Former Meta Researchers Launch Voice-Input Smart Ring: Former Meta Reality Labs and CTRL-Labs researchers launched Stream, a smart ring designed for voice input and gesture-based media control, aimed at capturing thoughts and supporting situational interactions. Stream features a capacitive touch sensor to start and stop recording, directional microphones for low-volume speech, and a companion app for transcription and query using AI models.

OpenAI Partners with AWS in $38 Billion Deal for Compute Capacity: OpenAI and Amazon Web Services (AWS) have established a strategic partnership with a $38 billion investment, providing OpenAI access to hundreds of thousands of NVIDIA GPUs via Amazon's EC2 UltraServers; this collaboration aims to significantly increase OpenAI's computational capabilities for AI workloads and infrastructure.

Microsoft Obtains License to Ship NVIDIA GPUs to UAE for Datacenter Expansion: Microsoft has secured a U.S. Commerce license allowing it to ship NVIDIA GPUs to the UAE, where it plans to invest $7.9 billion in datacenter infrastructure; this initiative is intended to expand Microsoft's AI capabilities and cloud services in the region.

NVIDIA and Dell Host NVFP4 Kernel Optimization Competition on Blackwell B200s: NVIDIA and Dell are sponsoring a 3-month competition for optimizing NVFP4 kernels on Blackwell B200 GPUs, offering prizes including DGX Spark and RTX 50XX GPUs, with a grand prize of a Dell Pro Max workstation equipped with a GB300 GPU; the competition focuses on optimizing kernels for tasks like Batched GEMV and GEMM.

Alibaba Releases Qwen3-Max-Thinking In-Training Checkpoint: Alibaba has unveiled an in-training checkpoint of its Qwen3-Max-Thinking model, which achieves 100% accuracy on the AIME 2025 and HMMT evaluations through tool use and test-time compute; the model is accessible through Qwen Chat and the Alibaba Cloud API, showcasing enhanced reasoning capabilities via 'thinking' checkpoints and scaffolding.

MiniMax M2 Tops Open WebDev Leaderboard: MiniMax has launched the MiniMax-M2, a 230B MoE (10B active) MIT-licensed model that has achieved the #1 ranking among open models on the Arena WebDev leaderboard; it ties for overall #4 with Claude Sonnet 4.5 Thinking 32k, demonstrating strong coding and reasoning skills.

Amazon's Chronos-2 Aims for Zero-Shot Forecasting: Amazon has announced Chronos-2, a time-series foundation model designed for zero-shot forecasting across various regimes, including univariate, multivariate, and covariate-informed scenarios; this model aims to provide improved accuracy and efficiency in time-series predictions without requiring extensive training data.

Perplexity's Comet Adds Granular Assistant Settings: Perplexity has updated Comet with enhanced Assistant settings, including local credential storage and third-party tracker blocking, along with a new transparency widget; these features focus on improving user privacy and control over their data within the Perplexity AI assistant.

VS Code Insiders Integrates OpenAI Codex with Copilot Pro+: Microsoft's VS Code Insiders now supports OpenAI Codex integration for users with Copilot Pro+ subscriptions, enhancing coding assistance within the IDE; this integration aims to provide developers with more advanced AI-powered coding suggestions and support.

OpenAI Introduces a $38 Billion Deal with AWS: OpenAI just signed a $38 billion agreement with AWS, adding Amazon to its roster of cloud partners. Big Tech is on track to spend $400B on AI in 2026 alone, buying GPUs like they're going out of style.

OpenAI introduces Company Knowledge: OpenAI launched a new feature called Company Knowledge. OpenAI also opened a private beta for AardVark, an agent that finds and fixes security bugs.

Wharton Study Shows Strong AI ROI for Large US Firms: According to a Wharton Business School study, 75% of large US firms are already seeing a return on their AI investments, with roughly two-thirds spending over $5 million annually on generative AI. Over 10% of these firms allocate $20 million or more, suggesting a conservative floor of $66 billion in annual genAI spending among comparable American firms, and 88% of respondents expect to increase spending.

OpenAI Pursues Trillion-Dollar Infrastructure Push with Platform Strategy: OpenAI is shifting towards building an AI platform to meet its infrastructure demands, which include commitments to approximately 30 GW of compute, estimated at $1.4 trillion, and plans to add 1 GW per week.  The company aims to evolve beyond a super-assistant inside ChatGPT and allow others to build on its platform, likely via APIs, to better integrate AI into various applications.

MiniMax Releases M2 Model Under MIT License: MiniMax, a Chinese AI company, has released M2, a mixture-of-experts model with 230 billion parameters (10 billion active per inference), under an MIT license. This model is designed for reliability and coding performance, offering comparable results to proprietary systems at a lower cost, positioning MiniMax as a counterweight to closed AI labs.

Harvey Raises $150 Million, Valuation Reaches $8 Billion: Harvey, a legal AI platform, secured $150 million in funding at an $8 billion valuation, demonstrating the increasing value of deep domain integration in AI. The platform's success stems from embedding AI throughout the legal workflow, including drafting, review, and compliance, making workflow intimacy and regulatory trust its competitive advantage.

Mercor's Valuation Surges to $10 Billion Following $350 Million Series C: Mercor, an AI engineering labor marketplace, increased its valuation to $10 billion after a $350 million Series C funding round. The company's network-driven approach matches vetted developers to autonomous and enterprise AI projects, reflecting investor confidence in the growing demand for human expertise in the AI economy.

LayerLens Releases Public AI Benchmarking Platform: LayerLens has launched a free, public version of its AI benchmarking and evaluation platform, which includes hundreds of models and benchmarks. This platform enables users to compare AI systems side-by-side, access prompt-by-prompt evaluation results, and explore detailed analytics of model behavior, aiming to foster empirical rigor and reproducibility in the AI industry.

Airbnb Transforms into an 'AI-First Application' with AI Customer Service Agent: Airbnb's CEO Brian Chesky announced the company's transformation into an 'AI-first application,' starting with a customer service agent trained on thousands of actual customer conversations using 13 different models. The AI agent, rolled out to half of US customers in April 2025, resulted in a 15% reduction in guests needing human support and is planned for expansion to other languages and trip planning capabilities.

Grammarly Rebrands to Superhuman, Launches AI Assistant: Grammarly is rebranding itself as 'Superhuman' following its acquisition of the email client company and launching 'Superhuman Go,' an AI assistant integrated into Grammarly that connects with Jira, Gmail, Google Drive, and Calendar. The company is bundling its products with acquired companies (Coda, Superhuman) at $33/month for Business plans to compete with Notion, ClickUp, and Google Workspace.

NVIDIA Announces AI Infrastructure Partnerships and Product Updates: NVIDIA announced multiple partnerships and product updates at GTC Washington, positioning itself as a core component of US AI infrastructure. These include partnerships with the Department of Energy to build seven new supercomputers with 100,000 Blackwell GPUs and integrating CUDA-X libraries into Palantir Ontology to accelerate decision-making across defense and intelligence operations.

Adobe Launches Personalized AI Creation Tools: Adobe introduced several AI updates at Adobe MAX 2025, including Firefly Custom Models, enabling creators to train personalized AI models on their visual styles, and conversational creation features integrating ChatGPT into Adobe Express. Additionally, Project Moonlight coordinates AI capabilities across Adobe apps, providing personalized content recommendations and performance analysis.

Poolside Raises $1B at $12B Valuation: Poolside has secured $1 billion in funding, elevating its valuation to $12 billion, indicating strong investor confidence in the company's AI initiatives and future growth potential.

Eric Zelikman Raises $1B After Leaving Xai: Eric Zelikman, formerly of Xai, has secured $1 billion in funding after leaving the company, highlighting significant investor interest in his future AI projects and endeavors.

Weavy Joins Figma: Weavy, a collaborative software company, has been acquired by Figma, suggesting that Figma aims to enhance its platform with Weavy's technology to improve real-time collaboration and user engagement.

Grammarly Rebrands to Superhuman and Adds AI Assistant: Grammarly has rebranded its parent company to Superhuman following its acquisition of the email client with the same name, and is launching 'Superhuman Go', an AI assistant built into the Grammarly extension to draft emails, schedule meetings, and log tickets using integrated tools.

Nvidia Expands AI Partnerships in South Korea with Key Tech Leaders: Nvidia is collaborating with Samsung to create an AI Megafactory for robotics and semiconductor development, while Hyundai is partnering on autonomous systems, and SK Group and Naver are developing AI clouds, involving a deployment of 260,000 Nvidia GPUs across South Korea.

OpenAI Agent Mode Enables ChatGPT to Research, Plan, and Execute Tasks: OpenAI has introduced 'Agent Mode' to ChatGPT, enabling it to conduct research, develop plans, and accomplish tasks autonomously; this feature is available for Plus, Pro, and Business subscribers, marking a step towards more capable and independent AI task completion.

LangChain Releases Deep Agents CLI and Agent Builder: LangChain has launched Deep Agents CLI, offering an agent harness with memory, and Agent Builder in LangSmith to accelerate long-horizon, tool-using agents, both designed to ease the development of sophisticated AI agents.

Moonshot AI Releases Terminal-Native Kimi CLI and 'Kimi For Coding': Moonshot AI has released Kimi CLI (Technical Preview), a terminal assistant integrating with Zsh, supporting MCP and the Agent Client Protocol, and 'Kimi For Coding', aiming to provide developers with an opinionated coding agent.

Bluwave Raises $14M to Expand AI-Driven Market Network: Bluwave received $14M to advance its AI-driven market network for private equity, improving connections between firms and providers.

FrontlineIQ Secures $3.3M for AI Coaching Platform: FrontlineIQ secured $3.3M in seed funding to build an AI coaching platform to enhance the performance of in-person sales teams with personalized insights.

Hugging Face Releases Smol Training Playbook: Hugging Face launched the Smol Training Playbook, a comprehensive 200+ page guide detailing the entire pipeline for training large language models (LLMs), covering pre-training, post-training, and infrastructure. The playbook is designed to share insights on effective and ineffective strategies, providing practitioners with a detailed roadmap for LLM development and is available on Hugging Face's platform.

Moonshot AI Releases Kimi Linear Attention Model: Moonshot AI released Kimi Linear, featuring a modified Gated DeltaNet architecture, designed to support very large context sizes, potentially up to 1M tokens. Despite a lower benchmark score compared to Qwen3-30B-AB3, it used 25 times fewer tokens for training, demonstrating training efficiency.

OpenAI's Aardvark (GPT-5) Enters Private Beta as a Security Researcher: OpenAI is testing Aardvark, an 'agentic security researcher' powered by GPT-5, in a private beta program, designed to automatically scan code repositories for vulnerabilities, build threat models, and propose Codex-assisted patches. Aardvark is intended to reason about code like a human and can catch complex bugs and logic flaws, achieving a 92% detection rate in tests.

Cursor's Agentic Coding Tool Ships Faster Cloud Agents: Cursor has released faster and more reliable cloud agents, providing insights into internal usage patterns, and users are now occasionally finding the Composer-1 agent "thinking" in Chinese. This raises transparency questions about the base-model provenance being used by the company for cloud agents.

OpenAI Launches Sora Monetization: OpenAI's Sora now allows users to purchase additional generations, with plans to implement a wider 'Sora economy' featuring rightsholder-paid cameos. Due to GPU constraints, reductions in the free tier are likely in the future for the video generation platform.

Perplexity AI Launches Citation-First Patent Research Agent: Perplexity AI introduced 'Patents,' a free beta patent research agent utilizing citation data, along with 'Discover' and new finance features, such as politician holdings tracking. This new agent enhances patent research capabilities through natural language processing and direct access to patent databases.

Meta Investing Heavily in AI Infrastructure: Meta is significantly increasing its investment in AI infrastructure, projecting spending of $70-72 billion in 2025, a 93% increase from 2024. This substantial investment will compress its free cash flow as Meta aims to outbuild competitors in the AI space.

Adobe's Creative Suite Enhanced with AI, Focuses on 'Additive' Approach: Adobe is integrating AI into its creative suite, focusing on an 'additive' approach with new AI features designed to assist rather than replace creative professionals, automating tasks like renaming Photoshop layers. The company's strategy involves using partner models, building its own, and allowing users to train custom models, particularly for Firefly.

Google Scales AI across Math, Development, and XR: Google's DeepMind launched the AI for Math Initiative, combining Gemini Deep Think, AlphaEvolve, and AlphaProof to accelerate mathematical discovery, while AI Studio now features a prompt-to-app generator for multimodal apps. NotebookLM has also been upgraded to a 1M-token context window, enhancing its capabilities for literature review and strategy planning.

Microsoft 365 Copilot integrates virtual computer to browse and analyze: Microsoft's 365 Copilot’s new Researcher feature can now utilize a virtual computer to browse, code, and analyze data for users. This new feature expands the capabilities of the AI assistant by allowing it to explore the web and gated content to connect insights across hundreds of sites.

n8n Introduces AI Evaluation Features for AI Workflows: n8n offers light and metric-based evaluation modes for AI workflows, utilizing special nodes for running and recording evaluations. However, the built-in metrics lack support for agent-specific checks like tool parameters and call order, critical for AI agent evaluation, and metric-based evaluations are limited to one workflow in the free Community Edition, which forces users to calculate metrics manually.

ZenML's LLMOps Database Highlights the Importance of Simplicity in Production AI Systems: ZenML's LLMOps database, analyzing nearly a thousand real-world LLM and agent deployments, emphasizes that the most reliable AI systems prioritize simplicity and narrowly defined use cases over complex, multi-agent designs. Constraining agents to specific functions and incorporating human-in-the-loop verification are crucial for managing the unreliability of fully autonomous systems.

MiniMax AI Releases M2 Open-Source Model for Coding and Agents: MiniMax AI launched M2, a sparse MoE model with approximately 200-230B total parameters and 10B active parameters, designed for agent and code-native applications and priced at “8% of Claude Sonnet” with ~2x faster inference. M2 is temporarily free via API and is supported on platforms like vLLM, Hugging Face, ModelScope, Baseten, and Cline.

Zhipu AI's Glyph Compresses Long Text Using Visual Rendering: Zhipu AI developed Glyph, a method that compresses long text into images processed by VLMs, achieving 3-4x token compression without significant performance loss. Glyph turns long-context processing into a multimodal efficiency challenge, demonstrating that visual representations can effectively reduce token count in language models.

LangChain v1 Adds Agent Harnesses and Content Blocks: LangChain v1 introduces standard content blocks to unify provider integrations, a create_agent abstraction, and a clarified stack, including LangGraph for runtime, LangChain as the framework, and DeepAgents for agent harnesses. It also includes new free courses on agents, memory, tools, middleware, and context engineering patterns.

Anthropic Launches Claude for Excel with Real-Time Financial Data Connectors: Anthropic released Claude for Excel in beta, allowing users to work with the AI assistant directly within Microsoft Excel, including reading, analyzing, and modifying spreadsheets, and transparently tracking all changes. Claude for Excel integrates with seven data connectors for the financial industry, providing real-time and proprietary information sources like Aiera, LSEG, and Moody’s, and offers finance-specific Agent Skills.

beehiiv Raises Series A Funding After Addressing Email Deliverability Issues: beehiiv secured $12.5M in Series A funding led by Lightspeed Venture Partners, following a challenging period where email deliverability issues impacted key users. The funding will support beehiiv's growth strategy, including the acquisition of Swapstack, and the raise occurred within a week with no prepared deck. 

OpenAI Enhances ChatGPT's Handling of Sensitive Mental Health Conversations: OpenAI updated GPT-5 with improved handling of sensitive mental health conversations after consulting with over 170 clinicians, reducing inappropriate responses by 65-80% in tests. The improvements focus on areas like emotional reliance, mental health crisis responses, and recognition of self-harm intent, but the sheer scale of users discussing suicide with ChatGPT (over 1 million weekly) raises accountability concerns.

Qualcomm Enters Data Center AI Inference Market with New AI Chips: Qualcomm unveiled a new line of AI chips, AI200 and AI250, designed for data center AI inference, directly challenging Nvidia and AMD. The AI200, expected in 2026, is focused on high-performance AI inference, and Qualcomm announced a deal with Humain, a Saudi-backed AI company, as its first customer.

Meta Cuts 600 Roles in AI Research Division: Meta is cutting 600 roles in its AI research division, including some prominent names, despite recent efforts to recruit AI researchers with high salaries. This restructuring follows concerns about Meta AI falling behind in certain areas, indicating a strategic shift in Meta's AI efforts.

OpenAI Launches ChatGPT Atlas AI Browser: OpenAI has released ChatGPT Atlas, an AI-powered browser initially for macOS, available to Free, Plus, Pro, and Go users. Atlas features a built-in ChatGPT side panel for explaining, summarizing, and in-depth analysis of viewed content, also remembering browsing history for personalized responses, and includes an agent mode for task automation.

Nike Unveils Project Amplify Powered Exoskeleton: Nike has introduced Project Amplify, a powered exoskeleton designed to enhance running and walking performance. The system uses a motor and battery to assist the lower leg, reducing effort, and has undergone testing with over 400 athletes, showing potential to improve mile times.

Google and Anthropic Announce Multi-Billion Dollar Cloud Deal: Anthropic and Google have formed a cloud partnership worth tens of billions of dollars, providing Anthropic access to up to one million of Google's TPU chips. This deal aims to add over a gigawatt of AI computing capacity by 2026, supporting Anthropic’s multi-cloud strategy while optimizing performance and cost.

Alibaba Cloud Claims GPU Reduction with New Pooling System: Alibaba Cloud asserts its Aegaeon system can reduce the Nvidia GPUs needed for running large language models by up to 82% through fine-level GPU time sharing. Tests showed a reduction from 1,192 GPUs to 213, improving performance, but results may vary based on infrastructure integration.

Meta Slashes Jobs in AI Operations to Streamline Processes: Meta is cutting approximately 600 jobs within its older AI teams to accelerate decision-making and increase employee responsibility. The company is still investing in its newer TBD Lab, which is focused on more ambitious AI research and development, and will continue hiring for that division.

LangChain Valued at $1.25 Billion After Funding Round: LangChain, an open-source framework for AI agent development, has raised $125 million, achieving a valuation of $1.25 billion. The company evolved from simplifying work with early large language models to a comprehensive platform for building and managing AI agents.

DoorDash and Waymo Launch Autonomous Delivery Service in Phoenix: DoorDash is partnering with Waymo to pilot autonomous delivery services in Metro Phoenix, beginning with DashMart orders. DashPass members in select cities will also receive monthly discounts on Waymo rides, representing a step towards increased automation in local commerce.

OpenAI Developing Music Generator: OpenAI is reportedly developing a generative music model that can compose or enhance tracks from text or audio prompts. This model is being refined with the help of Juilliard students to improve musical structure and phrasing, potentially integrating into ChatGPT or Sora.

Apple Engineers Express Concerns Over Siri's Performance: Apple's AI division is facing internal challenges, including delays in Siri improvements and staff departures, raising concerns about their AI strategy. Key executives are leaving for competitors like Meta, and internal builds of iOS 26.4 show concerning Siri performance.

Crusoe Energy to IPO in 2026 Amidst AI Datacenter Boom: Crusoe Energy, an AI datacenter startup, is planning an IPO in early 2026 after raising $1.38 billion at a valuation of about $10 billion. The company, backed by Peter Thiel, is focused on providing AI infrastructure and calls itself the "AI Factory" company.

OpenAI Launches Atlas AI Browser: OpenAI has released Atlas, a web browser with ChatGPT natively integrated for Free, Plus, Pro, and Go users on macOS; the browser allows ChatGPT to understand webpage context and complete multi-step workflows such as online shopping and competitive research autonomously.

Microsoft's Copilot Fall Release Focuses on Personalization: Microsoft introduced its Copilot Fall Release featuring 12 new updates to make the AI assistant a personal companion, including 'Groups' for collaborative AI use and 'Imagine' for creative content remixing.  Copilot now provides personalized experiences through long-term memory, the 'Mico' visual character for voice interactions, and integrates with OneDrive, Gmail, Google Drive, and Outlook.

Anthropic Expands Claude's Memory Feature: Anthropic broadened the availability of its Memory feature for Claude to Pro and Max users, enabling the AI to remember details, preferences, and work patterns across ongoing conversations. Each project has separate memory spaces, and users can control memory saving and use Incognito mode, ensuring privacy.

Microsoft Rolls Out "Copilot Mode" in Edge Browser: Microsoft released "Copilot Mode" in its Edge browser, positioning it as an AI-powered browser capable of reading tabs, summarizing content, and executing actions like travel booking. This feature is designed to leverage AI to enhance browsing efficiency and task completion.

LangChain Achieves Unicorn Status: LangChain secured $125 million in funding, reaching a $1.25 billion valuation, to further develop its agent-engineering platform. The company's platform includes LangChain, LangGraph, and LangSmith, which are designed to facilitate the design, testing, observation, and deployment of AI agents.

Sesame Unveils Conversational AI Smart Glasses Experience: Sesame, a company founded by Oculus co-founders, raised $250 million and launched a limited beta for its smart glasses experience powered by conversational AI. The company aims to provide a new way for users to interact with AI in an augmented reality setting.

Serval Secures Funding for AI-Driven IT Service Management: Serval received $47 million in funding to embed AI agents into IT service management processes and automate help-desk workflows. The company's technology aims to improve efficiency and response times in IT support operations.

Nexos.ai Raises Funds for Enterprise AI Model Access: Nexos.ai obtained €30 million in funding, co-led by Index Ventures, to offer secure and governed access to various AI models for enterprise clients. The company focuses on providing a safe and compliant environment for businesses to utilize AI technologies.

Netflix Uses AI to Personalize User Experience and Greenlight Content: Netflix personalizes the homepage for each user using AI, including unique thumbnails, resulting in a 30% increase in CTRs and $1 billion in annual savings from reduced churn. Furthermore, Netflix uses data-driven insights to greenlight scripts, such as Squid Game and Stranger Things, and also integrates AI in production for tasks such as generating VFX scenes and de-aging characters.

Monologue's Local Model Significantly Increases Audio Processing Speed: Monologue has updated its local model to process an hour of audio in under a second, simplifying the experience by removing model size options. The updated local model supports 25 languages, cutting transcription latency by over half compared to early October.

vLLM Supports NVIDIA Nemotron for Faster Inference: vLLM announced first-class support for NVIDIA's Nemotron family, including the Nemotron Nano 2 model, which boasts a hybrid Transformer-Mamba design and open weights. Using vLLM, Nano 2 generates 'thinking' tokens significantly faster than comparable models due to its tunable 'thinking budget', and also enables OCR models fast deployments.

Mistral AI Launches Studio for Production AI Agents: Mistral AI introduced its production platform, Mistral AI Studio, providing a runtime environment for AI agents and comprehensive observability tools across the entire lifecycle of agent development. This launch aims to streamline the transition from AI experimentation to robust production deployment for their language models.

Baseten Achieves High Throughput with GPT-OSS 120B: Baseten reported improved performance for GPT-OSS 120B running on NVIDIA hardware, achieving 650 tokens per second (TPS) with a 0.11s time to first token (TTFT) and 99.99% uptime. This represents an increase from the initial launch performance of 450 TPS, showcasing optimization efforts for serving open-source language models.

GitHub Copilot Improves Code Search with New Embedding Model: GitHub launched a new Copilot embedding model for VS Code that enhances code search capabilities, achieving a 37.6% improvement in retrieval accuracy. The new model also offers approximately 2x higher throughput and an 8x smaller index size, improving overall search performance and efficiency for developers.

OpenAI's ChatGPT Atlas Now Features Persistent User Memory: OpenAI has updated ChatGPT Atlas to include persistent browsing and task history as user memory, allowing for improved context retention and more efficient tab management. This enhancement aims to provide a more seamless and personalized experience for users by retaining information across multiple interactions.

MiniMax M2 Model Competes with Top-Tier Models: MiniMax's M2 model is showing promising performance, with early tests suggesting it is competitive with leading Chinese models and comparable to Sonnet 4.5. The M2 is positioned for agent and coding tasks with low latency and cost, making it suitable for a range of applications and gaining positive reviews for its performance.

Microsoft Copilot Gains New Avatar, Memory, and Collaboration Features: Microsoft's latest Copilot update includes 'Mico', a visual avatar, group session capabilities for up to 32 users, a 'Real Talk' mode for more conversational interactions, and long-term memory for remembering preferences. These enhancements aim to transform Copilot into a more versatile and integrated workspace assistant.

Anthropic Adds Persistent Memory to Claude: Anthropic has introduced persistent memory to Claude, enabling the AI assistant to retain details across multiple chats and provide more consistent and personalized responses. This memory upgrade is available to all subscribers, enhancing Claude's ability to understand and assist users over extended conversations.

Meta Reorganizes AI Division Focusing on TBD Lab for Foundation Models: Meta is restructuring its AI division, reducing roles in legacy FAIR and infrastructure teams while prioritizing its TBD Lab, led by Alexandr Wang, which focuses on building next-generation foundation models and agent systems. The reorganization aims for smaller, faster execution from teams operating like startups within the company.

Starcloud to Deploy AI Data Centers in Space: Starcloud is preparing to launch AI data centers into orbit using NVIDIA H100 GPUs and solar-powered systems, planning to use Google's Gemma LLM in orbit. Starcloud-1, the first satellite, is expected to be significantly more powerful than any prior space-based operation and aims to solve energy, cooling, and data latency bottlenecks for AI infrastructure.

Descript Introduces Custom Tool for Sharing Terminal Sessions: Descript user created a tool to reduce friction in converting terminal sessions into shareable HTML files. The tool, built using Claude Code for web, converts rich text formatted terminal output into HTML and uploads it to GitHub Gist for sharing.

Anthropic's Claude Code Deletes Session Logs After 30 Days by Default: Claude Code by default deletes user session logs, stored as newline-delimited JSON files, after 30 days, which has been identified as an undesirable behavior. Users can modify the cleanup period in the settings.json file to delay the deletion for up to 274 years.

Claude Code Develops SLOCCount in WebAssembly: Claude Code assisted in building sloccount.html, a web UI for running the Perl SLOCCount tool against code. Initially Claude attempted a reimplementation in Javascript, but the final version uses WebPerl and compiles C utilities to WebAssembly to incorporate them into the project.

OpenAI Launches 'Company Knowledge' for ChatGPT: OpenAI has launched 'Company Knowledge' for ChatGPT, enabling users to pull and synthesize data from various sources such as Slack, Google Drive, and GitHub. This feature, built on a GPT-5 variant, aims to deliver context-aware insights and is equipped with enterprise controls like role-based access and audit logs.

OpenAI Acquires Software Applications Incorporated: OpenAI acquired Software Applications Incorporated, the creator of Sky, a Mac automation tool that interprets screen content and acts across applications. OpenAI plans to integrate Sky into ChatGPT to offer advanced system-level tasks for macOS users, positioning the company ahead of Apple's Siri overhaul.

OpenAI, Oracle, and Vantage Collaborate on Lighthouse AI Campus: OpenAI, Oracle, and Vantage are collaborating to construct the Lighthouse AI campus in Wisconsin as part of the Stargate initiative, investing $15 billion in the project. This campus will supply 4.5 gigawatts of IT capacity to power ChatGPT, Copilot, and other AI workloads.

Microsoft's Copilot Gets Major Update: Microsoft released a major update to Copilot, positioning it as a unified automation layer across Edge, Windows, and productivity apps. The update includes Copilot Mode in Edge, providing the AI with access to open tabs, and an animated companion named Mico.

Anthropic Introduces Claude Memory and Secures Compute Deal with Google: Anthropic has rolled out Claude Memory for Pro and Max subscribers, which allows the chatbot to retain context across conversations, and has signed a multi-billion dollar deal with Google for access to up to one million Tensor Processing Units (TPUs). The Claude Memory feature provides project-specific memory to prevent data crossover and control over stored information.

Netflix Embraces Generative AI in Film Production: Netflix is increasing its use of generative AI in film production, using it for tasks such as collapsing buildings, de-aging actors, and designing sets. CEO Ted Sarandos frames AI as a tool to enhance artistic capabilities and streamline content creation processes.

Google AI Studio Upgrades to Vibe-Coding Web App Builder: Google AI Studio has been upgraded with a revamped Build interface, allowing users to create live web apps using Gemini 2.5 Pro, and requiring no coding skills. The upgrade includes generating code, design, and deployment setups instantly, with optional premium add-ons like Cloud Run hosting.

OpenAI Launches Atlas Browser with ChatGPT Integration: OpenAI released Atlas, a web browser for macOS with ChatGPT deeply integrated, enabling the AI assistant to directly access and act upon webpage content. Atlas aims to streamline tasks like research, summarization, and automated website actions, but initial limitations include single-tab agent mode and slower task delegation.

Adobe Introduces AI Foundry for Custom Generative AI Models: Adobe launched AI Foundry, a service allowing enterprises to build custom generative AI models using their own brand assets, internal data, and creative IP, built on Adobe’s Firefly models. This service aims to provide companies with brand-specific creative models capable of handling text, image, video, and 3D content, with usage-based pricing instead of per-seat fees.

Meta Streamlines AI Unit with Layoffs: Meta reduced its workforce in the Superintelligence Labs by 600 employees as part of a reorganization effort to streamline operations and enhance individual impact after substantial investments in AI talent.  The company seeks to reduce bureaucracy within its AI division while continuing to pursue advanced AI research and development.

IBM and Groq Partner to Enhance AI Inference Speed: IBM and Groq are collaborating to offer high-speed, low-latency AI inference solutions for enterprise clients, facilitating faster and more cost-effective AI deployments at scale. This partnership aims to address the infrastructure requirements for real-time AI workloads within large organizations by leveraging Groq's specialized AI accelerator architecture.

Ant Group Releases Ling-1T, a High-Performing Non-Reasoning AI Model: Ant Group, an affiliate of Alibaba, launched Ling-1T, a trillion-parameter, open-weight, non-reasoning AI model that outperforms leading non-reasoning models on various benchmarks, including reasoning, math, coding, and general knowledge. Ling-1T emphasizes chain-of-thought reasoning during pretraining and fine-tuning, enabling selective reasoning based on the input.

Pynt Identifies Security Risks in Model Context Protocol (MCP) Servers: Pynt, an API security firm, identified significant security vulnerabilities in Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers, revealing that the dynamic design of MCP can lead to exploitation, with 72% of tested servers exposing sensitive capabilities to attackers.  The study emphasizes that risk compounds with the number of MCP servers used in a system, necessitating careful security measures, including limiting server capabilities and testing data transfers.

California Passes AI Regulatory Bills: California enacted four AI regulatory bills, including SB 53, requiring large AI developers to disclose safety protocols and SB 243, regulating chatbots interacting with minors. Other laws address liability for AI actions and mandate labeling of AI-generated media, creating a comprehensive AI regulatory framework within the state.

GEPA Algorithm Improves Agent Prompts for Enhanced Performance: UC Berkeley, Stanford, BespokeLabs.ai, Notre Dame, Databricks, and MIT developed GEPA, an algorithm that enhances the performance of AI agents by iteratively improving their prompts, offering an efficient alternative to reinforcement learning for fine-tuning large language models. GEPA analyzes an agent's behavior, identifies associations between prompts and outcomes, and composes more effective prompts to guide the model efficiently.

Amazon Introduces AI-Powered Smart Glasses for Delivery Drivers: Amazon is developing AI-powered smart glasses for its delivery drivers to enhance efficiency and safety by scanning packages, providing walking directions, capturing proof of delivery, and detecting hazards, completely hands-free. Future upgrades will include real-time defect detection, pet detection, and automatic adjustments for low-light conditions, with trials underway in North America.

Alibaba Announces Quark AI Glasses with Qwen Integration: Alibaba unveiled its Quark AI Glasses, powered by its Qwen large language model, supporting hands-free calling, music streaming, real-time language translation, and integration with Alibaba's new AI Chat Assistant.  These glasses are aimed at consumers, marking Alibaba's entry into the wearable AI market with a focus on direct competition with ChatGPT through its chat capabilities.

Anthropic Launches Claude Code for Web: Anthropic introduced Claude Code for Web, an asynchronous coding agent similar to OpenAI's Codex Cloud and Google's Jules, enabling users to point it to a GitHub repository, select an environment, and provide prompts for coding tasks. After completion, it opens a branch on the repo with the changes and can optionally open a pull request, providing a convenient hosted container for coding tasks managed by Anthropic.

DeepSeek-OCR Runs on NVIDIA Spark with Claude Code Assistance: DeepSeek released DeepSeek-OCR, a 6.6GB model for OCR, and Claude Code was used to get it running on an NVIDIA Spark by automating the configuration and troubleshooting process. This involved setting up a Docker container, installing necessary dependencies, and running the model against a sample image, showcasing the ability of Claude Code to solve complex hardware and software compatibility issues.

OpenAI Launches ChatGPT Atlas Browser with Agent Mode and Browser Memories: OpenAI launched ChatGPT Atlas, a Mac-only web browser that deeply integrates ChatGPT, including a chat panel populated with page context and a 'browser memories' feature to improve chat responses. Atlas also features an experimental 'agent mode' where ChatGPT can navigate and interact with web pages, intended to complete end-to-end tasks like researching meal plans and making online purchases, with efforts to maintain user control and data privacy.

LangChain Raises $125M Series B and Releases Agent Engineering Stack: LangChain secured $125M in Series B funding, valuing the company at $1.25B, and launched version 1.0 of its LangChain and LangGraph platforms, a LangSmith insights agent, and a no-code agent builder. These releases emphasize production-first agent runtime and observability, along with a new createAgent abstraction and middleware in LangChainJS, aimed at providing controlled and reliable agent development and deployment.

Alibaba Releases Qwen3-VL Multimodal Models: Alibaba released Qwen3-VL-2B and Qwen3-VL-32B, dense vision language models (VLMs) with FP8 variants and “Thinking”/Instruct types, claiming strong performance against GPT‑5 mini and Claude Sonnet 4. These models aim to match larger models on tasks such as OSWorld while maintaining high memory efficiency, and demos were quickly made available on Hugging Face.

OpenRouter SDK Released for Simplifying Multi-Model App Development: OpenRouter released a TypeScript SDK (beta) with fully typed requests/responses for over 300 models, built-in OAuth, and support for all API paths, aiming to streamline multi-model app development and authentication. The company plans to release SDKs in Python, Java, and Go soon.

Krea Realtime Releases Open-Source Text-to-Video Model: Krea Realtime released a 14B parameter open-source autoregressive text-to-video model distilled from Wan 2.1, generating long-form video at approximately 11 frames per second on a single NVIDIA B200. The weights are released under the Apache-2.0 license on Hugging Face, facilitating community experimentation and fine-tuning.

DeepSeek-OCR Released as Open-Source Toolkit: DeepSeek AI released DeepSeek-OCR on GitHub, providing an open-source OCR toolkit with a modern VLM-friendly design and multilingual support, aiming to enhance OCR capabilities. Developers contrasted it with existing OCR stacks and highlighted the importance of contextual understanding for scripts like Kanji.

HubSpot Unveils Guide on AI-Powered Income Ideas: HubSpot launched "200+ AI-Powered Income Ideas," a guide that presents opportunities for generating revenue using AI across content creation, e-commerce, gaming, and emerging digital markets. The guide includes implementation guides, which are designed for beginners and aligned with market trends.

Fal.ai Valued at Over $4B After Raising $250M: Fal.ai, a multimodal AI infrastructure provider, raised over $250 million and reached a valuation exceeding $4 billion, supported by investments from Sequoia and Kleiner Perkins. The company supports millions of developers and clients such as Adobe with GPU-efficient cloud infrastructure.

GPT-5 Allegedly Crawled the Web for Erdős Problem Solutions: OpenAI's GPT-5, according to Sebastien Bubeck, reportedly found solutions to several unsolved Erdős problems; however, the system merely crawled the web for already-solved problems instead of discovering original solutions, causing widespread criticism within the math and AI communities. Sir Demis Hassabis called the incident 'embarrassing', and Bubeck later deleted the initial tweet and claimed misunderstanding, which was widely disbelieved.

DeepSeek-OCR Achieves High OCR Accuracy with Efficient Compression: DeepSeek unveiled DeepSeek-OCR, a vision-language OCR model that compresses text as visual context, achieving ~97% decoding precision at <10x compression and ~60% at 20x compression. The model can process approximately 200,000 pages per day on a single A100-40G GPU and around 33 million pages daily using 20 nodes each with 8 A100-40G GPUs, outperforming other OCR models on OmniDocBench while using fewer vision tokens and rendering complex layouts into HTML.

Google DeepMind's Veo 3.1 Leads in Video Generation: Google DeepMind's Veo 3.1 has become the top-rated model on the Video Arena leaderboards for both text-to-video and image-to-video tasks. The model surpassed previous leaders in physics/realism and incorporates precision editing features that allow users to add or remove elements with consistent lighting and scene interactions.

Krea Releases Open-Source Realtime Video Generation Model: Krea AI released “Realtime,” a 14B autoregressive video model under the Apache 2.0 license capable of generating long-form video at ~11 FPS on a single B200 GPU. The weights and a report are available on Hugging Face, enabling rapid workflow prototyping and benchmarking against closed models.

Anthropic Launches Claude Code on Web and iOS with Enhanced Security: Anthropic introduced Claude Code on the web and iOS, executing tasks in cloud VMs with chat loop integration.  The new sandbox mode in the CLI reduces permission prompts by 84% by scoping filesystem and network access, open-sourcing the sandbox for general agent builders, enhancing agent security and ease of use.

Cline Offers Enterprise-Grade Agent Operations with BYOI: Cline announced an enterprise version that operates in VS Code, JetBrains, and CLI and supports multiple models such as Claude, GPT, Gemini, and DeepSeek across Bedrock, Vertex, Azure, and OpenAI. This approach of "bring your own inference" (BYOI) aids during cloud outages, and IBM and Groq are pairing watsonx agents with Groq LPU inference for faster speeds and lower costs.

Unitree Robotics Unveils Advanced Humanoid Robot H2: Unitree Robotics introduced the Unitree H2, showcasing advanced movement capabilities and fluid motions, indicating significant progress in China's robotics expertise. The H2 model reflects a focus on enhancing practical applications with improvements in agility and functionality, although some users express a desire for more utility-focused features.

Anthropic Introduces Agent Skills for Claude: Anthropic's Claude is now equipped with Agent Skills, designed to convert knowledge into automated workflows where processes are captured once and applied automatically. This new offering, available on all paid plans, enables Claude to perform specialized tasks such as financial modeling by pulling SEC data, building projections, and creating integrated models.

beehiiv Implements Cooldown Periods to Improve Platform Stability: beehiiv, a newsletter platform, shifted from two-week engineering sprints to a three-week sprint followed by a one-week cooldown period to prioritize bug fixes, performance, and quality of life improvements. This move resulted in fewer platform issues, reduced support tickets, and improved customer satisfaction and has led to employees utilizing the platform and providing valuable feedback.

OpenAI Plans to Offer 'Sign in with ChatGPT' Option: OpenAI is planning a “Sign in with ChatGPT” option, pitching it to other companies, allowing their users to use their ChatGPT quota to access AI features on the company's tools. This is a strategy to broaden ChatGPT's integration and accessibility across various platforms.

ZenML ML Engineer Discusses AI Tool Failures in Production: Alex Strick van Linschoten, an ML Engineer at ZenML, discussed the reliability cliff of AI agents and what happens when AI tools fail in production, drawing insights from 900+ documented LLM and AI enterprise deployments in ZenML's LLMOps database. The discussion encourages contributing to the LLMOps database to document real-world AI deployments.

Kentro Tech and OKIGU Offer Workshop on AI-Generated Code: Isaac Flath (Kentro Tech, ex-Answer.AI) and Eleanor Berger (OKIGU, ex-Microsoft, ex-Google) are hosting a workshop to teach developers how to break complex problems into smaller tasks, provide clear context to AI tools for better code results, and systematically review AI-generated code before integrating it into projects.

Salesforce's AI Infrastructure Team Contributes to AI System Evaluation: Stefan Krawczyk from Salesforce's AI Infrastructure team co-authored an essay on Decoding AI about Evaluation-Driven Development for AI Systems, focusing on how to escape Proof-of-Concept purgatory.

Manus Develops AI Agents for Conversation Data Summarization: Ivan Leo, an ML Engineer at Manus, will host a session detailing methods for summarizing LLM and agentic conversation data at scale, embedding and clustering conversations to identify recurring patterns, and building classifiers and feedback loops for continuous improvement in AI agents.

NVIDIA Invests $5B in Intel, Co-Developing AI Systems: NVIDIA is making a $5B equity investment in Intel to co-develop x86 CPU + NVIDIA GPU tile systems for rack-scale AI infrastructure and new AI PC SoCs, which broadens CPU compatibility for NVIDIA's rack systems and allows them to capture more of the AI PC market.

Kepler Robotics Begins Mass Production of Humanoid Robots: Kepler Robotics has announced the mass production of its Kepler A40 Hybrid, a humanoid robot using a combined electric-hydraulic architecture, priced around $25,000 to $30,000, representing a large-scale humanoid robot manufacturing effort in China.

Figure AI Unveils Integrated Humanoid Robot for Mass Manufacturing: Figure AI unveiled Figure 03, a fully-integrated humanoid robot designed for mass manufacturing and built on a joint AI system with OpenAI, combining visual perception, reasoning, and manipulation with plans to begin commercial deployment in logistics and manufacturing next year.

Baidu Deploys Kunlun P800 Cluster for LLM Training: Baidu deployed a 30,000-card Kunlun P800 cluster, becoming the first Chinese company operating domestic AI accelerators at hyperscale for LLM training, plus Baidu’s Intelligent Cloud won a 1 billion yuan China Mobile contract for AI inference servers utilizing Kunlun chips.

Poolside Plans 2GW AI Campus in Texas with CoreWeave: AI startup Poolside announced plans to build a 2 Gigawatt AI training campus in West Texas, beginning with a 250MW cluster built with CoreWeave, containing 40,000 NVIDIA GB300 GPUs.

Exo Labs Builds Frankencluster with DGX Spark and Mac Studio: Exo Labs has constructed a 'frankencluster' using an NVIDIA DGX Spark and an Apple Mac Studio, implementing software that distributes computational tasks to each machine based on their strengths, yielding a 2.8X speedup over a Mac Studio baseline for LLM inference.

Meta and Blue Owl Partner for Data Center Construction: Meta is partnering with Blue Owl in a private-capital deal, estimated at nearly $30 billion, to build a hyperscale data center. Meta will retain a 20% ownership stake, offloading the remaining ownership to Blue Owl, aiming to expand its AI infrastructure.

Anthropic Launches Agent Skills for Claude: Anthropic introduced Agent Skills, a new feature that enables Claude to access specialized instructions, scripts, and resources for specific tasks. This allows for modularized expertise that can be loaded on demand, improving performance and enabling specialized capabilities like Excel manipulation or brand guideline adherence across Claude's products.

Google DeepMind Releases Veo 3.1 with Enhanced Video Generation: Google DeepMind launched Veo 3.1, enhancing its AI-powered video creation tool with improved audio, more realistic visuals, and greater creative control. The new version allows users to combine text prompts with reference images and define start and end frames for more directable and continuous video sequences.

Alibaba Qwen Releases Qwen3-VL Models: Alibaba Qwen released Qwen3-VL 4B and 8B, two small models optimized for reasoning and instruction following. The models provide improved capabilities for visual understanding tasks.

Oracle Announces Comprehensive AI Infrastructure and Platform Strategy: Oracle announced a comprehensive AI strategy, highlighting its OCI Zettascale10 infrastructure connecting up to 800,000 NVIDIA GPUs, AI Database 26ai integrating AI directly into the database core, and pre-built AI agents embedded in Oracle Fusion Applications. This positions Oracle as building vertically across infrastructure, platform, and applications in the AI stack.

WorkOS Launches AuthKit Authentication Platform: WorkOS released AuthKit, a complete authentication platform, to handle everything from basic login to enterprise SSO without integrating multiple systems. AuthKit includes a hosted UI, enterprise authentication support, roles and permissions, radar for fraud protection, custom metadata, and Connect for application integrations, aiming to simplify authentication for growing SaaS companies.

Every Studio Launches Spiral, an AI Writer: Every Studio launched Spiral, a reimagined AI writing tool that learns a user's style through interviews and helps draft content in formats from X posts to essays. Spiral focuses on delivering high-quality AI outputs tailored to individual user preferences.

Every's Cora Upgrades to Anthropic's Haiku 4.5 Model: Every's inbox assistant, Cora, has been upgraded to Anthropic's new Haiku 4.5 model, resulting in a 44% faster response time while maintaining accuracy. The upgrade provides quicker and more efficient assistance to Cora users, improving their email management experience.

Sparkle Adds Content-Based Organization Feature: Sparkle introduced a new feature that organizes files based on their content, not just by name or date. Users can now instruct Sparkle to gather files related to a specific topic, and it will scan filenames and document contents to create a dedicated folder, enhancing file management capabilities.

Monologue Launches Teams and Improves Transcription Latency: Monologue, a dictation tool, launched team accounts with self-serve onboarding capabilities and reduced transcription latency for audio over 60 seconds by 50 percent. It also expanded its recording limit to 1.5 hours and transcribes them in just 15 seconds, providing users with faster and more streamlined transcription services.

Anthropic Introduces Claude Skills for Enhanced Model Abilities: Anthropic has released Claude Skills, a new system allowing users to enhance Claude's performance on specific tasks by loading instructions, scripts, and resources. Skills are stored in folders and accessed when relevant, improving Claude's capabilities in specialized areas such as Excel and brand guideline adherence, with examples like document creation now available in Anthropic's repository.

Anthropic Launches Claude Haiku 4.5: Anthropic unveiled Claude Haiku 4.5, a smaller and more affordable AI model in the Claude 4.x series, available to all users including those on the free tier. Haiku 4.5 is designed to be fast and perform well, even outperforming older, larger models on certain tasks, particularly in coding where it matches Claude Sonnet 4 and OpenAI's GPT-5 on bug fixing.

Google's AI Model Generates Validated Cancer Therapy Hypothesis: Google DeepMind's AI model, C2S-Scale 27B, developed in collaboration with Yale, has generated a novel hypothesis regarding cancer cellular behavior that has been experimentally validated in living cells. The model identified a method to transform 'cold' tumors, which are resistant to treatment, into 'hot' tumors responsive to immunotherapy, resulting in a roughly 50% increase in antigen presentation in lab tests.

OpenAI Partners with Broadcom and AMD for Custom AI Chips: OpenAI has partnered with Broadcom to co-design and deploy custom AI accelerators, with the aim of reducing reliance on Nvidia and AMD and achieving major efficiency gains for OpenAI's workloads. The systems, integrating compute, memory, and networking on Broadcom's Ethernet stack, are slated for deployment in late 2026, and AMD granted 160 million shares to support OpenAI’s buildout.

OpenAI's DevDay 2025 Introduces Apps, AgentKit, and More Powerful Models: OpenAI's DevDay 2025 introduced Apps inside ChatGPT, a preview Apps SDK, and AgentKit, re-framing ChatGPT as an app platform and agent OS. Apps run directly in ChatGPT with interactive UIs and actions via the Model Context Protocol (MCP), while new API models include GPT-5 Pro and Sora 2 video, alongside the announcement of 800 million weekly active ChatGPT users.

Google Releases Veo 3.1 with Enhanced Video Generation Capabilities: Google has launched Veo 3.1, an upgraded version of its Veo 3 video generation model, which focuses on improved visual fidelity, stronger prompt adherence, and richer editing controls, with an improvement to image-to-video quality and the introduction of better audio output. This new model, which also offers granular edits and object manipulation, is now available in Flow, the Gemini app, and via Vertex and Gemini APIs.

Microsoft Launches 'Vibe Working' in Excel and Word with Agent Mode: Microsoft has launched 'Agent Mode' in Excel and Word, powered by OpenAI's GPT-5 and an Anthropic-powered Office Agent in Copilot chat, which enables users to generate, plan, and execute complex spreadsheets, documents, and slide decks from simple prompts. The new mode aims to automate complex office tasks using AI agents integrated directly into Microsoft Office applications.

Anthropic Releases Petri, an Open-Source Framework for AI Auditing: Anthropic has released Petri, an open-source framework for automated auditing designed to use AI agents to test the behaviors of target models across diverse scenarios. Petri automates large-scale alignment audits, orchestrating an auditor agent to run multi-turn probes, synthesize realistic environments and tools, and use an LLM judge to score transcripts.

Anthropic Introduces Claude Skills for Workplace Task Automation: Anthropic introduced 'Skills,' enabling organizations to create and share reusable sets of instructions, scripts, and resources that teach Claude to perform specific workplace tasks. These Skills can be integrated across Claude.ai, Claude Code, the API, and the Claude Agent SDK, allowing for customized workplace automation.

Zoox Launches Robotaxi Service in Las Vegas: Amazon's Zoox has launched a free robotaxi service in a mapped, geofenced area along the Las Vegas Strip, accessible via a phone app. Early rider reports have been primarily positive, with no accidents reported, marking a step forward in the deployment of autonomous vehicle technology for public transportation.

Anthropic Launches Agent Skills for Claude: Anthropic has introduced Agent Skills, a modular system enabling Claude to load specialized workflows for tasks like document editing and content creation. These skills, organized as folders with instructions and scripts, are dynamically loaded by Claude and can be stacked for complex tasks and used across Claude apps, Claude Code, and the API, streamlining specialized task automation.

Anthropic Integrates Claude with Microsoft 365 via New MCP Connector: Anthropic is connecting Claude directly to Microsoft 365, enabling data retrieval from SharePoint, OneDrive, Outlook, and Teams through a new MCP framework. This integration allows enterprise users to query across calendars, chats, HR files, and emails, synthesizing results from multiple systems in a single request, enhancing Claude's utility within enterprise environments.

Apple Unveils M5 Chip with Enhanced AI Performance: Apple launched the M5, a next-generation processor for its devices, boasting a 4x increase in GPU compute for AI tasks compared to the M4.  Each GPU core now includes a Neural Accelerator, which enables large AI models to operate locally with greater efficiency, improving on-device Apple Intelligence capabilities.

Google AI Studio Refreshes User Interface: Google AI Studio has received a user interface refresh, combining Chat, GenMedia, and Live functionalities into a single, streamlined environment. This integration simplifies the workflow for users working with multiple AI modalities, allowing for easier access and management of various AI-driven creative processes.

Google DeepMind Partners with Commonwealth Fusion Systems on SPARC: Google DeepMind is collaborating with Commonwealth Fusion Systems to apply AI to plasma control and simulated reactor design for SPARC, a fusion energy project. DeepMind's models will be used to optimize experimental cycles and reduce the computational costs of simulations, which will aid in achieving net energy breakeven.

Spotify's AI DJ Now Accepts Text Requests: Spotify has enhanced its AI DJ feature for premium users, enabling it to process text-based requests in addition to voice commands. This allows users to prompt the AI to play specific genres, moods, or recommend new artists through text, making the AI feel more interactive and responsive to user preferences.

Amazon Launches AgentCore AI agent platform for all businesses: Amazon has launched the general availability of AgentCore, a platform designed to enable businesses to build and deploy AI Agents. Businesses from many domains such as customer support or insurance can build code executioners and chain together a series of actions with many external tools.

Oracle Expands Agentic AI Toolkit for CFOs: Oracle announced its expanded AI offerings for financial officers and professionals, allowing CFOs to leverage internal data and industry benchmarks to create projections and make better-informed decisions. The aim is to augment decision making by identifying anomalies and risks.

General Intuition Raises $134M Seed to Teach Agents Spatial Reasoning: General Intuition secured $134M in seed funding to develop AI models that possess spatial-temporal reasoning abilities. The company is using Medal's dataset of 2 billion video game clips to train agents, enabling them to understand and navigate complex virtual environments.

Kayak Launches an AI Mode for Travel Questions, Search and Bookings: Kayak has introduced an AI mode that allows users to find and book travel by typing questions like 'Find me a family-friendly hotel in Rome with free breakfast,' rather than using search filters. This simplifies the travel planning process through a conversational interface driven by AI.

California Regulates AI Companion Chatbots: California became the first U.S. state to regulate AI companion chatbots by implementing age verification, content warnings, and suicide-prevention protocols. SB 243 takes effect in January 2026 and mandates firms to disclose that chats are AI-generated, shield minors from explicit content, and penalize profits from illegal deepfakes up to $250,000 per offense, shaping AI oversight nationwide.

Nvidia Releases DGX Spark 'Personal AI Supercomputer': Nvidia launched DGX Spark, a compact "personal AI supercomputer" priced at $3,999 that delivers a petaflop of FP4 performance. This system features a GB10 Grace Blackwell Superchip, 128GB of unified memory, and up to 4TB of SSD storage allowing it to handle AI models with up to 200 billion parameters, aimed at democratizing AI compute by placing supercomputing power on individual data scientists' desks.

OpenAI to Allow Mature Content in ChatGPT for Verified Adults: OpenAI will introduce an age-gated "adult mode" in ChatGPT starting December 2025, enabling mature content including erotica for verified users over 18. This move relaxes previously restrictive safety policies and aims to make ChatGPT feel more human and expressive, providing users explicit control over tone and personality.

Walmart Integrates Shopping Directly Into ChatGPT: Walmart partnered with OpenAI to integrate shopping directly into ChatGPT, enabling shoppers to browse, plan, and purchase products using conversational interfaces. The integration leverages OpenAI’s Instant Checkout feature, offering personalized recommendations and seamless purchases within the chat and positions Walmart to compete with Amazon’s AI tools.

Microsoft Adds Copilot-Powered Formula Completion to Excel: Microsoft is integrating Copilot with Excel to provide AI-driven formula suggestions and completion, simplifying complex Excel workflows. This feature assists users in writing and understanding formulas, and will be available for Microsoft 365 subscribers.

OpenAI Launches GPT-5 Search API with Domain Filtering: OpenAI released the GPT-5 Search API, offering a 60% cost reduction and the ability to filter searches by domain. This API enhances search capabilities in Chat Completions and is designed to align with the new Responses web search behavior.

Firefox Integrates Perplexity AI Search Engine: Mozilla has officially integrated Perplexity's AI answer engine as a selectable search option in Firefox, expanding its availability beyond initial test markets. This gives users the option to use Perplexity, known for its AI-driven search summaries, directly within the Firefox browser.

Google Implements Image Generation in Search and Real-Time AI Makeup in Meet: Google integrated Nano Banana, a Gemini 2.5 Flash-based model, across Search, Lens, and NotebookLM, for functionalities like real-time image generation and video overviews. Google Meet now features virtual makeup with real-time face tracking, and Discover offers live trend previews in Search, enhancing search and communications experiences.

Good Start Labs Raises $3.6M to Train AI with Games: Good Start Labs, spun out of Every, raised $3.6 million to generate reinforcement learning data for frontier labs through teaching AI to play games. They are partnering with Bad Cards to train AI models on humor and will launch leaderboards for AI Diplomacy environments, aiming to improve long-term reasoning.

Alibaba Releases Compact Qwen3-VL Models: Alibaba introduced Qwen3-VL 4B and 8B, compact vision-language models, which come in Instruct and Thinking variants and often outperform Gemini 2.5 Flash Lite and GPT-5 Nano.  The models support 256K context expandable to 1M, and “open vocabulary” detection.

Microsoft's AI Experiences CPO advocates for AI as 'universal translator' at work, showcasing 'Researcher' at Microsoft.: Aparna Chennapragada, Microsoft's CPO of AI Experiences, suggests that AI language models can automate translation tasks, potentially flattening traditional management structures; she is building 'Researcher' at Microsoft to provide CEO-level insights to every employee, leveraging internal knowledge and web data to streamline information access and decision-making.

Figure AI Debuts Figure 03 Mass-Production Home Robot for 2026: Figure AI unveiled Figure 03, a humanoid robot designed for home use with capabilities including folding laundry, loading dishwashers, and watering plants; the robot utilizes Figure's Helix AI system, learning tasks by watching humans and incorporating upgraded cameras, tactile sensors, and wireless charging, and the company plans to produce 12,000 robots per year in its new BotQ factory.

OpenAI Launches Sora, a TikTok-Style Mobile App Powered by Sora 2 Model: OpenAI released Sora, an invite-only mobile app powered by the Sora 2 model for generating and remixing short AI videos with embedded user faces; the app rapidly gained popularity, reaching 1 million downloads within five days and becoming the number one app on the Apple App Store.

OpenAI Introduces Instant Checkout and App Integrations within ChatGPT: OpenAI launched Instant Checkout, allowing users to purchase products directly in ChatGPT starting with Etsy and soon Shopify, powered by the Agentic Commerce Protocol co-developed with Stripe; additionally, ChatGPT now supports interactive third-party apps like Booking.com, Spotify, and Canva, accessible within the platform via OpenAI's Apps SDK.

OpenAI and AMD Announce Multi-Year Partnership for AI Chips: OpenAI and AMD have partnered for a multi-year agreement involving 6 GW of AMD Instinct chips, beginning with 1 GW deployments in H2 2026, while AMD issued OpenAI a warrant for up to 10% of its shares tied to deployment milestones, indicating a diversification of OpenAI's AI chip supply chain.

Thinking Machines Lab Co-founder Joins Meta: Andrew Tulloch, co-founder of Thinking Machines Lab, has joined Meta after declining a $1.5 billion offer earlier, marking a notable AI talent acquisition for Meta.

Microsoft Copilot Integrates with Google and Office Products: Microsoft Copilot now supports Google Drive, Gmail, and Outlook, enabling users to search across multiple accounts with natural language queries directly within Windows; Copilot can also create and export content into Word, Excel, PowerPoint, or PDF formats from simple prompts.

xAI Targets AI-Generated Gaming with 'World Models': Elon Musk's AI startup, xAI, is developing 'world models,' AI systems that simulate real-world physics and environments by learning from videos and robotic data, for application in AI-assisted game design, and Musk announced plans to release a 'great' AI-generated game before the end of next year.

Samsung's Tiny Recursive Model (TRM) Achieves High Accuracy on Reasoning Tasks: Samsung introduced the Tiny Recursive Model (TRM), a 7-million-parameter model that outperforms larger models like DeepSeek R1 and Gemini 2.5 Pro on the ARC-AGI benchmark, demonstrating the potential for smaller models with recursive reasoning to achieve high accuracy on challenging tasks.

Wispr Flow Enhances Productivity through AI-Powered Voice Dictation: Wispr Flow offers a voice-based productivity tool that is 4x faster than typing, with AI-driven auto-editing for emails, documents, and code; it is designed to eliminate filler words, correct grammar, and maintain formatting while integrating with Slack, Notion, Gmail, ChatGPT and other popular applications.

Meta Plans Data Center the Size of Manhattan: Meta is planning to construct a new data center equivalent to the size of Manhattan to meet the growing computational demands of AI, indicating the significant infrastructure investment required to support future AI development and deployment.

Samsung's Tiny Recursive Model (TRM) Achieves High Scores on Reasoning Benchmarks: Samsung's 7-million-parameter TRM model has demonstrated impressive performance on ARC-AGI benchmarks, surpassing much larger models with significantly fewer parameters by thinking recursively. This indicates a potential shift towards smaller, edge-capable AI systems that can run locally rather than in large data centers, reshaping deployment economics.

Figure Unveils Scalable Humanoid Robot for Home Use: Figure has introduced its third-generation humanoid robot, F.03, engineered for mass production and intended for residential use, with plans to manufacture up to 100,000 units in four years. The robot features improved hardware, AI integration, and a focus on cost-effective manufacturing techniques like die-casting and injection molding.

DEEP Robotics Introduces All-Weather Humanoid for Industrial Use: DEEP Robotics, a Chinese company, has launched an all-weather humanoid robot designed for outdoor industrial applications, capable of operating in extreme temperatures ranging from -20°C to 55°C. This development underscores China's growing robotics ecosystem and its focus on robust, real-world applications for humanoid robots.

OpenAI's Dev Day Introduces Apps for ChatGPT and AgentKit: OpenAI unveiled Apps for ChatGPT, allowing developers to integrate third-party services directly into the chat interface, along with the Apps SDK and the Model Context Protocol (MCP) to build interactive applications. The company also introduced AgentKit, a modular toolkit with Agent Builder, ChatKit, and Connector Registry, aimed at simplifying the creation, deployment, and testing of AI agents.

OpenAI and AMD Expand Partnership with Chip Supply Deal: OpenAI has expanded its partnership with AMD through a multi-year deal worth billions, where AMD will supply its MI450 series GPUs starting in 2026 for OpenAI's AI infrastructure. This agreement includes warrants for OpenAI to acquire up to a 10% stake in AMD, reflecting the deep integration between model development and compute capacity management.

Musk's xAI Investing Heavily in Supercomputer Infrastructure: Elon Musk's xAI is reportedly expanding its ongoing funding round to $20 billion, with a structure tied to Nvidia GPU purchases, to build a massive supercomputer in Memphis named Colossus 2, equipped with hundreds of thousands of Nvidia chips. The project aims to accelerate AI development and address the growing demand for AI infrastructure, consuming more electricity than all Memphis homes combined.

Google Launches Gemini 2.5 Computer Use Model: Google released the Gemini 2.5 Computer Use model that can interact with websites and apps like a human by clicking, typing, and navigating on its own. This model, built on Gemini 2.5 Pro, aims to provide faster and more accurate agentic capabilities with strong safety features.

Starbucks Uses AI to Personalize Customer Experience and Optimize Supply Chain: Starbucks utilizes its proprietary AI, Deep Brew, to analyze customer data from its mobile app, enabling personalized promotions and new beverage offerings like unsweetened iced teas. Deep Brew also optimizes the supply chain by analyzing weather, local events, and consumer trends to ensure ingredient availability, resulting in significant cost savings and revenue preservation.

Cognixion Integrates BCI with Apple Vision Pro for Communication: Cognixion, a startup developing brain-computer interfaces (BCI), is launching a clinical trial to integrate its EEG-powered headband and AI communication app with the Apple Vision Pro headset. This integration aims to enable people with paralysis and speech disorders to communicate using brain signals and gaze, offering a non-invasive alternative to brain implants.

GPT-5 Pro Sets New Accuracy Record in Compute-Heavy FrontierMath: OpenAI's GPT-5 Pro achieved 13% accuracy in FrontierMath Tier 4, outperforming Gemini 2.5 Deep Think by a single problem in compute-heavy settings. EpochAI Research clarified that OpenAI had access to 28 of the 48 problems, with GPT-5 Pro solving 5 out of 8 problems on the held-out set.

Mila + Microsoft's Markovian Thinking Decouples Reasoning Length from Context Size: Mila and Microsoft introduced Markovian Thinking, a method to train models to 'write state' at fixed boundaries, enabling reasoning with longer token sequences while using less compute. An R1-Distill 1.5B model reasoned up to 24K tokens with an 8K context, outperforming LongCoT-RL trained on full 24K at ~4× lower compute, reducing dependence on extensive context windows.

vLLM Demonstrates Strong Inference Gains with NVIDIA Blackwell Integration: vLLM achieved substantial performance improvements in InferenceMAX by integrating with NVIDIA Blackwell, utilizing over 100 PRs across the stack, FP4/FP8 kernels, asynchronous scheduling, graph fusions, and FlashInfer integration. Speculative decoding and Data + Expert Parallel (DEP) are expected to further enhance throughput by 2–3x, showcasing deep collaboration between the two companies.

Together AI Launches ATLAS, an Adaptive Speculative Decoding System: Together AI unveiled ATLAS, an adaptive speculative decoding system designed to learn from live traffic, reportedly achieving 4x faster performance compared to baseline (500 TPS on DeepSeek‑V3.1). Early reports also suggest that self-adaptive speculators can reduce RL training time by over 60%, indicating a significant increase in inference efficiency.

Alibaba Qwen Releases Qwen3-VL Cookbooks for Multimodal Tasks: Alibaba Qwen launched a set of polished notebooks for local and API use of Qwen3-VL, covering various multimodal tasks like computer use, omni recognition, document parsing/OCR, 3D grounding, video understanding, mobile agents, and spatial reasoning. These cookbooks are designed to simplify the utilization of the model across various applications.

OpenAI's GPT Realtime Mini Offers Scalable Speech-to-Speech Capabilities: OpenAI released GPT Realtime Mini, a speech-to-speech model that is approximately 7x cheaper than the flagship Realtime, reducing time-to-first-audio (TTFA) to 0.81 seconds and doubling context to 32k. Additionally, GPT Realtime Mini adds image input, positioning it for scalable agent applications over WebRTC/WebSocket/SIP.

Microsoft Unveils NVIDIA GB300 NVL72 Cluster for OpenAI: Microsoft and Azure announced the first production NVIDIA GB300 NVL72 cluster for OpenAI, featuring over 4,600 Blackwell Ultra GPUs. Each NVL72 virtual machine integrates 72 GPUs via NVLink Switch fabric, delivering 1.44 exaflops FP4 per VM and facilitating low-precision training and inference using NVFP4 and the NVIDIA Dynamo compiler.

ComfyUI Integrates NVIDIA GPUDirect Storage (GDS) for Running Heavy Models on Low-VRAM GPUs: Developer Maifee integrated NVIDIA GPUDirect Storage (GDS) into ComfyUI, allowing model weights to be streamed directly from NVMe to GPU VRAM, enabling heavy models to run on GPUs with as little as 6 GB VRAM. This integration bypasses CPU/host RAM, improving I/O efficiency by using a zero-copy NVMe→GPU DMA path, though it is currently limited to Linux.

Figure AI Unveils Third-Generation Humanoid Robot, Figure 03: Figure AI launched its third-generation humanoid robot, Figure 03, designed for mass production and featured in Time Magazine’s ‘Best Inventions of 2025’. Figure's new BotQ factory aims to scale production to 12,000 units annually, focusing on home adoption with improved dexterity for carrying out chores.

SoftBank to Acquire ABB's Robotics Arm for $5.4B: SoftBank is set to acquire ABB’s robotics division for $5.4 billion, granting it immediate entry into the growing $75 billion robotics market. The acquisition will add over 7,000 employees and manufacturing facilities to SoftBank’s automation portfolio, enhancing its AI-driven segment.

Figure Unveils Next-Generation Humanoid Robot Figure 03: Figure AI introduced Figure 03, a new humanoid robot designed for home and industrial use with features like dual palm cameras, fingertip sensors, and wireless foot charging. The company plans to produce 12,000 units per year through BotQ.

Google Launches Gemini Enterprise for Workplace AI Automation: Google released Gemini Enterprise, an AI platform that integrates Gemini models, agents, and enterprise data for workplace automation and no-code agent building. The platform features workflow orchestration and deep integration with Workspace, Microsoft 365, and Salesforce.

Reflection AI Raises $2 Billion for Open-Source AI Development: Reflection AI, founded by ex-DeepMind researchers, raised $2 billion at an $8 billion valuation to develop open-source frontier AI models. The company aims to rival OpenAI and Anthropic by building and open-sourcing frontier AI models.

OpenAI's Sora Hits 1 Million Downloads: OpenAI's AI video app Sora has achieved over 1 million downloads in under five days since its iOS launch, surpassing ChatGPT's initial performance. The app generates short videos from text prompts.

Microsoft Deploys NVIDIA GB300 NVL72 Production Cluster for OpenAI: Microsoft announced it has deployed the world's first at-scale production cluster of NVIDIA GB300 NVL72 for OpenAI, and OpenAI's next-generation models will run on this infrastructure.

Samsung Releases Tiny Logic Puzzle Solving AI Model: Samsung released the Tiny Recursive Model, a 7M-parameter open-source model capable of solving logic puzzles better than Gemini 2.5 Pro and o3-mini despite its compact size.

Alibaba's Qwen Releases Cookbooks for Qwen3-VL: Alibaba's Qwen shared cookbooks for deploying Qwen3-VL in diverse use cases, offering resources for applications like document parsing, spatial reasoning, and building multimodal agents, aiming to facilitate broader adoption.

AI21 Labs Releases Jamba Reasoning 3B: AI21 Labs released Jamba Reasoning 3B, a small reasoning model that leads "tiny" reasoning models with 52% on IFBench, demonstrating strong reasoning capabilities in a compact size.

Radical Numerics Releases RND1, a 30B-Parameter Diffusion Language Model: Radical Numerics released RND1, a 30B-parameter sparse MoE DLM, with weights, code, and training details to catalyze research into DLM inference/post-training and a simple AR-to-diffusion conversion pipeline.

Elastic Acquires Jina AI: Elastic acquired Jina AI to deepen multimodal/multilingual search and context engineering in Elastic’s agentic stack, signaling a move to enhance their AI-powered search capabilities.

Samsung's Tiny Recursive Model (TRM) Achieves High Efficiency in Reasoning: Samsung has developed a 7M Tiny Recursive Model (TRM), a reasoning model that outperforms prior 27M HRM on ARC-AGI and Sudoku. This model uses a smaller, single-network design with full backprop through recursion, which improves generalization by reducing the number of layers and swapping self-attention for MLP in fixed-length contexts.

AI21 Labs Releases Jamba Reasoning 3B Model: AI21 Labs launched Jamba Reasoning 3B, a hybrid SSM-Transformer model, boasting speed and accuracy for long context reasoning tasks. It is reported to be 3-5x faster than Llama 3.2 3B and Qwen3 4B at 32K tokens and can achieve up to 64K context, making it available on HF/Kaggle/LM Studio/llama.cpp.
