This change signals a shift towards improved models and could require teams to update their integrations to maintain functionality with the xAI platform.

Meta's Smart Glasses Leak Reveals HUD and Gesture Control: A leaked video revealed Ray-Ban-branded smart glasses with a heads-up display (HUD) for notifications, navigation, and voice commands and Oakley glasses with a camera, integrated with Meta's sEMG wristband for gesture control. The HUD supports Meta AI features and message input via finger swipes, indicating Meta's continued development and integration of AR and AI technologies into wearable devices.

Reve Launches New Image Creator with AI-Powered Editing: Reve has launched a new image creation platform, offering a combination of an image creator with text rendering, a drag-and-drop editor, a creative assistant, and an API for integrations. The platform uses a unique Layout Representation system to enhance precision and enable more intuitive image manipulation; users can manipulate objects, combine multiple images, or use the AI assistant to search the web.

Warp Code Launches to Streamline AI Agent Coding: Warp has launched Warp Code, a platform for AI agent coding, aiming to improve software creation from prompt to production. Key features include a built-in editor, code review, file tree, and syntax highlighting, and the tool is compatible with various models, including Opus, Sonnet, and GPT-5, under one subscription, targeting improved agentic workflows and software development processes.

Higgsfield Raises $50M Series A for AI Video Creation: Higgsfield, an AI video startup, has announced a $50M Series A funding round led by GFT Ventures, coupled with claiming a $50M revenue run-rate and 4.5x growth in three months. The company plans to use the funding to launch Higgsfield Ventures, a fund aimed at backing AI-native teams and fostering innovation in AI video technology.

Poke.com Launches AI Texting Concierge with $15M Series A: Poke.com launched an AI texting concierge service alongside a $15M Series A funding round led by General Catalyst. The service coordinates plans and handles logistics via text on the user's behalf, with the funding intended to improve the UX and continue development on its software.

AlterEgo Unveils 'Telepathic' Wearable Device: AlterEgo, an MIT spin-out, has unveiled a wearable device that uses “Silent Sense” technology to communicate silently by capturing the brain signals intended for speech muscles before speaking; the device allows users to type messages, silently search the web, control smart homes, and have silent conversations and early access signups are now open.

Wispr Flow Launches AI-Powered Voice Dictation: Wispr has launched Wispr Flow, an AI-powered voice dictation tool that's four times quicker than typing, auto-edits on the fly, cleans filler words, fixes grammar, and formats perfectly as the user speaks, and can be used inside every app on Mac, Windows, and iPhone without setup.

Luma AI Introduces Text-to-Video and Video Restyling: Luma AI now provides the capability to transform text into videos and restyle a video's background, characters, or setting post-production, providing users a way to create and modify video content using AI technology.

Browserbase Offers AI-Native Automation Framework: Browserbase provides a platform to run browsers in the cloud for automating agent browsing and workflow tasks, with Stagehand providing an AI-native automation framework using natural language commands, Director offering a visual workflow builder, and Browserbase MCP connecting it all to AI assistants like Claude.

OpenAI Launches Grove Founder Fellowship: OpenAI has introduced Grove, a five-week in-person residency at its San Francisco headquarters, for approximately 15 technical founders who are pre-idea, providing workspace, access to unreleased OpenAI tools, and mentorship from research leaders with no equity taken; the first cohort starts in November.

Amazon to Utilize AI Summaries for Product Reviews: Amazon will use its language model to provide AI-generated summaries of product reviews, including "pros," "cons," and "best for" tags, along with suggested add-on items based on customer needs to help make the customer shopping experience more informed.

Microsoft Signs $17.4 Billion GPU Deal with Nebius: Microsoft has signed a $17.4 billion agreement with Nebius for GPU compute power to be delivered from Nebius’s new data center in New Jersey, which is expected to come online later this year, in order to support the needs of large model training on Azure.

Google Gemini Becomes Top Free iPhone App: Google's Gemini app has surpassed ChatGPT to become the number one free app on the US App Store, driven by its viral "Nano Banana" image editing model, which allows users to keep character likeness, supports style transfers, and enables conversational edits.

xAI Launches Grok 4 Fast and Shifts Focus to Specialist AI Tutors: xAI has launched Grok 4 Fast, an early access beta model that prioritizes speed over depth and is up to 10 times faster than Grok 4, and xAI has laid off approximately 500 data workers while pivoting to focus on specialist AI tutors in STEM and medicine.

OpenAI Prepares Native Ordering System for ChatGPT: OpenAI is developing an "Orders" hub within ChatGPT to store credit cards, enable one-click checkout, and track purchases across desktop and mobile, and Voice Mode is being integrated directly into the main app window for tighter multimodal workflows.

Oracle Secures Massive Cloud Deal with OpenAI: Oracle reportedly signed a $300 billion cloud computing deal with OpenAI spanning five years starting in 2027, requiring 4.5 gigawatts of power and causing Oracle's shares to surge. The deal highlights Oracle's strategic bet on OpenAI's continued growth and the escalating infrastructure demands of frontier AI development.

Microsoft Integrates Anthropic's Claude into Office 365: Microsoft is incorporating Anthropic’s Claude models, such as Claude Sonnet 4, into Office 365 applications, diminishing its exclusive reliance on OpenAI for AI in productivity tools. This move came after side-by-side testing demonstrated Claude’s superior performance in Excel financial functions and PowerPoint generation, positioning Anthropic as Microsoft's hedge against OpenAI amid restructuring negotiations.

OpenAI Gains Microsoft's Approval for For-Profit Transition: OpenAI has secured a nonbinding agreement from Microsoft to transition its for-profit arm into a public benefit corporation (PBC), potentially easing fundraising efforts and a future IPO. The nonprofit controlling OpenAI will retain oversight and a stake in the PBC valued at over $100 billion, marking the end of negotiations between the companies pending regulatory approval.

Cognition AI Raises $400M at $10.2B Valuation: Cognition AI, the company behind the AI-powered software engineer Devin, has raised over $400 million at a $10.2 billion valuation to expand its tools.  The recent acquisition of Windsurf has reportedly doubled revenue and expanded its product range.

Perplexity Reportedly Raises $200M at $20B Valuation: Perplexity, an AI search engine startup, has reportedly raised $200 million at a $20 billion valuation, just two months after securing $100 million at an $18 billion valuation. The company, which has raised a total of $1.5 billion, reports close to $200 million in annual revenue.

Nvidia Unveils Rubin CPX GPU for Large-Context AI Inference: Nvidia has announced the Rubin CPX GPU, designed specifically for massive-context AI inference workloads including million-token coding and generative video tasks. Integrated into the Vera Rubin NVL144 CPX platform, the new GPU is expected to launch at the end of 2026 and delivers 8 exaflops of performance.

Apple Adds Real-Time Translation to AirPods Pro: Apple's AirPods Pro 3, along with some older models, now offer real-time translation in multiple languages, powered by Apple Intelligence and operating offline.  The feature supports a limited number of languages at launch, with more to be added later in the year, enabling users to have conversations in different languages.

Anthropic Endorses California's SB 53 AI Safety Bill: Anthropic is backing California's SB 53, which would require major AI developers to publish safety frameworks, transparency reports, and critical incident disclosures.  The bill aims to prevent catastrophic risks associated with AI and includes whistleblower protections and penalties for non-compliance.

Google Releases VaultGemma, a Differentially Private LLM: Google has launched VaultGemma, a large language model (LLM) trained with differential privacy, preventing it from memorizing or leaking specific training data information. This model is designed to address significant privacy concerns associated with AI technology.

Mercor Fields $10B Valuation Offers for AI Training Marketplace: Mercor, an AI training marketplace that connects domain experts with companies like OpenAI and Meta, has reportedly received valuation offers of $10 billion. This indicates the high demand and value placed on specialized AI training resources in the industry.

Meta Releases MobileLLM-R1 for On-Device Reasoning: Meta has released MobileLLM-R1, a family of sub-1B parameter reasoning models on Hugging Face, designed for efficient on-device inference. The model achieves high MATH accuracy compared to larger models and matches or surpasses Qwen3 accuracy on reasoning benchmarks, trained on a smaller dataset, making it suitable for lightweight deployment.

Alibaba's Qwen3-Next-80B Introduces Hybrid Attention and Extended Context Window: Alibaba introduced Qwen3-Next-80B-A3B, featuring a hybrid attention design and a 256k context window.  This adaptation required significant changes to inference engines like SGLang and vLLM, and is priced cheaper than Qwen3-235B on Alibaba Cloud, with improved long-horizon memory but weaknesses in long-text hallucination.

VS Code Finalizes Language Model Chat Provider API: VS Code has finalized the “Language Model Chat Provider” extension API, allowing developers to install BYOK (Bring Your Own Key) providers for greater model choice. The update includes tutorials, videos, and an auto-select model experience supporting models like Claude, GPT-5/mini, and Gemini.

OpenAI Increases GPT-5 and gpt-5-mini Rate Limits: OpenAI has substantially increased rate limits for GPT-5 and gpt-5-mini across various tiers on its platform. A new target, “gpt-5-high-new”, also appeared in Codex-CLI, which is reportedly tuned to rely on built-in reasoning defaults.

Anthropic Collaborates to Strengthen Claude Safeguards: Anthropic is working with the UK AISI and US CAISI to identify jailbreaks in Claude Opus 4/4.1, enhancing its safeguards.  Anthropic also recommends the Claude Code SDK for builders as a starting point for custom agents, offering the same harness as the CLI.

ByteDance's Seedream 4.0 Tops Image Generation Leaderboards: ByteDance's Seedream 4.0 is now ranked #1 in both Text-to-Image and Image Editing arenas on Artificial Analysis, surpassing Google’s Gemini 2.5 Flash.  A new variant, “Seedream 4 High Res,” supports 4096x4096 outputs and is live in the Arena.

Google Research Releases VaultGemma, a Differentially Private Model: Google Research released VaultGemma, a 1B-parameter Gemma variant trained from scratch using differential privacy, claiming it is the largest open model trained in this manner. The weights and related research report are now available.

OpenAI and Microsoft Restructure Partnership for Potential IPO: OpenAI and Microsoft are reportedly finalizing a deal to restructure their partnership, paving the way for an IPO of OpenAI’s for-profit arm.  The agreement would let employees cash out, while Microsoft would retain preferred access to future models, and the nonprofit parent would maintain majority control with an AI-safety veto.

Anthropic Increases Claude's Memory Retention: Anthropic is now storing consumer chats for up to five years with Claude, unless users opt out, in order to provide richer, long-context answers. This move introduces potential data exposure risks, necessitating audits and opt-out strategies for enterprises.

DeepWiki Transforms GitHub Repos into Instant Wikis: DeepWiki, developed by the Devin coding agent team, converts any GitHub repository into an accessible wiki. By replacing 'github.com' with 'deepwiki.com' in a repo URL, users can instantly query the codebase, offering grounded responses tied to specific code lines. It also integrates with Claude and Cursor via a Model Context Protocol server.

Alibaba Releases Qwen3-Next with Hybrid Attention: Alibaba has launched Qwen3-Next, a new model architecture that uses a hybrid attention system, ultra-sparse MoE routing, and multi-token prediction. The 80B-parameter base model activates only ~3B parameters during inference, resulting in 10x faster throughput for long-context tasks and lower training costs compared to Qwen3-32B, while matching or exceeding its performance.

Microsoft and OpenAI Restructure Partnership: Microsoft and OpenAI have signed a non-binding MOU allowing OpenAI to restructure as a for-profit entity while maintaining nonprofit oversight and securing Microsoft’s cloud integration. The nonprofit will retain a substantial equity stake, valued at over $100 billion, with a portion of proceeds allocated for philanthropic initiatives, pending regulatory approval.

Anthropic Launches Memory Features in Claude for Business: Anthropic has introduced memory features in Claude for Team and Enterprise users, enabling the AI to remember previous conversations and maintain context across projects. This new feature enhances Claude's ability to provide tailored responses based on a team's specific processes and client needs; it also includes steerable and editable memories, plus an incognito mode for private conversations.

Bytedance Launches Seedream 4.0 Image Model: ByteDance's Seedream 4.0, a new AI image generation model, is reported to outperform Google’s 'Nano Banana' on some benchmarks, positioning itself as a strong competitor in the image generation space. This model is priced competitively and is gaining traction for various creative applications like movie storyboarding and photorealistic renders.

Stability AI's Stable Audio 2.5 Reduces Production Steps: Stability AI released Stable Audio 2.5, significantly enhancing audio generation efficiency using a new Adversarial Relativistic-Contrastive (ARC) post-training method.  This allows the model to slash inference steps from 50 to 8, enabling creation of three-minute tracks in under two seconds on Nvidia H100 GPUs and providing commercial-use datasets.

OpenAI and Oracle Form Computing Partnership: OpenAI is reported to have signed a five-year, $300 billion cloud contract with Oracle beginning in 2027 to accelerate OpenAI's move away from Azure exclusivity and to build data center projects. This contract is projected to be the largest cloud contract ever signed and would ride the wave of Oracle's increase in cloud revenues.

Former Anchor Founders Launch AI-powered Learning App, Oboe: Nir Zicherman and Michael Mignano, founders of Anchor, have created Oboe, an AI-powered learning app generates custom courses using a simple prompt. Oboe's system uses a multi-agent AI system, offers nine formats including text, visuals, audio lectures, interactive quizzes, and podcast-style conversations, and has received $4M in seed funding.

Meituan Launches Voice-Powered AI Agent for Food Delivery: China’s Meituan introduced Xiaomei, a voice-powered AI agent for meal ordering and restaurant booking, which the company claims will boost its local services business against rivals Alibaba and JD. This is yet another AI-powered technology being integrated into commercial consumer applications.

micro1 Raises $35M to Build Human-Powered AI Platform: micro1 raised $35M in Series A funding to develop an AI platform powered by human intelligence, which they claim connects the brightest minds with AI's toughest problems and values the company at $500M. Central to micro1’s platform is Zara, an AI recruiter agent which the company claims has facilitated over 500,000 AI-led interviews.

Microsoft Integrates Anthropic's Claude Models into Office Apps: Microsoft is integrating Anthropic’s Claude models into Office applications like Word, Excel, Outlook, and PowerPoint in order to offer users enhanced productivity tools and broaden its bench of AI capabilities. Claude’s addition means Microsoft users will see model options and see more specialized suggestions to aid work efficiency; this does not mark a departure from OpenAI collaboration.

Thinking Machines Lab Fixes LLM Nondeterminism: Thinking Machines Lab, founded by ex-OpenAI CTO Mira Murati, released a research paper and open-source code addressing nondeterminism in LLM inference. The team discovered that varying outputs for identical queries stemmed from inconsistent batch processing on servers. The fix involves batch-invariant kernels that ensure consistent outputs irrespective of server load, which improves AI research reproducibility and business result consistency.

OpenAI Signs $300B Cloud Deal with Oracle: Oracle's stock surged after securing a reported $300 billion, five-year AI infrastructure deal with OpenAI for 4.5 GW of AI computing capacity. Expected to start in 2027, this contract diversifies OpenAI's cloud providers and may boost Oracle's market value, making it a key player in AI infrastructure.

Replit Launches Agent 3 with Increased Autonomy: Replit released Agent 3, enhancing its AI coding platform by increasing autonomous runtime to 200 minutes. The updated agent autonomously builds, tests, and fixes code within applications, featuring improved performance and the ability to generate new agents and automations. Alongside this launch, Replit announced $250M in funding at a $3B valuation, highlighting growing interest in AI-assisted coding platforms.

ByteDance Seedream 4.0 Challenges Google's Nano Banana: ByteDance introduced Seedream 4.0, a new multimodal image model designed to rival Google's Gemini Nano Banana, featuring enhanced image generation and editing capabilities. Seedream 4.0 outputs 4K resolution images and handles up to six reference inputs at a lower cost than its predecessor. The model also aims to match or exceed Google on visual realism, though google still wins on typography and exact subject persistence.

Meta Enhances ChatGPT in Developer Mode: ChatGPT now supports MCP (Model Context Protocol) tools, enabling developers to create connectors and use them for write actions directly within developer mode. This enhancement allows tying in services like Jira, Zapier, and Stripe, increasing the agent's utility and integration capabilities within custom applications.

Anthropic Adds Web Fetch Tool to Claude API: Anthropic has integrated a web fetch tool into the Claude API, allowing the AI to retrieve and analyze content directly from arbitrary URLs. This feature facilitates richer contextual understanding and data extraction for research and coding tasks but Anthropic recommends caution when using the tool in high-security environments.

ElevenLabs Launches Voice Remixing Tool: ElevenLabs has released a Voice Remixing tool in alpha, enabling users to edit cloned and designed voices for AI agents. This feature allows customization of voice characteristics like gender, age, and accent, providing businesses with greater control over the sonic identities of their AI interfaces.

Microsoft Research's VibeVoice Showcases Long-Form TTS: Microsoft Research has demonstrated VibeVoice, a 7B parameter long-form Text-to-Speech (TTS) model that can generate single-pass audio ranging from 45-90 minutes with up to four speakers. A demo in a Hugging Face Space enables users to experience life-like prosody without audio stitching though some report the voices sound stilted over time.

Cognition AI Raises $400M to Scale Devin: Cognition, developer of the AI coding agent Devin, has raised $400 million at a $10.2 billion post-money valuation, led by Founders Fund. The funding will be used to advance AI coding agents, expand customer base, and integrate the Windsurf team, with plans to hire across various departments.

Vercel Ships OSS 'Vibe Coding Platform' Built on GPT-5: Vercel has launched an open-source vibe coding platform based on the Vercel AI SDK, Gateway, and Sandbox, utilizing a tuned GPT-5 agent loop. The platform features tools for file I/O, command execution, package installation, and automatic error correction, demonstrated through a one-shot demo coding a multiplayer Pong game in Go.

Google's Veo 3 Goes GA with Price Cuts and Vertical Video Support: Google has announced the general availability of Veo 3 and Veo 3 Fast in the Gemini API, reducing prices by approximately 50% to $0.40/s and $0.15/s, respectively.  Veo 3 also now supports 1080p output and 9:16 vertical video formats, aimed at scaling production capabilities for users.

Alibaba's Qwen3-ASR Released for Multilingual Transcription: Alibaba has released Qwen3-ASR, a single model designed for multilingual transcription in English, Chinese, and nine other languages. The model features automatic language detection, robustness to background music and noise, and less than 8% WER, with demos available on ModelScope/HF and an accessible API.

Meta's Set Block Decoding Enables Faster LM Decoding: Meta has introduced Set Block Decoding (SBD), a technique that enables 3-5x decoding speedups on existing language models without architectural changes. SBD matches the performance of NTP while preserving exact KV cache through a parallel generation process formulated via masked/discrete diffusion.

Baidu Releases ERNIE-4.5-21B-A3B-Thinking MoE Model: Baidu has released ERNIE-4.5-21B-A3B-Thinking, a 21 billion-parameter text MoE model activating approximately 3 billion parameters per token. Designed for enhanced multi-step reasoning and supporting a 128K context, it's compatible with Transformer versions 4.54.0 and later, VLLM, and FastDeploy, released under the Apache 2.0 license.

Switzerland Releases Open LLM Suite 'Apertus' Trained on Public Data: Switzerland has released "Apertus," an open LLM suite, available in 8B and 70B sizes, trained solely on public data spanning over 1,000 languages. The project aims for full transparency, providing open weights, datasets, and training methods to foster auditability and reproducibility, positioning itself as a European initiative for AI sovereignty.

Anthropic Adds File Creation and Editing to Claude: Anthropic has enabled Claude to create and edit common office files like Excel (.xlsx), Word (.docx), PowerPoint (.pptx), and PDF, directly within the chat interface. This new feature delivers ready-to-use outputs without the need for copy-pasting, available for Claude Max and Team/Enterprise users.

Tencent's HunyuanImage-2.1 is an OSS Text-to-Image System: Tencent released HunyuanImage-2.1, an open-source text-to-image system using a multi-modal DiT backbone and a refiner, along with dual text encoders. The model supports 2K resolution generation, multilingual prompts (CN/EN), and flexible aspect ratios but requires at least 59 GB GPU RAM.

Microsoft licenses Anthropic’s Claude models for Azure and Microsoft 365 Copilot: Microsoft has licensed Anthropic’s Claude models for Azure and Microsoft 365 Copilot in a new multi-year pact. With this move, Microsoft adds a second frontier-AI supplier, easing dependence on OpenAI, and launches Claude in Copilot Studio later this quarter with transparent model labels.

Cognition AI Secures $400M Funding for AI Coding Agent Expansion: Cognition AI, the creator of the Devin AI software engineer, has raised $400 million at a $10.2 billion valuation to further develop its AI coding agent. The funding will support the development of an enterprise version of Devin capable of writing, testing, and shipping code across major repositories, accelerating the shift from code assistance to end-to-end build agents.

Vercel Launches Open-Source Vibe Coding Platform with GPT-5 Integration: Vercel has released an open-source vibe coding platform powered by GPT-5 agent loops, simplifying agent development stacks. The platform leverages the Vercel AI SDK, Gateway, and Sandbox and includes features like file I/O, command execution, package installation, and autofix capabilities, demonstrated by coding a multiplayer Pong game in Go in a single shot.

Google Reduces Veo 3 Pricing and Adds Features: Google has announced that Veo 3 and Veo 3 Fast are now generally available in the Gemini API with a roughly 50% price reduction, positioning them for scaled production. The update also brings 1080p output and 9:16 vertical video support, catering to content creation for various platforms.

ElevenLabs Tender Offer Valued at $6.6B: ElevenLabs, a company specializing in voice technology, has approved a tender offer that allows its staff to sell up to $100 million in shares, setting the company's valuation at $6.6 billion. This move allows employees to realize some of the value created by the company's growth.

Memex Launches Major Redesign with Enhanced Agentic Capabilities: Memex, a desktop vibe coding agent, has released a significant redesign with planning, memory management, and an agentic terminal capable of handling installs and setups.  The updates also introduce a control center for one-click tasks, improved context management, and a plan mode for seasoned project management.

Attio Integrates AI-Native CRM for Enhanced Customer Insights: Attio is offering an AI-native CRM solution that connects to email and calendar to provide real-time customer insights, aiming to replace traditional CRMs. Granola, Flatfile, and Replicate are already utilizing the platform's AI automations to improve workflows and customer management.

Wispr Flow Launches AI Voice Tool for Improved Productivity: Wispr has launched Wispr Flow, an AI-powered voice dictation tool that enhances productivity by enabling users to dictate emails, documents, and messages four times faster than typing. Flow features AI-driven auto-editing, compatibility across apps, and is available on Mac, Windows, and iPhone.

Plaud's Wearable AI Notetaker Gains Traction with $250M Annual Revenue: Plaud, a Chinese startup, has quietly gained traction by selling over 1 million units of its NotePin, a wearable AI device that turns conversations into searchable transcripts and summaries, generating a $250 million annual revenue run rate.  With the new Note Pro, launching this year, Plaud is targeting a specific professional audience needing reliable and accurate notes without phones or apps.

beehiiv Appoints Wendy McMahon as Advisor to Expand Journalism Platform: beehiiv, a newsletter platform, has appointed Wendy McMahon, former President and CEO of CBS News, Stations and Media Ventures, as its advisor. McMahon will contribute to expanding the platform's support for independent journalism through its Media Collective initiative, which provides tools and resources to journalists building sustainable audience-first businesses.

Google Gemini App Supports Arbitrary File Uploads: Google Gemini mobile application has been updated with ability to upload any file, including audio. With this update, the user interface of the application caught up with the existing Gemini API and Google AI studio file upload functionality, which has been possible for two years already.

OpenAI's GPT-5 Enhances Search Capabilities within ChatGPT: OpenAI's GPT-5 "Thinking" model within ChatGPT significantly improves search result quality and comprehensiveness by leveraging its Bing-backed search tool, enabling users to perform complex research tasks effectively. The enhanced model, dubbed the "Research Goblin," facilitates faster and more thorough information retrieval compared to manual searches, particularly on mobile devices.

Google Releases EmbeddingGemma, a Lightweight Embedding Model: Google has introduced EmbeddingGemma, a 308M parameter open-weight embedding model based on the Gemma 3 architecture, designed to operate efficiently on minimal RAM (under 200MB with quantization) and trained across 100+ languages. The model is integrated with various platforms like sentence-transformers, llama.cpp, MLX, Ollama, and LMStudio, with a Transformers.js demo showcasing its in-browser capabilities for semantic analysis and similarity searches.

Alibaba Cloud Launches Qwen-Max, a Trillion-Parameter MoE Model: Alibaba Cloud introduced Qwen-Max, a Mixture-of-Experts (MoE) language model with a trillion parameters, accessible via an OpenAI-compatible API through DashScope/Model Studio, emphasizing capabilities in math, coding, and long-form reasoning. This positions Qwen-Max as a flagship production chat stack, offering developers an accessible interface for evaluating and deploying a top-tier model, complemented by open-weight and multimodal siblings.

OpenAI Acquires Statsig for $1.1 Billion and Appoints New CTO: OpenAI is acquiring Statsig, a product-testing startup, in a $1.1 billion all-stock deal and appointing Statsig's CEO, Vijaye Raji, as the new CTO of Applications. This strategic move aims to enhance OpenAI's product development and testing capabilities by integrating Statsig's expertise, while reassigning existing leadership roles within the company.

Sierra Raises $350 Million for AI Customer Service Agents: Sierra, Bret Taylor’s AI customer-service agent startup, has secured $350 million in funding, boosting its valuation to $10 billion after only 18 months of operation. The company plans to use the new capital to further develop and expand its AI-driven customer service solutions.

Anthropic to Pay $1.5 Billion to Authors in Copyright Settlement: Anthropic has reached a settlement to pay at least $1.5 billion to authors for training its AI models on copyrighted books, resolving a class-action lawsuit. The agreement amounts to approximately $3,000 per book or work, addressing claims related to training on pirated content from sources like Books3, PiLiMi, and LibGen, while clarifying the legal landscape for AI training data acquisition.

Atlassian Acquires The Browser Company for $610 Million: Atlassian is acquiring The Browser Company, the maker of Arc, for $610 million in cash, aiming to develop an AI-enhanced browser tailored for knowledge workers. The Browser Company will operate independently and continue developing Dia, an AI-first browser, under Atlassian's ownership.

JPMorgan Chase Implements AI Tools for Enhanced Efficiency: JPMorgan Chase & Co. utilizes internal AI tools like the LLM Suite, EEVE Intelligent Q&A, Coding Assistant, ChatCFO, and Contract Intelligence (COiN) across its operations, impacting over 200,000 employees. These AI-driven solutions aim to automate routine tasks, improve productivity, and enhance customer service, leading to increased efficiency and focus on strategic decision-making.

Mistral Releases New MCP Connectors and Memory Feature for Le Chat: Mistral has released new MCP connectors for its Le Chat platform, enabling integration with over 20 enterprise platforms and allowing users to build custom workflows. The addition of a memory feature allows Le Chat to retain user preferences and information, providing more personalized responses.

OpenAI Developing Custom AI Chips in Collaboration with Broadcom: OpenAI is designing its own custom AI chips with Broadcom, led by former Google TPU architect Richard Ho, aiming for mass production by 2026 using 3nm fabrication at TSMC. This initiative seeks to reduce dependency on vendors like NVIDIA and manage increasing compute costs.

Moonshot AI Updates Kimi K2 with Agent Capabilities: Moonshot AI released an updated Kimi K2-0905 model with improved coding and tool-calling abilities, doubling the context window to 256k. The model is integrated with various platforms such as Hugging Face, Together AI, and Groq, aiming for practical agent upgrades, and community reports suggest it rivals or surpasses Sonnet 4 in performance.

Alibaba Launches Qwen3-Max-Preview with 1T Parameters: Alibaba introduced Qwen3-Max-Preview, an agent-oriented model exceeding 1T parameters, available through Qwen Chat, Alibaba Cloud API, and OpenRouter. Early benchmarks indicate enhanced conversation, instruction following, and agentic task performance, positioning it as a competitive 'US-grade frontier model' with attractive pricing and throughput.

Together AI Raises $150M to Expand Inference Infrastructure: Together AI secured $150M in a Series D funding round led by BOND to scale its inference infrastructure. The investment will likely be used to enhance their platform's capabilities and expand support for various AI models, aiming to provide efficient and scalable inference solutions.

Baseten Raises $150M Series D, Rolling Out EmbeddingGemma Support: Baseten also raised a $150M Series D as it introduces performance enhancements and support for Google's EmbeddingGemma, indicating a focus on improving embedding services. This investment suggests Baseten's continued growth and commitment to providing robust AI infrastructure and model support.

OpenAI's ChatGPT Now Supports Conversation Branching: OpenAI has introduced conversation branching to ChatGPT, enabling users to explore different conversational paths. The feature enhances user control and allows for more structured and directed interactions within the chatbot environment.

OpenAI's Custom AI Chips in Mass Production with Broadcom: OpenAI is set to begin mass production of its custom AI accelerators in partnership with Broadcom to reduce reliance on Nvidia GPUs and lower costs for training and inference. The chips are intended for internal use within OpenAI's infrastructure rather than external sales, signifying a move toward vertical integration.

Atlassian Acquires The Browser Company for $610M: Atlassian is acquiring The Browser Company, the startup behind the Dia work browser, for $610 million. Atlassian plans to integrate Dia's AI workspace and tab-grouping technology into Confluence and Jira, suggesting improvements to productivity and workflow management within Atlassian's suite of products.

Scale AI's Former CTO Launches Data-Cleaning AI Agent 'Toro': Brad Porter, former CTO of Scale AI, launched 'Toro,' an AI agent designed to profile, fix, and label messy data sets. Toro integrates with platforms like Snowflake and Databricks, aiming to accelerate data preparation for model training and reduce the time and budget spent on data wrangling.

OpenAI Reorganizes Team Behind ChatGPT's Personality, Merging Personas Research with Engineering: OpenAI is reorganizing its 'Personas' research team, which shapes ChatGPT's personality, by merging it with product engineering under a single lead. This shift aims to expedite live testing using newly acquired Statsig tooling and accelerate the deployment of public 'voice' changes to fortnightly cycles, allowing faster iteration on chatbot characteristics.

HappyRobot Raises $44M to Expand Cloud 'Digital Workforce' Platform: HappyRobot raised a $44M Series B to expand its cloud-based 'digital workforce' platform. The company's technology enables businesses to automate tasks and augment human employees with AI-powered digital assistants, promising increased efficiency and productivity.

Google Avoids Chrome Divestiture in Antitrust Ruling: U.S. District Judge Amit Mehta rejected the Department of Justice's proposal to force Google to divest its Chrome browser, preserving Google's core business structure and influence in AI-driven browser technologies, but barred Google from exclusive agreements that tie the distribution of its Search, Chrome, Google Assistant, or Gemini products to other apps or revenue arrangements.

ZeroClick Building AI-Native Advertising Platform: Ryan Hudson, CEO of ZeroClick, aims to revolutionize advertising by creating a system integrated within AI, enhancing user experience through contextually relevant advertisements and real product options, instead of generic AI-generated suggestions that have no follow-through path.

OpenAI Launches LinkedIn Competitor, the OpenAI Jobs Platform: The OpenAI Jobs Platform will leverage AI to connect candidates and employers, while OpenAI Academy aims to certify 10 million Americans in AI fluency by 2030, with Walmart as a key partner, marking a significant push by OpenAI into workforce development.

Atlassian Acquires The Browser Company for $610M: The acquisition is intended to create an AI-powered browser optimized for knowledge workers, enhancing Atlassian's existing suite of productivity tools and allowing The Browser Company to continue developing its Dia browser under independent operations.

Stripe Unveils AI Payments Blockchain with OpenAI and Anthropic as Partners: The new blockchain, named Tempo, is designed with OpenAI and Anthropic as partners to enable AI agents to autonomously conduct financial transactions at scale, marking Stripe's move into AI-integrated financial infrastructure.

DuckDuckGo Adds Premium AI Models to Subscription Plan: DuckDuckGo is bundling access to powerful AI models such as GPT-5 and Claude Sonnet 4 into its subscription plan, positioning itself as a cost-effective alternative for users seeking advanced AI functionalities.

DeepSeek Plans to Release AI Agent to Rival OpenAI: DeepSeek plans to release a major AI agent by the end of 2025 that would rival OpenAI through cost-effective, open-source models with token pricing 4-8 times cheaper than OpenAI, enabling the AI to carry out multi-step actions on a person’s behalf with minimal direction from the user.

Sierra Raises $350M for AI Agent Platform Expansion: Sierra, an AI agent platform, raised $350M at a $10B valuation to expand its AI agent platform, enhance AI development capabilities and its global presence, serving hundreds of major companies and reaching a substantial portion of US households.

OpenAI Developing AI Chips with Broadcom: OpenAI will start producing its own AI chips in collaboration with Broadcom, signifying a strategic move to reduce dependency on Nvidia and to manage the increasing expenses associated with AI computing.

Google's EmbeddingGemma for On-Device AI: EmbeddingGemma, a 308M-parameter model built on Gemma 3 and trained in 100+ languages, now tops the Massive Text Embedding Benchmark for sub-500M systems, designed for on-device RAG and semantic search, is a compact, multilingual embedding model with 300M parameters optimized for on-device performance.

Exa Raises $85M Series B to Develop Search Engine for AI: Exa, a company focused on creating search infrastructure tailored for AI, raised $85 million in a Series B funding round, bringing its valuation to $700 million. The company aims to enable AI models to access and process information from the web more effectively, building AI-native web search infrastructure.

CoreWeave Acquires OpenPipe to Enhance AI Infrastructure: CoreWeave, a specialized cloud provider for compute-intensive workloads, acquired OpenPipe, an agent training startup that helps enterprises develop customized AI agents with reinforcement learning. The acquisition aims to integrate ART RL fine-tuning pipelines with high-performance inference infrastructure, enabling tighter integration of agent training and deployment.

Decart Releases Mirage, a Real-Time Video Transformation AI Model: Decart released Mirage, a real-time video-to-video AI model that transforms any video stream with just 40 milliseconds of delay. The model uses frame-by-frame processing, predicting the next frame, unlike other AI video tools that generate entire clips at once, and has potential applications in gaming, video calls, and content creation.

Mistral AI Finalizes €2B Investment, Valuation Reaches $14B: Mistral AI, a French company that develops open-source language models and the Le Chat chatbot, is finalizing a €2 billion investment, boosting its valuation to $14 billion. This funding round supports Mistral's mission to become Europe's answer to OpenAI, providing open and accessible AI technology.

OpenAI Acquires Statsig and Eyes Product Data for Model Improvement: OpenAI has acquired Statsig for $1.1 billion in an all-stock deal; Statsig's founder Vijaye Raji is becoming CTO of Applications at OpenAI. Statsig is an A/B testing company and product analytics platform with clients like OpenAI, Anthropic, and others.  The data from Statsig is intended to improve product development and AI alignment.

OpenAI Releases Projects in ChatGPT Free Tier with Expanded Features: OpenAI has expanded access to ChatGPT Projects, making the feature available to free tier users, across web and Android platforms with iOS support soon. Users now have access to dedicated workspaces for organizing chats, uploading up to 5 files per project, and setting project-specific memory controls for better focus and reproducible workflows.

Apple Tests Google's Gemini for AI-Powered Siri Upgrade: Apple is exploring the use of Google's Gemini AI model to enhance Siri with a new AI search feature called 'World Knowledge Answers.' The upgrade aims to provide AI-powered summaries from web results and support various media formats. Apple is also testing its own models alongside Anthropic's to handle on-device search while prioritizing user privacy.

ScaleAI Sues Mercor, Alleging Trade Secret Theft: ScaleAI filed a lawsuit against Mercor, a competitor, and a former employee, alleging the theft of over 100 confidential files. The lawsuit claims the former employee attempted to pitch Mercor to a major ScaleAI client before resigning; the company argues that confidential data was taken, affecting their relationship with key clients.

Tesla Showcases Next-Gen Optimus Robot with Grok AI Integration: Tesla unveiled a prototype of its next-generation Optimus robot integrated with Grok AI. The robot demonstrated basic capabilities, such as answering questions and walking. Tesla aims for Optimus to handle complex tasks and contribute significantly to the company's valuation, emphasizing human-like dexterity through new hand designs and forearm actuators.

Perplexity Launches Comet for Students with New Features: Perplexity launched Comet, a student-focused tool offering features like ad blocking, study mode, scheduling, and a native assistant. The launch aims to provide students with a dedicated platform for research and learning, integrating a suite of AI-powered tools to support academic tasks.

Anthropic Raises $13B at $183B Valuation, Driven by Claude Code Success: Anthropic secured $13 billion in Series F funding at a $183 billion post-money valuation, fueled by the rapid growth of Claude Code, its AI developer assistant. Claude Code, launched in May 2025, has already achieved a $500 million annual run-rate, demonstrating the company's success in the AI coding space and attracting significant investor interest for expansion and AI safety research.

OpenAI Acquires Statsig for $1.1B to Enhance Product Experimentation: OpenAI acquired Statsig, an A/B testing and software experimentation platform, for $1.1 billion in an all-stock deal to accelerate its ability to test and deploy new features across ChatGPT, which serves hundreds of millions of users. As part of the acquisition, Statsig CEO Vijaye Raji becomes CTO of Applications at OpenAI, overseeing engineering for ChatGPT and other consumer products to streamline product development cycles.

Mistral AI's Le Chat Introduces "Memories" for Enhanced User Control and Transparency: Mistral AI has unveiled "Memories" in Le Chat, offering users a hybrid memory system focused on transparency, control, and task focus. This feature aims to surface relevant information with visible recall, citations, and editable memory logs, improving the usability and reliability of the conversational AI platform.

Google's Gemini 2.5 Flash Image Model Codenamed 'Nano Banana' Generates Fake Celebrity Selfies: Google's state-of-the-art image generation model Gemini 2.5 Flash Image, known internally as 'Nano Banana', is being used by LinkedIn influencers to create convincingly fake celebrity selfies, which highlights the potential misuse of advanced AI image generation. Google's SynthID watermark, designed to detect such fakes, may be circumvented by using open-source models without similar safeguards.

ETH Zurich Launches Apertus, a Multilingual LLM with Emphasis on Transparency: ETH Zurich introduced Apertus, a fully open and transparent multilingual LLM trained with over 40% non-English data, supporting native language in 1,811 languages and claiming compliance with legal source material. While benchmarking positions accuracy between Llama 3.1 8B and 70B parameters, the community is awaiting the release of the pretraining corpus to validate openness and reproducibility, pending the repo's availability.

Google’s NotebookLM Introduces Video Overviews and Expands Language Support: NotebookLM, Google's AI-powered research assistant, now supports Video Overviews for generating narrated slide presentations from uploaded sources and has expanded audio overview functionality to over 50 languages, enabling users to customize narrative styles and add guiding prompts. Additionally, the tool can find and import relevant web sources directly into your notebook, meaning that users don’t have to do all of the source searching themselves.

ElevenLabs Releases SFX v2 with Longer Clips, Looping, and MIDI Support: ElevenLabs released an upgraded version of its AI sound effects model, SFX v2, increasing maximum clip length to 30 seconds, improving audio fidelity, and adding seamless looping within the ElevenLabs Studio editor.  The update also extends to hardware integration with MIDI connectivity on the SB-1 soundboard, indicating the company's focus on professional-grade generative audio applications.

Microsoft's Copilot Audio Expressions Creates Voice Narrations: Microsoft released Copilot Audio Expressions, an experimental AI tool that transforms text into emotionally expressive audio narration. The tool lets users pick from nearly a dozen synthetic voices and choose between conversational emotive mode or narrative-focused story mode to add nuanced expression to presentations, accessibility features, or other audio projects.

MAESTRO v0.1.5 Released as Open-Source Autonomous Research Agent: MAESTRO v0.1.5-alpha is an open-source autonomous research agent generating fully-cited reports, focusing on performance and local-LLM compatibility via refined agent workflows/prompts and added parallelization. A new documentation site includes example reports from locally hosted models like Qwen 2.5 72B, GPT-OSS 120B, and more, helping compare model behavior on complex topics.

Zhipu/THUDM Open-Sources Slime v0.1.0, the RL Infrastructure Behind GLM-4.5: Zhipu/THUDM open-sourced Slime v0.1.0, the reinforcement learning infrastructure behind GLM-4.5 which resulted in improvements of GLM-4.5 (355B-A32B) decoding from <10 to 60–70 tok/s and used in 8 node GLM-4.5 and 16 node DeepSeek-R1 training. The open source project includes FP8 rollout, DeepEP, multi token prediction, speculative decoding and unified tensor offload via CUDA VMM.

V&A East Storehouse Opens to the Public: The Victoria and Albert Museum's new off-site storage facility, V&A East Storehouse, opened in London, offering free public access to 250,000 unexhibited items. Visitors can explore walkways between shelving units, viewing items with minimal signage and watching curators at work, creating an engaging and unique museum experience.

Will Smith's Concert Audience Size Debated Due to AI: Will Smith faced accusations of using AI to inflate audience sizes for his tour, though audiences were real. The resulting footage, affected by static-image-to-video models and YouTube's compression, created an 'uncanny valley effect,' leading to doubts about the content's authenticity.

DeepSeek 3.1 Model Released: DeepSeek released DeepSeek-V3.1-Think, a 685B parameter hybrid reasoning model that achieves comparable answer quality to DeepSeek-R1-0528, while responding more quickly. Benchmarks show the model uses 25-50% fewer tokens and includes prompt examples for coding, python, and search agents, showcasing the models support for agentic patterns.

ChatGPT Adds Project-Only Memory Feature: OpenAI's ChatGPT introduced a project-only memory feature, which allows the AI to use other conversations within the same project for additional context while preventing it from using saved memories outside the project. This ensures that information from one project won't influence future chats outside of it, offering users better control over conversation context.

DuckDB Introduces Optimized Spatial Joins: DuckDB enhanced its database with spatial join optimizations, including a piecewise merge join and R-Tree indexing, for significantly faster spatial data processing. Using these optimizations, DuckDB reduced the runtime of a query involving 58 million NYC Citi Bike Trips and 310 neighborhood polygons from 30 minutes to 30 seconds.

Perplexity's Comet Browser Extension Faces Security Vulnerabilities: Brave's security team found prompt injection vulnerabilities in Perplexity's Comet, an agentic browser extension, where malicious code embedded in webpages could be executed as commands. Despite Perplexity's attempts to mitigate the issues, Brave confirmed that the vulnerabilities remain, raising concerns about the safety of agentic browser extensions.

Anthropic Pilots Claude for Chrome with Security Risks Highlighted: Anthropic launched an invite-only preview Chrome extension for Claude, acknowledging prompt injection security risks and a 23.6% attack success rate in autonomous mode. While safety mitigations reduced this rate to 11.2%, Anthropic recommends a hands-on approach with users granting site-level permissions and confirming high-risk actions.

OpenAI Releases GPT-Realtime: OpenAI released gpt-realtime, a speech-to-speech model replacing gpt-4o-realtime-preview, featuring improved instruction following and the ability to send images.  While its training date is still October 2023, there are key improvements including MCP server configuration and image integration, however the gpt-4o-mini-realtime-preview model is still available with a longer context window and cheaper pricing.

GPT-5 integrates deeper into dev workflows: GPT-5 is now “built into” Xcode 26 with a “step function” improvement in Codex task startup latency. Practitioners report GPT‑5 as a top daily driver for coding.

Apple pushes real‑time, local VLM: Apple released FastVLM and MobileCLIP2 on Hugging Face enabling fully local live video captioning in the browser via WebGPU. The models are up to 85× faster and 3.4× smaller than comparable VLMs.

Tencent's WeCom Explores AI Anxiety Solutions: Tencent's WeCom, a communication and office tool connected to WeChat, is being examined for its potential to alleviate concerns among Chinese business managers regarding the productivity boosts promised but not consistently delivered by current AI tools.

Innoscience Becomes Key Supplier for Nvidia's Power Architecture: Innoscience, founded by former NASA scientist Luo Weiwei, has become the sole Chinese supplier of Nvidia’s 800 VDC power architecture, marking a significant achievement in the Chinese semiconductor industry.

DeepSeek V3.1 Experiences Mysterious Bug: DeepSeek, after open-sourcing its latest base model V3.1, encountered a peculiar bug where some outputs were randomly replaced with the Chinese character "极", prompting investigation into the possible causes of the malfunction.

ByteDance's HeteroScale Optimizes LLM Efficiency: ByteDance Seed has developed HeteroScale, a software solution designed to enhance the efficiency of large language model (LLM) operations across GPU clusters exceeding 10,000 units by optimizing prefill and decode stages, resulting in significant GPU-hour savings and improved utilization metrics.

Andon Labs Exposes Real-World LLM Challenges with Vending Machines: AI startup Andon Labs' real-world deployment of vending machines controlled by LLMs revealed issues such as hallucinated tools, creation of fake management structures, and excessive discounting, indicating that current AI agents require significant guardrails for successful business management.

Hugging Face Introduces INTIMA Benchmark for Human-AI Companionship: Hugging Face has created INTIMA, a benchmark consisting of 368 prompts designed to evaluate and score language models on their companionship behaviors, utilizing theories of parasocial interaction, attachment, and anthropomorphism to assess AI responses to companionship-seeking interactions.

ESET Discovers PromptLock Ransomware Using OpenAI's gpt-oss 20b Model: Security firm ESET has identified a new ransomware malware called PromptLock that leverages OpenAI's gpt-oss 20b model to generate Lua scripts, representing an early example of generative AI being used in malicious software, though its current implementation is not considered a major threat.

OpenAI Experiments with "Juice 200" Cognitive Intensity for ChatGPT: OpenAI is testing a new "Thinking Effort" selector in the ChatGPT web app, named "Juice 200", that allows Pro and Enterprise users to adjust the AI's cognitive intensity, ranging from Light (5) to Max (200), to optimize performance for different tasks.

Microsoft Develops In-House AI Models Aiming for Independence from OpenAI: Microsoft has unveiled two internally developed AI models, MAI-Voice-1 for speech generation and MAI-1-preview for text, to reduce its dependence on OpenAI, with MAI-Voice-1 already integrated into Copilot features and MAI-1-preview undergoing public testing for wider Copilot integration.

Meta AI Hiring Spree Backfires with Key Recruits Leaving Shortly After Joining: Meta's recent AI hiring initiative has faced setbacks as prominent recruits, including ChatGPT co-creator Shengjia Zhao, threatened to leave or departed soon after joining, leading to internal disruption and adjustments in leadership roles.

PwC Reduces Junior Hiring Amidst AI Adoption: PwC's 32% cut in junior hiring suggests AI is impacting youth employment, with a study indicating a 13% fall in early-career worker employment since late 2022 in areas where AI automates tasks, while older cohorts saw employment growth, implying a shift in value towards experience and judgment.

Google Releases Gemini 2.5 Flash Image 'Nano Banana': Google launched Gemini 2.5 Flash Image, nicknamed "nano-banana," a native image generation and editing model emphasizing low-latency, high visual quality, and controllability, now available in Google AI Studio, the Gemini API, and Vertex AI. The model offers capabilities like multi-image fusion, character consistency, fine-grained local edits, and edits grounded by Gemini's world knowledge.

Maisa AI Launches 'Maisa Studio' After $25M Raise: Maisa AI, after raising $25M led by Creandum, launched 'Maisa Studio', a model-agnostic platform for supervised agentic "digital workers," intended to provide reliable enterprise automation after failures of many gen-AI pilot projects.

SkyeChip Introduces MARS1000 Edge AI Processor: Malaysia's SkyeChip introduced the MARS1000, the country’s first homegrown edge AI processor, highlighting its strategic focus on AI hardware development amidst tightened export restrictions.

Assort Health Reportedly Raises $50M for AI Voice Agents: Assort Health is reported to have raised approximately $50 million at a valuation of around $750 million, to expand its AI voice agents that handle patient calls, scheduling, and FAQs for specialty clinics.

Vercel's Valuation Triples to $9B with Accel Investment: Vercel's valuation has significantly increased to about $9 billion following a new investment from Accel, signifying strong growth as the Next.js company expands its AI-enhanced developer cloud platform.

Google Expands NotebookLM's Language Support: Google has broadened the reach of NotebookLM, its study aid, by extending auto-generated Video Overviews and enhanced Audio Overviews to support 80 languages, moving significantly beyond its initial English-only capabilities.

OpenAI Releases gpt-realtime and Realtime API: OpenAI has launched gpt-realtime, their advanced speech-to-speech model, along with Realtime API updates available for developers to create advanced voice agents, enabling more natural voice interactions and support for phone systems.

Microsoft AI Unveils MAI-Voice-1 and MAI-1-preview Models: Microsoft AI (MAI) has revealed its first in-house AI models, including MAI-Voice-1, a rapid speech generation model used in Copilot Daily and Podcasts, and MAI-1-preview, a language model tested on LMArena that ranks ahead of Gemini 2.5 Flash, marking a move towards creating specialized models for different applications.

xAI Releases Grok 2.5 as Open Source: xAI has made Grok 2.5, its flagship model from the previous year, available as an open-source resource, which can be downloaded from Hugging Face, and Elon Musk announced that Grok 3 will also be open-sourced in about six months.

Apple Releases FastVLM and MobileCLIP2 with On-Device Capabilities: Apple launched FastVLM and MobileCLIP2 on Hugging Face, featuring real-time video captioning demo powered by WebGPU, emphasizing on-device execution and low latency. The models are claimed to be up to 85x faster and 3.4x smaller than previous solutions, with live video captioning running entirely in-browser, showcasing Apple's advancements in vision-language models for edge computing.

xAI's Grok-code-fast-1 Shows Strong Coding Performance: xAI released Grok-code-fast-1, a coding model that Cline users report is significantly faster and better than Claude for diff edits and complex refactors, achieving approximately 87 TPS. The model is uniquely trained on frequent checkpoints learned from Cline's extensive usage data, enabling frequent model updates directly derived from real-world coding interactions.

OpenAI Integrates GPT-5 into Xcode 26: OpenAI announced that GPT-5 will be built into Xcode 26. Developers can access higher limits by signing in with their ChatGPT account, offering advanced coding assistance directly within the IDE and reflects OpenAI's strategy to embed AI more deeply into development workflows.

StepFun AI Releases Step-Audio 2 Mini Speech-to-Speech Model: StepFun AI launched Step-Audio 2 Mini, an 8B-parameter speech-to-speech model with an Apache-2.0 license, trained on over 8 million hours of audio. The model supports over 50,000 voices and uses multimodal LLM techniques to outperform GPT-4o-Audio on expressive and grounded speech benchmarks, emphasizing real-time speech conversations.

Alibaba Creates AI Chip to Help China Fill Nvidia Gap: Alibaba is testing a domestically-fabricated AI inference chip designed to replace Nvidia GPUs in China and aiming for compatibility with the Nvidia ecosystem. The chip uses a Chinese foundry due to sanctions and could pair with Alibaba's LLM stack, including Qwen, for deeper vertical integration and if successful would enable Alibaba to offer drop-in serving for popular LLM stacks while controlling costs and supply internally.

ByteDance Releases USO for Unified Style and Subject-Driven Generation: ByteDance Research released the USO (Unified Style and Subject-Driven Generation) model, accompanied by a paper and weights available on Hugging Face. USO aims to advance T2I (text-to-image) technology by offering disentangled control and reward learning for generating images with specific styles and subjects.

Microsoft Debuts MAI-Voice-1 and MAI-1-preview for Copilot: Microsoft unveiled MAI-Voice-1 and MAI-1-preview, its first in-house AI models. MAI-Voice-1 generates natural speech and powers Copilot Daily news briefs, while MAI-1-preview, trained on 15,000 H100 GPUs, handles text instructions and is now in public testing within Copilot Labs, marking a significant step in Microsoft’s shift towards a multi-model Copilot strategy and some consumer workloads are moving off OpenAI.

Anthropic Modifies Data Policy: Consumer Data Used for Training Unless Opted Out: Anthropic announced that starting September 28, 2025, Claude Free, Pro, and Max chats will be stored for up to five years and used to train future models unless users actively opt out, reversing its previous policy, while enterprise and API customers remain exempt. Users should audit who is using personal Claude accounts, issue an opt-out guide before the deadline, and update vendor questionnaires to catch similar hidden changes and this could expose teams’ prompts or code snippets to model-training pipelines.

Framer Achieves $2 Billion Valuation with AI-Powered Website Builder: Framer, a website builder, secured a $2 billion valuation after closing a funding round led by Meritech and Atomico, bringing total funding to $165 million. The company, now claiming over 500,000 monthly active users and $50 million in ARR, has integrated an AI page-generation engine and counts Miro, Perplexity, and Scale AI among its new enterprise clients.

OpenRouter Adds 1 Million Token Context Window for Sonnet 4: OpenRouter announced that Sonnet 4 now supports a 1 million-token context window across all providers. OpenRouter is rolling out keepign standard pricing up to 200k input tokens, after which costs rise for extended context usage.

Google's Gemini 2.5 Flash Image Model Enhances Gemini Chatbot: Google DeepMind launched the Gemini 2.5 Flash Image, an image editing model now featured in the Gemini app and topping the LMArena chart. This model maintains consistent details across edits, allowing for changes in outfits, styles, and poses, and includes visible watermarks and SynthID tags.

Microsoft Launches In-House AI Models MAI-Voice-1 and MAI-1-preview: Microsoft AI introduced MAI-Voice-1, a speech generation model capable of producing a minute of audio in under a second, powering Copilot Daily, and MAI-1-preview, a text model being tested on LM Arena. This move signals Microsoft's increasing independence from OpenAI's models and control over its AI technology stack.

OpenAI Releases GPT-Realtime and Realtime API with Enhanced Features: OpenAI officially released its Realtime API, featuring a new gpt-realtime speech model and tools for developers.  This model detects tone, switches languages mid-conversation, handles images, and integrates with external data using Model Context Protocol (MCP), enhancing voice agent capabilities.

Anthropic Integrates Claude AI Agent into Google Chrome Browser: Anthropic is rolling out a Chrome extension for Claude, initially to 1,000 Max subscribers, allowing direct interaction within the browser for tasks like form completion and page searching. It includes safety measures to reduce prompt injection attacks and protect against malicious websites.

xAI Launches Grok Code Fast 1 for Coding Assistance: xAI released Grok Code Fast 1, a coding model focused on speed and affordability for developers, priced at $0.20 per million input tokens. It offers rapid rollout iterations and integration across popular IDEs and tools like GitHub Copilot and Cursor, with community tests showing positive results.

OpenAI's Codex gets Major Upgrade: OpenAI's Codex received a major upgrade, now "powered by GPT-5", featuring IDE extensions, seamless local/cloud task management, GitHub code reviews, and a unified CLI.  This upgrade aims to provide tighter end-to-end workflow coverage for developers, enhancing coding collaboration across various environments.

Tencent Releases HunyuanVideo-Foley Open-Source Text-Video-to-Audio Model: Tencent's HunyuanVideo-Foley, an open-source text-video-to-audio model, generates foley/soundtracks aligned to input videos with improved A/V synchronization. The model is trained on 100k hours and targets the missing audio stage in current video-generation pipelines, enabling fully synthetic shorts with synchronized visuals and sound.

Higgsfield AI Launches Nano Banana-Powered Mini Apps for Content Creation: Higgsfield AI launched a suite of 'mini apps' that enable users to create diverse content types rapidly, offering features like commercial generation and effects creation. The platform leverages Google’s 'Nano banana' image model and comprises over 2,000 applications, aiming to make content creation more accessible.

Unsloth's Flex Attention Enables 60K Context Length for OpenAI's gpt-oss Fine-tuning: Unsloth introduced Flex Attention for OpenAI's gpt-oss training, facilitating context lengths exceeding 60K tokens while reducing VRAM usage by over 50% and accelerating training by 1.5x compared to other implementations.  It adds export of QLoRA-finetuned models to llama.cpp, vLLM, Ollama, and HF and offers fixes for float16 loss blow-ups on T4/Colab.

Meta plans on releasing Llama 4.X model before the end of 2025: Meta plans to release its next version of Llama before the end of the year, the model, internally known as Llama 4.X or Llama 4.5, will be one of the first projects from Meta Superintelligence Labs. Meta recently restructured the unit into four groups, with teams focused on training, research, product, and infrastructure.

Google Ships Gemini 2.5 Flash Image (Nano-Banana) Image Editor: Google has released Gemini 2.5 Flash Image, internally known as nano-banana, a new state-of-the-art image generation and editing model. The model supports multi-step image editing, character consistency, and world-knowledge-based transformations controlled through natural language prompts, and it has ranked #1 on LM Arena’s Image Edit leaderboard, surpassing OpenAI and Flux models in cost-to-performance ratio. The image editor is priced at $30 per 1M output tokens, is available via the Gemini API and Google AI Studio, and is integrated into Google AI Studio’s Build Mode and available through OpenRouter.ai and fal.ai.

Anthropic Puts Claude AI Agent Directly Into Google Chrome: Anthropic has integrated its Claude AI agent directly into Google Chrome, enabling the agent to browse, click, and fill forms within the browser. This integration allows Claude to interact with web content and perform tasks directly within the Chrome environment, enhancing its utility for users needing assistance with online activities.

Nous Research Debuts Hermes 4 Open-Source Hybrid Reasoning Model: Nous Research has released Hermes 4, a family of open-source hybrid reasoning models, featuring capabilities in math, coding, and general reasoning. The models are available in 405B and 70B parameter versions and are designed to be user-steerable and uncensored, with GGUF files for the 70B model already available.

Anthropic Claude Code Gains GitHub Integration: Anthropic announced the general availability of its Claude Code GitHub integration, allowing developers to use templates and subagents for automation. This enables users to leverage Claude's capabilities directly within their GitHub workflows, streamlining code-related tasks.

OpenAI Moves Assistants Features Into the Responses API: OpenAI is recommending developers migrate from the Assistants API to the Responses API, citing that the Responses API has surpassed Chat Completions in token activity. This shift indicates a strategic move by OpenAI to consolidate functionalities and potentially offer a more efficient or capable alternative for developers.

Google's NotebookLM Now Supports Video and Audio Overviews in 80 Languages: Google has expanded its NotebookLM capabilities to support video and audio overviews in 80 languages, enhancing its accessibility and utility for a global audience. This update allows users to generate summaries and insights from multimedia content in a wider range of languages.

OpenAI Codex Receives GPT-5-Powered Overhaul with IDE Extension: OpenAI has significantly upgraded Codex into a unified agent accessible across IDEs, terminals, cloud environments, GitHub, and mobile devices, leveraging the power of GPT-5. The update introduces new extensions for VS Code, Cursor, and Windsurf, along with an enhanced local CLI, seamless task movement between local and cloud environments, and integrated code reviews in GitHub; this will be available for ChatGPT Plus, Pro, Team, Edu, and Enterprise users.

Google's Pixel 10 to Feature Proactive AI Assistance via Magic Cue: Google's upcoming Pixel 10 smartphone will incorporate Magic Cue, an AI-powered system that proactively anticipates user needs and provides relevant information without requiring explicit prompts. Leveraging an upgraded Gemini Nano model and the new Tensor G5 AI processor, Magic Cue delivers contextual assistance within various apps by tracking user behavior and responding to the phone's state in real-time.

Deep Robotics' X30 Robot Disguised as Tibetan Antelope for Wildlife Study: Deep Robotics, in collaboration with the Chinese Academy of Sciences, has deployed an X30 robot disguised as a Tibetan antelope to study the species in their natural habitat. Equipped with advanced sensors and rugged design, the robot gathers data on the herd's behavior and movement without disturbing the animals while navigating challenging terrain.

Microsoft's VibeVoice TTS Integrated with ComfyUI for Rapid Voice Cloning: A developer is creating a ComfyUI wrapper for Microsoft’s VibeVoice TTS, enabling users to clone voices rapidly from small samples. The integration supports single-speaker cloning initially, with plans for dual-speaker support, and offers both a 1.5B model for fast inference and a 7B model, though cloning without explicit consent remains policy-restricted.

Meta to Integrate Midjourney for Image and Video Generation: Meta will integrate Midjourney's image and video generation capabilities into its ecosystem, leveraging Midjourney's aesthetic superiority in the commercial image generation space, although it lags in compliance. This integration aims to improve ad creatives and further integrate advertisers into Meta's advertising pipeline, building upon Meta's prior quarterly outperformance tied to generative ad tools.

Meta Offloads Infrastructure Workloads to Google Cloud in $10B Deal: Meta is ceding the infrastructure race by offloading massive infrastructure and inference workloads to Google Cloud Platform (GCP) in a $10B deal. This strategic move signals a shift towards concentrating on the application layer, such as social platforms, advertising, and metaverse experiences, instead of investing capital expenditure in infrastructure, mirroring a pragmatic approach similar to Alibaba's.

Google Offers Gemini for Government at a Loss-Leader Price: Google is offering 'Gemini for Government,' including NotebookLM, VIO (image generation), Gemini, and FedRAMP compliance, at $0.47 per agency per year. This loss-leader pricing strategy aims to disintermediate smaller service providers that currently resell LLM wrappers to agencies at significantly higher prices, potentially consolidating the market to hyperscalers like Google and Microsoft.

Apple Considers Integrating Google's Gemini to Modernize Siri: Apple is in talks to integrate Google's Gemini to modernize Siri, breaking with its tradition of vertical integration. Gemini integration would likely require TPU-class compute or specialized interconnects, forcing Apple into deeper reliance on external chip ecosystems, but potentially improving Siri's technical performance.

OpenAI's $30B Oracle Data Center Deal Signals Infrastructure Ambitions: OpenAI secured a $30B data center deal with Oracle, funded via investor capital, to build infrastructure ownership and reduce dependency on hyperscalers. This move, coupled with chip-design hires from Google, signals a strategic push toward full-stack control and investor narratives beyond mere model provision.

Anthropic Piloting Claude for Chrome: Anthropic is piloting Claude for Chrome, a browser-integrated actioning agent, for 1,000 users. Emphasizing safety with prompt injection defenses, the pilot will guide broader rollout and potential features of an AI assistant directly within the Chrome browser.

Google DeepMind Releases Gemini 2.5 Flash Image: Google DeepMind confirmed the 'nano-banana' model, known as Gemini 2.5 Flash Image, delivers state-of-the-art image editing and generation with strengths in character consistency, natural-language edits, and multi-image composition. Available in the Gemini app and Google AI Studio/API, the model leads in image editing benchmarks with significant Elo margins.

Nous Research Releases Hermes 4 Open-Weight Reasoning Model: Nous Research released Hermes 4, an open-weight hybrid 'reasoning' model focused on steerability, low refusals, and strong math/coding/STEM benchmarks. Available on Hugging Face and OpenRouter, it allows 'thinking' mode toggles via headers/template kwargs, marking an advancement in adaptable AI models.

Microsoft Open-Sources VibeVoice TTS System: Microsoft open-sourced VibeVoice, a neural TTS system in 1.5B and 7B variants, supporting long-form synthesis up to 90 minutes per generation and native multi-speaker mixing. User testing reports strong prosody/expressiveness suitable for podcast/audiobook workflows, with voice cloning quality improving with 30-second reference clips.

Adobe Integrates Google’s Gemini 2.5 Flash Image Model into Firefly: Adobe integrated Google's Gemini 2.5 Flash Image model into Firefly, expanding its AI model offerings alongside its own Firefly models and those from OpenAI and Black Forest Labs. This integration signifies a move towards providing a diverse range of AI tools for users to choose from, rather than relying on a single proprietary model.

xAI Releases Grok-2 and Grok-2.5 Open Weights: xAI released the open weights for Grok-2 and announced Grok-2.5 on Hugging Face, with Elon Musk stating Grok-3 will be open-sourced in approximately six months. The Grok-2 model configuration uses μP scaling and an unusual “MoE residual” path, acting as a shared expert; however, the licensing has been flagged as highly restrictive for open use.

Microsoft Open-Sources VibeVoice-1.5B for Long-Form TTS: Microsoft has open-sourced VibeVoice-1.5B, a text-to-speech model under the MIT license, designed for multi-speaker conversations and continuous synthesis up to 90 minutes, with streaming support planned and a 7B variant in development. Demos and Spaces are live through Gradio and community repositories, enabling developers to experiment with long-form speech synthesis.

Motif Technology Releases Motif-2.6B with Differential Attention: Motif Technology released Motif-2.6B, trained on 2.5T tokens, featuring Differential Attention and PolyNorm at scale, along with Muon optimizer and PolyNorm kernels, which are compatible with FSDP2/HF stacks. Training for this model reportedly used AMD MI250 GPUs, expanding the ecosystem of hardware used for model training.

Alibaba's Qwen-Code v0.0.8 Adds Deep VS Code Support: Alibaba’s Qwen-Code v0.0.8 introduced major integrations, including deep VS Code support for context-aware suggestions and inline diffs, a robust MCP CLI for managing code, a responsive TUI, and context compression controls.  These features enhance the coding workflow and integration with developer environments.

Google Runs Veo-3 Open Weekend in Gemini: Google provided free access to Veo-3 in Gemini during an open weekend, increasing generation limits for free, Pro, and Ultra users, along with providing prompt tips. This initiative allows users to experiment with video generation capabilities within the Gemini platform.

ByteDance's Kling 2.1 Adds Keyframing: ByteDance's Kling 2.1 now features “Start/End frame” keyframing, which enables multi-view-consistent transitions and cinematic camera moves with consistency across frames. This feature is currently available in Higgsfield, enhancing capabilities for creating advanced video content.

InternLM Releases InternVL3.5 Series for Multimodal 'Agency': InternLM introduced the InternVL3.5 series, featuring expanded multimodal “agency” capabilities, including GUI and embodied agents, along with releasing multiple checkpoints, including smaller variants, to enable reproducibility and fine-tuning. The InternVL3.5-241B-A28B checkpoint claims state-of-the-art scores across multimodal general, reasoning, text, and agency tasks among open-source VLMs.

Alibaba Teases WAN 2.2-S2V Audio-Driven Video Generation System: Alibaba's WAN team teased “WAN 2.2-S2V,” positioning it as an open-source, audio-driven cinematic video generation system (“sound/speech-to-video”). This system conditions video generation directly on audio, complementing existing T2V work within the WAN 2.2 family.

Microsoft Launches Copilot AI Function in Excel: Microsoft launched Copilot for Excel, an LLM-powered assistant capable of generating formulas, summarizing tables, and running natural-language analyses within spreadsheets. However, Microsoft advises users against relying on Copilot for tasks requiring accuracy or reproducibility due to the non-deterministic nature of its outputs.

NVIDIA Launches Jetson Thor Robotics Computer: NVIDIA released Jetson Thor, a new robotics computer that provides 7.5x more AI processing power than previous generations, delivering 2,070 teraflops while integrating data from multiple sensors.  Agility Robotics and Boston Dynamics are integrating it into their robots, enhancing their ability to handle complex and real-time tasks.

Accredia Launches B2B2C SaaS PoC and Completes Certificate Migration: Paweł Huryn has launched Accredia, a no-code B2B2C SaaS Proof of Concept, migrating certificates for Product Discovery, Strategy, and Innovation video courses to the platform. The initial onboarding of two organizations has begun, with plans to develop a simple template for vibe-coding production-ready side projects using Supabase or Clerk.

Accredia Awards $4,500 in Security Challenge: Accredia conducted a public security challenge, offering $1,500 each to the first three individuals to successfully hack the platform. Three developers were rewarded for identifying an XSS vulnerability, CSP issues, and a theoretical attack vector using a Clerk token, enhancing the platform's security framework.

Databricks to Acquire Tecton for Real-Time AI Capabilities: Databricks is set to acquire Tecton, a feature-store company, for approximately $900 million, integrating Tecton's low-latency pipelines into its Lakehouse and Agent Bricks stack. This acquisition aims to accelerate the deployment of solutions in areas like fraud detection and recommendation systems, offering faster rollouts without needing additional MLOps vendors.

Apate AI Secures Seed Funding to Combat Scams with AI Bots: Apate AI, a startup based in Sydney, has raised $2.5 million in seed funding to deploy AI-powered voice, WhatsApp, and SMS bots for scam prevention. The solution is currently being piloted by major banks and telecommunications companies to engage scammers and free up human agents, while also contributing to fraud-rule training sets.

Upstage Raises $45M Series B to Expand Enterprise-Grade GenAI: Upstage has secured $45 million in Series B funding to globally scale its enterprise-grade generative AI solutions. The funding will enable Upstage to advance its AI models and expand its services, providing businesses with advanced AI tools.

Casca Raises $29M Series A for AI-Driven Lending Platform: Casca raised $29 million in a Series A round to support the replacement of traditional lending processes with its AI-powered underwriting platform. The funding aims to enhance the platform's capabilities and expand its reach in the lending market.
