Dynamics Lab Releases Mirage 2, a Playable World Model: Dynamics Lab has launched Mirage 2, an improved version of its generative world engine that turns images into playable game worlds. This AI tool allows users to transform static images into interactive environments, showcasing advancements in AI's representational complexity.

Fudan University Develops AnalogSeeker, an Open-Source LLM for Circuit Design: Fudan University researchers have created AnalogSeeker, an open-weight LLM designed to aid in analog circuit design, using Qwen2.5-32B-Instruct and fine-tuning it with data from analog circuit design textbooks. The model demonstrates competitive accuracy compared to mainstream LLMs, potentially speeding up the circuit design process for domain experts.

Google Releases Gemma 3, a Compact Language Model for On-Device AI: Google has introduced Gemma 3, a 270M parameter language model optimized for on-device performance and designed for fine-tuning in specific tasks. The compact model is intended for applications requiring low-latency responses and deployment on smaller devices like phones, offering developers a tool for efficient AI integration.

Meta Licenses Midjourney's AI Image and Video Generation Technology: Meta has partnered with Midjourney to license its AI image and video generation technology, aiming to integrate the technology into Meta's research and future products. This partnership aims to combine Meta's resources with Midjourney's AI capabilities to enhance the visual content generation within Meta's ecosystem.

Meta Taps PIMCO and Blue Owl for $29 Billion Financing: Meta secured $29 billion in financing from PIMCO and Blue Owl, signaling confidence from sober-minded infrastructure capital in the long-term revenue potential of Meta's massive data center build-out to support growing demand for AI applications and services.

OpenAI's GPT-5 Steers Tasks to Cheaper Models: OpenAI's upcoming GPT-5 will feature a router system designed to direct simpler tasks to more cost-effective AI models, optimizing computational efficiency and reducing operational expenses for users.

Google Reduces LLM Energy Consumption by a Factor of 33: Google has significantly improved the energy efficiency of its Large Language Models, reducing energy consumption by a factor of 33 within the past year; the average prompt in Gemini now consumes only 0.24Wh, demonstrating advancements in sustainable AI computation.

DeepSeek V3.1 Model Release: DeepSeek released V3.1, a new model featuring a hybrid inference design allowing it to operate in a direct-response mode for quick tasks or a deliberative mode when deeper reasoning is needed, offering flexibility and efficiency for developers.

Cohere Releases Command A Reasoning: Cohere launched Command A Reasoning, a model optimized for enterprise workflows, packaging reasoning, tool use, and multilingual competence with strong controls and predictable throughput, ensuring it respects production SLOs.

Anthropic Nearing $10B Funding Round: Anthropic is reportedly nearing a deal to raise up to $10 billion in a funding round, indicating strong investor confidence in the company's AI technology and future prospects.

Manus AI Projects $90M Annual Revenue Run Rate: Agentic platform Manus AI projects an annual revenue run rate of $90 million, providing insight into the scale of its business and growth in the AI agent market.

OpenAI to Open First India Office: OpenAI will open its first office in New Delhi, India, to build local partnerships and developer/education programs, expanding its presence in a key global market and fostering AI innovation.

FieldAI Raises $405M for 'Robot Brains': FieldAI raised $405M across multiple rounds to develop general-purpose embodied AI with a physics layer, building 'robot brains' for diverse robotics applications.

Microsoft Introduces =COPILOT() Function in Excel: Microsoft introduced the '=COPILOT()' function in Excel for Windows and Mac, allowing users to input natural language prompts directly into spreadsheets for AI-powered data analysis and manipulation.

OpenAI Appoints Fidji Simo as CEO of Applications, Sam Altman Focuses on Long-Term Projects: OpenAI has restructured its leadership, with Fidji Simo now heading ChatGPT and other consumer-facing applications. This move allows Sam Altman to concentrate on long-term initiatives such as GPU development, brain-computer interfaces, and consumer hardware, indicating a strategic shift within the company.

Meta Partners with Midjourney to Develop AI Image and Video Models: Meta is collaborating with Midjourney by licensing the startup’s AI image and video generation technology. This partnership aims to accelerate the development of new models for Meta's consumer and business tools, enhancing creative automation across platforms like ads, Reels, and Workplace.

Netflix Establishes Guidelines for Generative AI Usage by TV and Filmmakers: Netflix is permitting the use of generative AI by its TV and film partners, but requires them to adhere to specific guidelines. These rules are intended to ensure responsible and ethical application of AI in content creation, though specific details of the guidelines were not disclosed.

DHL Invests €637 Million to Deploy Over 1,000 Robots in UK Operations: DHL, a global logistics company, is significantly expanding its investment in warehouse automation by deploying over 1,000 additional robots in its UK operations. This initiative is part of a £550 million (€637 million) investment, signaling a major push towards robotics in logistics and supply chain management.

Alibaba's Qwen-Image-Edit Achieves Top-Tier Image Editing Performance: Alibaba's open-weight image editor, Qwen-Image-Edit, has achieved an ELO score of 1098 in the Image Editing Arena, positioning it on par with GPT-4o but at a lower cost. The community has demonstrated robust localized edits and style fidelity, with the Qwen3 model also running on Qualcomm NPUs in cars and robots.

DeepMind's Genie 3 and SIMA Enable Interactive World Simulation and Embodied Training: DeepMind has released Genie 3, an interactive world simulator that can be prompted with text, photos, or videos, featuring advanced spatial memory and real-time avatar control. DeepMind’s SIMA is also learning inside Genie-generated environments, creating a closed loop from world generation to embodied learning entirely in AI.

ByteDance Releases Seed-OSS-36B with 512K Context Window: ByteDance has launched Seed-OSS-36B-Base-woSyn, a 36B parameter base model boasting a 512K context window and trained on approximately 12T tokens. This release is generating excitement in the community as a clean base model for fine-tuning, although the absence of GGUF artifacts has sparked discussion regarding potential incompatibilities.

Apple to provide enterprise IT control over ChatGPT: Apple will provide enterprise configuration options that let IT administrators choose which ChatGPT model employees can use, set data retention windows, and disable data uploads. This configuration option will be available in the next macOS and iOS release, allowing businesses to whitelist ChatGPT on-device, reducing privacy risk.

Functionize Raises $41M to Expand Autonomous Software-Testing Agents: Functionize has secured $41 million in a Series B funding round to further develop and expand its autonomous software-testing agents. This investment aims to improve the capabilities and reach of its AI-powered testing solutions, allowing for more efficient and comprehensive software quality assurance.

Zed Raises $32M to Scale Collaborative AI Coding for Dev Teams: Zed has closed a $32 million Series B funding round to scale collaborative AI coding capabilities for development teams. The investment will facilitate further development of AI-assisted coding tools and enhance collaboration features within the Zed platform.

DeepSeek V3.1 Released with Agent Focus and Hybrid Reasoning: DeepSeek launched V3.1, a hybrid model featuring both 'thinking' and 'non-thinking' modes for autonomous workflows, including planning, tool use, and multi-step task execution. It boasts a 128K context window, strict JSON for tool reliability, and improved code automation performance, aiming to shift from chatbots to more versatile agents.

Anthropic Adds Claude Code Access to Enterprise and Team Plans: Anthropic allows Enterprise and Team plan administrators to assign standard or premium seats with access to Claude Code, enhancing coding capabilities within these plans. This provides organizations with more flexibility in managing access to specialized coding features for their teams.

Hugging Face Introduces Jupyter Agent 2 for In-Notebook Coding and Analysis: Hugging Face unveiled Jupyter Agent 2, enabling code execution and plot generation directly within Jupyter notebooks in real-time. This tool streamlines the coding and analysis workflow for data scientists and developers by providing immediate feedback and visualization capabilities.

ElevenLabs Debuts v3 (alpha) API for Expressive Text-to-Speech: ElevenLabs released its v3 (alpha) API, which includes a dialogue mode for creating lifelike, multi-speaker conversations with improved expressiveness. The new API offers fine-grained audio controls, emotion, pitch, and style, allowing developers to build multi-character conversations without workarounds.

NVIDIA Ships Open-Source Nemotron Nano 2 for Reasoning Tasks: NVIDIA introduced the open-source Nemotron Nano 2 (9B–12B), a hybrid Mamba-Transformer reasoning model that is reportedly 6x faster in reasoning tasks compared to similar-sized models. This small-footprint reasoning model aims to offer efficient performance for various applications.

GitHub Integrates Copilot Coding Agent with GitHub Mobile and VS Code: GitHub has expanded the functionality of its Copilot coding agent by integrating it with GitHub Mobile and VS Code.  The rollout includes Agents Panel, allowing users to launch Copilot coding tasks from any page, streamlining code creation and review workflows.

Dynamics Lab Releases 'Mirage 2,' an AI-Generated Video Game World: Dynamics Lab launched 'Mirage 2,' an AI-generated video game world allowing players to explore real-time environments within a browser.  Players can also modify their gaming experience through text prompts, such as changing the setting from a Wild West landscape to an urban environment.

Google Introduces Agentic Capabilities to Gemini in Search: Google is expanding its AI Mode in Search to over 180 territories and adding agentic capabilities that can plan and execute multi-step tasks, such as making restaurant reservations. AI Mode in Search is being deployed with personalised results, rolling out to many more countries globally.

Z.ai Launches Smartphone AI Agent with Alibaba Cloud: China's Z.ai, in partnership with Alibaba Cloud, has released a smartphone AI agent capable of handling various tasks, including booking hotels and ordering food. The agent, powered by GLM-Z1-Air and GLM-4-Air-0414, operates on Android and iOS devices, allowing users to automate complex workflows with natural language instructions.

Google Pixel 10 integrates AI directly with Tensor G5: Google's new Tensor G5 chip fully integrates Gemini Nano onto the devices, which improves speed and privacy for Pixel 10 users. The Pixel 10 includes Magic Cue and real-time language translation, and the camera has added a Camera Coach.

Alibaba's Qwen Team Releases Open-Source Image Editing Model: Alibaba's Qwen team launched Qwen-Image-Edit, a 20B parameter open-source image editing model. The model extends Qwen-Image’s capabilities to support both semantic and appearance editing, outperforming models like Seedream, GPT Image, and FLUX on public image editing benchmarks.

Google Adds URL Context to Gemini API: Google introduced URL Context to its Gemini API, which enables the extraction of content from webpages, PDFs, images, and structured files. This feature allows developers to provide URLs to the API, facilitating the analysis and processing of online content directly within their applications.

ElevenLabs Launches Music API for Commercial Use: ElevenLabs unveiled its Music API, which allows developers to integrate AI-generated music into various applications, such as games, advertisements, and personalized media. The API is trained on licensed data and is cleared for commercial use, providing a legal and scalable solution for AI-driven music creation.

OpenAI Debuts Affordable ChatGPT Subscription in India: OpenAI released ChatGPT Go in India, a more affordable subscription priced under $5 per month, to compete with offerings from Perplexity and Google. This move aims to expand access to OpenAI's services in the Indian market, focusing on users seeking budget-friendly AI solutions.

ByteDance Unveils Open-Source Multimodal Agent with Long-Term Memory: ByteDance released M3-Agent, an open-source multimodal agent framework that links text, faces, and voices into a unified long-term memory. This framework aims to improve the agent's ability to understand and respond to complex, multi-faceted interactions over extended periods.

ElevenLabs Launches Chat Mode for AI Agents: ElevenLabs expanded its platform with Chat Mode, enabling users to build text-only AI agents alongside existing voice systems. This new feature broadens the applications of ElevenLabs' technology beyond voice interactions, allowing for more diverse and versatile AI agent implementations.

Anthropic Bundles Claude Code for Enterprises: Anthropic now includes Claude Code in its enterprise plans, providing coding assistance to enterprise users within the existing Claude platform. This bundling offers businesses integrated coding help with admin controls, streamlining workflows and potentially consolidating coding tools.

Google Photos Introduces Voice and Text-Based Editing: Google Photos now allows users to make edits using voice or text commands, such as "brighten face" or "remove object", launching first on Pixel 10 devices in the U.S. This feature aims to simplify the photo editing process and make it more accessible to a wider range of users.

Field AI Raises $405M for Robot Brains: Field AI secured $405 million in funding to develop AI control systems for robots, targeting universal controllers that can integrate with existing machines. This funding round values the company at approximately $2 billion, focusing on automating tasks in sectors like data centers.

Google’s Pixel 10 Leans Heavily into On-Device AI: Google's Pixel 10 includes a range of on-device AI features powered by the Tensor G5 chip, with the cross-app assistant Magic Cue, an upgraded Gemini Live, and Gemini for Home replacing Assistant on Nest devices. The company also added Visual Overlays and real-time Voice Translate, improving user interaction and functionality across the Google ecosystem.

Databricks Valued at Over $100 Billion After Series K Funding: Databricks raised a Series K funding round, valuing the company at over $100 billion, positioning them among SpaceX and OpenAI. The funding will fuel development of its Data (Lakebase) and AI (Agent Bricks) offerings, enhancing its competitive stance against rivals like Snowflake and major cloud providers.

OpenAI Launches ChatGPT Go in India at Discounted Price: OpenAI launched ChatGPT Go in India for ₹399/month (approximately $4.55), offering users 10x higher message limits, image generations, and file uploads, along with 2x longer memory compared to the free version. The company plans to leverage the India rollout to inform future global expansion strategies for the product.

DeepSeek Releases V3.1 Base and Instruct Models: DeepSeek quietly released V3.1 Base and Instruct models, featuring 685B parameters and strong coding evaluations. The base model is available under the MIT license, and it also extended context/document length support to 128k tokens and maintains unchanged API endpoints for integration.

Meta Unveils DINOv3 Vision Foundation Model: Meta released DINOv3, a 7B-parameter vision foundation model trained on 1.7B unlabeled images, producing high-resolution image features. It is the first frozen vision backbone to outperform specialized models on multiple dense prediction tasks and is available with distilled smaller models (ViT-B, ViT-L) and ConvNeXt variants for flexible deployment.

Google Launches Gemma 3 270M, A Lightweight Open-Source Model: Google released Gemma 3 270M, an open-source fine-tuning model that can run on 0.5 GB RAM. Gemma 3 270M is delivering instruction-following and text structuring at a small scale which emphasizes deployability and specialization over brute‑force capability.

Higgsfield Launches Draw-to-Video Tool: Higgsfield launched a new freemium tool allowing users to sketch on images to generate custom, motion-based outputs. The tool provides a new approach eliminates prompts to let users customize their content, and free tier includes limited daily credits.

Google Releases Imagen 4 Fast and Adds Imagen 4 to Gemini API: Google released Imagen 4 Fast and made the entire Imagen 4 family generally available via the Gemini API and AI Studio. The models emphasize delivering high-quality image generation and editing capabilities, and provide flexible options.

Anthropic Adds Conversation-Ending Feature to Claude Opus 4 and 4.1: Anthropic added a conversation-ending feature to Claude Opus 4 and 4.1 to stop harmful, persistently abusive interactions. The feature aims to protect the model's integrity by automatically terminating abusive chats, allowing it to not be part of harmful situations.

ByteDance Releases UI-TARS-desktop for Computer Control via Prompts: ByteDance offers UI-TARS-desktop, a native GUI agent that helps you control your computer using natural language and vision‑language AI. The tool runs locally on Windows and macOS, understands screen elements via screenshots, triggers mouse and keyboard actions, and delivers real‑time feedback.

Adobe Launches Acrobat Studio with AI-Powered PDF Conversations: Adobe launched Acrobat Studio, combining Adobe Acrobat, Adobe Express, and AI agents into one workspace to facilitate conversations with PDFs, extract insights, and create content. It includes PDF Spaces to transform document dumps into smart assistants for summarizing, answering questions, and citing sources.

Gemma 3 270M Released for Edge and Embedded Use: Google's ultra-small language model, Gemma 3 270M, is now available and designed for edge and embedded applications. It is optimized for speed and efficiency on platforms like MLX and mobile devices, with demonstrations showcasing performance of approximately 140 tokens per second on an iPhone 16 Pro using MLX.

NVIDIA Releases Open Multilingual ASR Models Canary and Parakeet with Massive Dataset: NVIDIA has launched Canary 1B and Parakeet-TDT (0.6B), two open automatic speech recognition (ASR) models under a CC-BY license supporting 25 languages. These models offer auto language detection/translation, timestamping, and can process up to 3 hours of audio, trained on a "1 million hours" dataset.

NVIDIA Unveils Nemotron-Nano v2 with Hybrid SSM Architecture: NVIDIA introduced Nemotron-Nano v2, a 9B parameter hybrid SSM model, claiming a 6x speed improvement over similarly sized models. The release includes base and teacher variants, along with a large portion of the pretraining data, but license terms should be reviewed before production deployment.

Alibaba's Qwen-Image-Edit Adds Bilingual Text Editing and Semantic Transforms: Alibaba has launched Qwen-Image-Edit, built on the 20B Qwen-Image model, which features precise bilingual text editing capabilities in Chinese and English, alongside semantic transformations like object rotation and appearance-level edits. The model has been integrated into Anycoder and offers functionalities like adding, deleting, and inserting elements within images.

Tencent Hunyuan Releases Controllable Game-World Video Generator: Tencent Hunyuan has released an open, Genie-3-like video generator trained on over 1 million gameplay recordings, designed for controllable game-world video creation. This generator showcases long-term consistency and real-time control capabilities.

Ant Group's UI-Venus Automates UI Navigation with Reinforcement Learning: Ant Group developed UI-Venus, built on Qwen2.5-VL, an agent that utilizes reinforcement fine-tuning and Group Relative Policy Optimization to navigate UI screenshots with actions like clicks, scrolls, and typing. UI-Venus achieved a 95.3% score on ScreenSpot-V2 grounding and 61.9% on ScreenSpot-Pro.

Codeium's Windsurf Wave 12 Integrates DeepWiki and Devin DNA for Enhanced IDE Functionality: Codeium released Windsurf Wave 12, an IDE enhancement adding DeepWiki docs-on-hover, Vibe & Replace, a smarter Cascade Agent, and native Dev Containers support. This release features enhanced in-IDE reasoning and automation, resembling Devin's intelligence, with a video demo showcasing the features.

LlamaIndex and Bright Data Collaborate to Build Web-Scraping Agents: LlamaIndex and Bright Data have partnered to create robust web-scraping AI agents using LlamaIndex's framework and Bright Data's access layer, focusing on reliable web access and resilient workflows for dynamic content. The goal is to create intelligent agents that can navigate, extract, and manage site data end-to-end.

Prophet Arena Launched for AI Prediction Markets with Real Money Bets: University of Chicago launched Prophet Arena, a platform testing AI models in live prediction markets using real money bets on events like elections and sports. The AI models are fed news and market data, placing probabilistic bets, and are evaluated based on actual outcomes.

Microsoft Introduces Copilot AI Directly Into Excel: Microsoft launched Copilot directly into Excel, allowing users to perform generative tasks within spreadsheets by typing simple formulas. This new COPILOT function, available to beta users with a Microsoft 365 Copilot subscription, can summarize feedback, categorize data, and pull information from outside sources.

Lovable Reaches $100M ARR in 8 Months: Lovable, a Stockholm-based AI-driven app development platform, announced it has surpassed $100 million in ARR within 8 months, indicating rapid growth in the vibe-coding space. The platform empowers non-technical users to create full-stack web applications using natural language, generating frontend, backend, and databases from text prompts.

Lovable Raises $200 Million Funding Round, Becomes Unicorn: Lovable secured $200 million in a funding round led by Accel, valuing the company at $1.8 billion and achieving unicorn status. The Series A round attracted angel investors like Klarna CEO Sebastian Siemiatkowski and Slack co-founder Stewart Butterfield, highlighting the company's strong market position and growth potential in the no-code/vibe-coding sector.

OpenAI Releases 'Warmer' GPT-5 Personality: OpenAI has rolled out a friendlier version of GPT-5 after user feedback indicated the model felt too formal and lacked the personality of previous iterations like GPT-4o.  This update aims to make the model more engaging while maintaining its core functionality and reasoning capabilities, with tests showing no increase in sycophancy.

Meta to Launch 'Hypernova' Smart Glasses: Meta is preparing to release its 'Hypernova' smart glasses in September, featuring a small heads-up display built into one lens, with a price point around $800. The glasses will offer notification and app access, as well as integration with Meta's neural wristband for gesture control, positioning it as a more accessible alternative to high-end AR headsets like Apple's Vision Pro.

OpenAI Staff to Sell $6 Billion in Stock: Current and former employees of OpenAI are preparing to sell approximately $6 billion worth of shares to investors, including SoftBank and Thrive Capital, valuing the company at $500 billion.  The deal allows employees to capitalize on the company's rapid growth and increasing valuation, especially following the success of ChatGPT.

Anthropic's Claude Models Can Now Terminate Abusive Chats: Anthropic has implemented a new safety feature in Claude Opus 4 and 4.1 that allows the models to end conversations if they become abusive or harmful.  This system is designed to safeguard the AI from harmful interactions, marking a step towards AI 'wellness' by allowing the model to disengage from situations involving inappropriate or dangerous topics.

AI2 Receives $152 Million in Funding for Open AI Ecosystem: The Allen Institute for AI Research (AI2) has been awarded $75 million from the National Science Foundation and $77 million from NVIDIA to build an open AI ecosystem. This funding will support the development of open technologies, including language models and curated datasets, aimed at driving scientific discovery and advancing AI research.

Snap Develops On-Device Video Generation Model: Snap Inc. researchers have created a video generation model capable of running at 10FPS on an iPhone 16 Pro Max, indicating advancements in mobile AI capabilities. The model, with 0.9B parameters, utilizes a pruned Diffusion Transformer and finetuning to generate decent quality video on-device, paving the way for mobile 'instant imagination'.

The Great Refactor Aims to Secure Codebases with AI: The Institute for Progress is incubating The Great Refactor, a non-profit aiming to rewrite critical codebases into Rust using AI to improve cybersecurity.  The organization intends to secure 100 million lines of code by 2030, betting on AI's ability to augment or replace human experts in translating legacy code.

Google's 'Nano Banana' Image Generation Model: A new image generation model named 'Nano Banana' has appeared on Reddit's AI testing platform, speculated to be a Google project. The model generates highly realistic images, edits existing photos, and reconstructs entire scenes, outperforming existing models in tasks like sharpening blurry images and character consistency across comics or ads.

Apple Ramps Up AI Search Efforts with AKI Team: Apple has formed the "Answers, Knowledge and Information" (AKI) team, led by former Siri head Robby Walker, to develop an AI-powered answer engine similar to ChatGPT. This initiative aims to enhance search capabilities within Siri, Spotlight, and Safari and potentially lead to a standalone Answers app, marking Apple's move to catch up in the AI-driven search market.

Apple Prepares for Siri's Reinvention with Internal and External AI Models: Apple is undertaking a complete rebuild of Siri, exploring both in-house and third-party AI models. The 'Linwood' project focuses on a homegrown LLM, while 'Glenwood' is testing models like Anthropic's Claude, ChatGPT, and Google's Gemini. Apple aims to enable Siri to directly control apps using voice commands, similar to agentic AI, but faces challenges in reliability for critical applications.

Sam Altman Backs Merge Labs to Compete with Neuralink: Sam Altman, co-founder of OpenAI, is co-founding a new brain-computer interface company, Merge Labs, potentially valued at $850 million.  Merge Labs will rival Elon Musk's Neuralink, focusing on developing brain implants to assist individuals with paralysis in controlling devices. This venture signals Altman's ongoing interest in merging human capabilities with technology.

Nvidia Unveils Cosmos World Models for Robotics: Nvidia introduced Cosmos Reason and Cosmos Transfer-2, new models for robotics. Cosmos Reason, a 7-billion-parameter vision-language model, helps robots with planning and data curation by understanding memory and physics, while Cosmos Transfer-2 facilitates faster synthetic data generation. These models are complemented by updates to the Omniverse SDK, the RTX Pro Blackwell Server, and the DGX Cloud platform.

OpenAI Secures Gold Medal at International Olympiad in Informatics: OpenAI's AI model achieved a gold medal at the International Olympiad in Informatics (IOI), placing sixth out of 300 participants. The AI competed under the same constraints as human contestants, including a five-hour time limit, a 50-submission limit, and no internet access, relying only on a basic terminal tool, which demonstrates the advanced reasoning capabilities of OpenAI's AI.

xAI Releases Grok 4 for Free, Introduces AI Video Tool: xAI made its new AI model, Grok 4, freely available globally, providing two modes: Auto Mode for quick responses and Expert Mode for more detailed answers. The company also launched Grok Imagine, a free AI video tool in the US, which demonstrates xAI's efforts to compete directly with OpenAI while addressing the challenges of cost and responsible AI use.

Anthropic's Claude Sonnet 4 Expands Context Window to 1 Million Tokens: Anthropic updated Claude Sonnet 4 to support a 1 million token context window via the Anthropic API, significantly increasing its processing capacity. The new limit allows users to input and analyze substantially larger documents such as codebases and research papers, costing $6 per million input tokens and $22.50 per million output tokens for prompts exceeding 200k tokens.

Tesla Gains Permit for Ride-Hailing Service in Texas: Tesla secured a permit to operate a ride-hailing business across Texas, valid until August 2026. This permit enables Tesla to run a transportation network company without requiring human safety drivers, facilitating the potential launch of its autonomous 'robotaxi' service.

Figure Demonstrates Laundry Folding Capabilities: Figure released a video showcasing its humanoid robot, 02, folding laundry with human-like dexterity. The demonstration indicates advancements in robotic manipulation and AI learning, highlighting the robot's ability to adapt to delicate household tasks with only new training data.

Google's Gemma 3 270M: A Compact Model for Edge Devices: Google introduced Gemma 3 270M, a 270-million-parameter language model designed for edge devices and low-cost servers. This open-weights model prioritizes predictable instruction following, structured text generation, and low latency, making it suitable for specialized tasks and deployment in resource-constrained environments.

OpenAI's GPT-5 Released with Multiple Variants and Aggressive Pricing: OpenAI launched GPT-5 across ChatGPT, introducing multiple variants and aggressive pricing, positioning the model as smarter, faster, more useful, and accurate with reduced hallucinations; it offers GPT-5 and GPT-5-mini for free and Plus users, while Pro subscribers gain access to GPT-5-pro and GPT-5-thinking. API pricing starts at $1.25/1M input tokens and $10/1M output tokens for the standard version, undercutting competitors like Anthropic and Google.

Anthropic Offers Claude AI to US Government Branches for $1: Anthropic countered OpenAI's government initiatives by offering its Claude AI model to all three branches of the U.S. government for $1 for one year, including Claude for Enterprise and Claude for Government, emphasizing robust security standards and integration with existing secure infrastructure through AWS, Google Cloud, and Palantir; the company aims to provide technical support for agency integration.

Meta Releases DINOv3, a State-of-the-Art Computer Vision Model: Meta AI has released DINOv3, a self-supervised computer vision model trained on 1.7 billion unlabeled images with a 7B-parameter backbone that generates high-resolution frozen image features, matching or surpassing the performance of domain-specific systems on dense tasks; the model is designed to be adaptable across research and edge settings with lightweight adapters.

Cohere Secures $500M Funding, Valuing the Company at $5.5 Billion: Cohere, a Toronto-based provider of enterprise-focused AI models, raised $500 million in funding, increasing its valuation to $5.5 billion, with backing from AMD, Nvidia, and Salesforce to support workforce expansion and model training.  Cohere focuses on private deployments, data controls, and agent tooling for regulated industries, accelerating revenue through partnerships with banks, hardware vendors, and major tech companies.

Google's Gemini AI to Offer Personalized Experiences: Google's Gemini AI will automatically recall and use stored personal details and preferences from past conversations to personalize responses, improving user experience; this feature, enabled by default, can be disabled, while temporary chats and a renamed Keep Activity option allow users to manage data retention and training usage.

The Browser Company Launches $20 Monthly Subscription for its AI-Powered Browser: The Browser Company introduced a $20 per month subscription plan for its AI-powered browser, offering unlimited access to Dia’s AI chat and skills, alongside introducing usage limits for free users; this marks the company’s first paid product as it plans for multiple tiers amidst growing competition from other AI-enhanced browsers.

Meta Acquires AI Audio Startup WaveForms: Meta acquired AI audio startup WaveForms, which raised $40 million, as the company seeks to bolster its Superintelligence Labs; WaveForms aimed to close the 'Speech Turing Test' and develop 'Emotional General Intelligence', and two of its co-founders will join Meta.

Google Integrates AI into Flight Deals with Gemini 2.5 Model: Google introduced a beta tool leveraging a custom Gemini 2.5 model to parse natural language queries, surface, rank, and display real-time priced flight deals within Google Flights; this AI-driven feature aims to enhance the flight search experience and enable users to manage their query history.

LlamaIndex Expands Agent Arsenal with New Templates: LlamaIndex published new agent templates that includes an AI stock portfolio agent with CopilotKit AG-UI, web-scraping agents with Bright Data, and legal knowledge graphs via LlamaCloud + Neo4j, expanding its tool offerings for developers to build specialized AI agents.

Inference.net Releases ClipTagger-12B, an Open-Source Video Captioning Model: Inference.net released ClipTagger-12B, a fully open-source video captioning Vision-Language Model (VLM) based on the Gemma-12B architecture, achieving a judge eval of 3.53, outperforming Claude 4 Sonnet on video captioning at significantly lower costs; the model utilizes FP8 quantization for efficient single-GPU inference and outputs structured JSON per frame for scalable video data applications.

AI2 Receives $152M Investment for Open Model Development: The Allen Institute for AI (AI2) secured $75M from the NSF and $77M from NVIDIA to advance open-source AI models like OLMo and Molmo. This funding aims to scale open model ecosystems and foster reproducible AI for scientific advancements.

Cohere Raises $500M Funding Round, Appoints New Chief AI Officer: Cohere, an AI company focused on enterprise and government solutions, secured $500 million in a funding round. This investment will support the development of secure and sovereign AI capabilities, and Joelle Pineau, former lead of META FAIR, has been appointed as Chief AI Officer to lead this effort.

Google Releases Gemma 3 270M, a Compact On-Device LLM: Google launched Gemma 3 270M, a 270-million-parameter language model engineered for efficient on-device use with open weights. This model features INT4 QAT checkpoints and a large embedding table, enabling strong instruction-following capabilities even in resource-constrained environments, and is now shipping across stacks like KerasHub, MLX, and Ollama.

Google Introduces Imagen 4 Fast for Rapid Image Generation: Google made Imagen 4 generally available and also introduced Imagen 4 Fast, priced at approximately $0.02 per image. The "Fast" version aims to facilitate large-scale and interactive workflows by providing a more cost-effective option for image generation.

Meta Releases DINOv3 for High-Resolution Dense Vision Features: Meta unveiled DINOv3, a family of self-supervised vision foundation models capable of producing high-resolution dense features. These models outperform specialized systems on dense prediction tasks and include more than 12 ConvNeXT/ViT models, trained on varied data with a permissive license and are quickly being adopted as backbone drop-ins.

GPT-5 Demonstrates Improved Performance in Pokémon Red: OpenAI's GPT-5 completed Pokémon Red in 6,470 steps, significantly faster than its predecessor o3 which required 18,184 steps. This improved performance showcases advancements in planning and reasoning capabilities for large language model agents in gaming contexts, with fewer hallucinations.

MaxSun Launches Intel Arc Pro B60 Dual GPU for AI Workloads: MaxSun is releasing the Intel Arc Pro B60 Dual GPU, featuring 48GB of memory and priced at $1,200. This dual-GPU card requires a motherboard with PCIe slot bifurcation support and targets high-end workstations for AI and machine learning tasks.

Perplexity Launches Comet AI-Powered Browser: Perplexity introduced Comet, an AI-powered browser agent for secure and linked-tool workflows targeted for enterprise use. Comet can automate tasks like unsubscribing from emails and booking restaurant tables.

Anthropic Adds Learning Modes to Claude Code: Anthropic introduced new interactive output styles for Claude Code: explanatory (justifies architectural choices and outlines best practices) and learning (an interactive, turn-based pair programming mode). The 'Learning' style is now available app-wide enabling stepwise guidance across all chat sessions.

OpenAI Invests $14M in Endex for AI-Powered Excel Integration: OpenAI's Startup Fund invested $14 million in Endex, a startup integrating an AI agent directly into Microsoft Excel. Endex can automate complex financial workflows like building cash flow models and parsing SEC filings, aimed towards finance teams.

OpenAI Launches GPT-5 with Router System and New Features: OpenAI released GPT-5, featuring a family of systems including Mini, Nano, and Pro versions, along with a router that dynamically switches between them; however, the initial rollout faced glitches leading to the reinstatement of previous models for paid users. GPT-5 supports up to 272,000 token inputs, and 128,000 output tokens, offers developer options such as four reasoning levels and tool calling, and is priced variably depending on the version and token usage.

Perplexity Pursues Browser Acquisition Amidst AI Search Ambitions: Perplexity, an AI-driven search company, reportedly made an unsolicited offer to acquire Google Chrome for $34.5 billion, while simultaneously raising funds at a $20 billion valuation; this follows their broader strategy of hunting for browsers to integrate AI capabilities directly into the user experience.

Anthropic Enhances Claude with 1M Context Window and Model Pairing: Anthropic has expanded the context window for Claude Code's Sonnet 4 model to 1 million tokens on the API, enabling it to handle larger and more complex tasks. Additionally, the model now officially supports 'Opus plan, Sonnet execute' via a new /model feature in Claude Code, routing high-level planning to Opus 4.1 and task execution to Sonnet 4.

India Invests in Homegrown Multilingual AI Models: The Indian government is funding startups like Sarvam AI and Soket AI Labs to develop multilingual language models, and CoRover.ai built BharatGPT, India’s first government-funded multimodal model, with voice capabilities in 12 languages. This initiative aims to address the linguistic diversity of India and build models suited to the specific needs of the region, despite facing challenges in funding and data availability compared to the US and China.

Google Integrates Enhanced Memory Features in Gemini Advanced: Google is rolling out enhanced memory features to Gemini Advanced, allowing the AI to automatically remember past conversations and details without prompting, and providing support for temporary chats. These new features, including persistent session memory and user-defined privacy controls, aim to enhance the chatbot's personalization and utility while giving users more granular control over data persistence.

NVIDIA Unveils Cosmos Reason for Physical AI and Robotics: Nvidia introduced Cosmos Reason, a 7-billion-parameter vision language model designed for physical AI applications and robotics, as part of its new world AI models and infrastructure for robotics developers. The Omniverse libraries and Cosmos foundation models are designed to accelerate robotics solutions and allow developers to generate diverse data for training robots at scale using text, image, and video prompts.

AI2 Launches Open-Source MolmoAct for Structured Reasoning in Robotics: The Allen Institute for AI (AI2) launched MolmoAct, an open-source robotics model designed to bring structured reasoning to the physical world, allowing robots to understand language, plan in 3D, and act with control and transparency. MolmoAct, based on Ai2’s Molmo, is classified as an Action Reasoning Model (ARM) and is built to unlock safer and more adaptable embodied AI.

Canva's Magic Studio Simplifies AI Integration for Creative Tasks: Canva launched Magic Studio, integrating AI tools for streamlined creative workflows, including Magic Write for copywriting, translation across 100+ languages, and Magic Switch for instant slide redesigns. The platform aims to simplify AI utilization by providing intuitive tools that work the way users think, rather than requiring complex prompting or coding knowledge.

Igor Babuschkin Departs xAI to Launch AI Safety Venture: Igor Babuschkin, a technical co-founder of Elon Musk's xAI, exited the company to establish Babuschkin Ventures, a VC firm focused on investing in startups committed to making AI "safe and beneficial to humanity." This departure follows a period of PR challenges for xAI's Grok chatbot, including controversies surrounding political content, inappropriate image generation, and adult-oriented chatbot avatars.

New Study Reveals Limited Diversity and Prompt Sensitivity in Wan 2.2 T2V Model: An experiment using the Wan 2.2 T2V text-to-video model to generate images of women with different body types revealed limited diversity, especially among slimmer body types, indicating prompt sensitivity and model constraints in rendering visually distinct features for abstract body descriptors. The study found inconsistent output and an abrupt transition from 'average' to 'overweight' in the generated images, suggesting the model's latent representations do not adequately separate these phenotypes.

OpenAI Rolls Out GPT-5 with New Features and Adjusts Strategy: OpenAI released GPT-5 with enhanced reasoning for all users, including free tiers, and introduced Auto, Fast, and Thinking modes, with message limits, however, after initial negative feedback, GPT-4o was restored as the default model for paid users. The company also aims to double computing power within five months, improving limits for users and the API.

Perplexity AI Bids $34.5 Billion for Google Chrome: Perplexity AI has made an unsolicited offer to acquire Google's Chrome browser for $34.5 billion, exceeding Perplexity's valuation; the firm claims the offer aims to keep Chromium open source while bolstering AI-powered search integration. Perplexity plans to invest $3 billion in the project and keep Google as the default search engine.

Anthropic Expands Claude Sonnet 4's Context Window and Offers Access to the U.S. Government: Anthropic updated Claude Sonnet 4 to handle 1 million tokens, enabling processing of large codebases or documents, and expanded functionality of their tool for 3D reasoning with the addition of new learning tools. The company is providing Claude to all three branches of the U.S. government for $1 for one year in order to make inroads with government clientele.

Figure AI's Robot Helix Achieves Autonomous Laundry Folding: Figure AI introduced Helix, an AI model enabling its Figure 02 humanoid robot to perform complex tasks like folding laundry without teleoperation, using the same neural net as for warehouse tasks. The model combines vision, language, and control, demonstrating adaptability to handle unfamiliar objects and natural language commands.

Alibaba's Qwen Enhances Deep Research Capabilities: Alibaba's Qwen has announced upgrades to its Deep Research capabilities, providing smarter reports, deeper search functionality, multi-modal input support, and parallel tool execution, but offered limited specifics. The enhancements are aimed at improving the utility of their deep research model for enterprise use cases.

Nvidia Announces Revenue Sharing for China Chip Sales: Nvidia and AMD will pay the US government 15% of revenue from AI chip sales to China, according to the White House; this agreement accompanies newly granted export licenses for Nvidia’s H20 and AMD’s MI308 chips, designed for AI applications in the Chinese market.

Sam Altman Ventures into Brain-Computer Interfaces with Merge Labs: Sam Altman is reportedly co-founding Merge Labs, a brain-computer interface startup potentially valued at $850 million, taking on Neuralink, according to a report; the new company plans to develop AI-driven neural links.

CodeRabbit Offers Free Context-Aware AI Code Reviews within IDEs: CodeRabbit is offering free AI-powered code reviews directly within VS Code, Cursor, and Windsurf IDEs, giving developers line-by-line reviews and one-click fixes. The tool aims to speed up the code review process and improve code quality by integrating into existing Git workflows and toolchains.

Microsoft Courts Meta AI Talent with Multi-Million Dollar Offers: Microsoft is attempting to attract Meta's AI talent by offering multi-million-dollar compensation packages, matching Meta's own recent recruitment offers, according to internal documents; the approach is intended to improve Microsoft's access to AI expertise.

ElevenLabs Introduces AI Music Generation Capabilities: ElevenLabs, known for its speech synthesis technology, is expanding its services to include AI-generated music, enabling users to generate studio-quality songs from text prompts without studio time or singers; however, this feature might be subject to ElevenLabs' limitations and terms of service.

OpenAI's Reasoning System Achieves Top Ranking at International Olympiad in Informatics: OpenAI's reasoning system outperformed most human competitors at the International Olympiad in Informatics, achieving 6th place overall, and first among AI systems.  The system operated under the same constraints as human competitors, and used general-purpose models without task specific training, indicating an advancement in general reasoning abilities.

Meta's TRIBE Model Predicts Brain Activity from Movies: Meta AI's TRIBE model, a 1-billion-parameter neural network, can accurately predict human brain responses to movies by processing video, audio, and text.  TRIBE outperformed single-modality models by approximately 30% in predicting brain activity patterns and identifies activity across ~1,000 brain regions, representing a step toward better BCIs.

Vercel Launches v0.app with Agentic AI for Full App Development: Vercel's v0.app now features agentic AI, enabling it to plan, build, and deploy entire applications from a single prompt, including the front-end, back-end, copy, and logic, and allowing for iterative refinement.  Originally a developer tool, v0.app has seen increased adoption from non-developers for rapidly prototyping and deploying applications for various business use cases.

Anthropic's Claude Now Features Chat History Recall for Paid Subscribers: Anthropic has introduced a memory feature for Claude, allowing it to search and reference past conversations on demand, a functionality initially rolling out to Max, Team, and Enterprise subscribers. This new feature lets Claude incorporate prior chat history into new sessions, without additional user prompting, improving contextual continuity in multi-turn workflows.

Google Rolls Out 'Deep Think' to Gemini App for Ultra Subscribers: Google introduced 'Deep Think' to Gemini Ultra users, a reasoning model designed for complex tasks such as math, coding, and logic problems. The new model tests multiple ideas in parallel before providing the best possible answer.

xAI Makes Grok 4 Free Worldwide: xAI made Grok 4 freely available to all users worldwide, expanding access to its latest AI model that features 'Auto' and 'Expert' modes for varying levels of reasoning depth. This move increases competition in the chatbot market, particularly following OpenAI's GPT-5 release.

NVIDIA Unveils Cosmos Models for Smarter Robots and Enhanced Simulation in Omniverse: NVIDIA presented Cosmos Reason, a 7B-parameter vision-language model, and Cosmos Transfer-2, alongside new Omniverse libraries, to advance AI for robotics and 3D simulation. Cosmos Reason assists robots in understanding physics and planning actions, while Cosmos Transfer-2 simplifies the creation of training data from simulations.

Microsoft Integrates GitHub More Closely with CoreAI Strategy: GitHub's leadership will now report directly to Microsoft's CoreAI team, after the CEO steps down, further integrating GitHub with Microsoft's AI strategy. This alignment will involve tighter integration of AI-driven features within GitHub's services and accelerate new AI-powered tools for developers using the platform.

Superhuman AI Improves User Experience with Customizable ChatGPT Personas: The email management platform Superhuman AI released updated Voice mode functionality that allows users to choose from 4 personas like Cynic, Robot, Listener, or Nerd, to adjust tone and response length based on user instructions.

Unsloth Releases Free Colab Notebooks for Fine-Tuning GPT-OSS Models: Unsloth released a free Colab notebook to fine-tune GPT-OSS, including fixes for training and quantization. They claim the 20B model can be trained on 14GB VRAM and the 120B model on 65GB VRAM, enabling budget fine-tuning for larger SFT targets.

OpenAI Addresses GPT-5 Rollout Issues and Restores GPT-4o: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman acknowledged a problematic GPT-5 launch stemming from a faulty routing layer and has promised fixes and increased rate limits for Plus users.  Due to user demand, GPT-4o will return as an option for Plus subscribers, while the team works to make GPT-5 warmer and explore per-user customization; labels will be clearer showing which model is answering each query.

X to Integrate Advertisements into Grok Chatbot Responses: Elon Musk announced that X will begin testing advertisements within Grok chatbot responses, introducing a new advertising surface.  The company is actively experimenting with various ad formats, labeling strategies, and frequency caps, with a small group of advertisers participating in the initial trials; the performance will be measured by click-through rates and conversation-led conversions.

Nvidia and AMD to Share China Sales Revenue with the U.S. Government: Nvidia and AMD have reportedly reached an agreement to remit 15% of their revenues from AI chip sales in China to the U.S. government in return for export licenses.  This arrangement enables Nvidia to ship its H20 accelerators and AMD to sell its MI308 chips to Chinese customers under specific conditions; the U.S. government could receive approximately $1 billion per quarter if sales recover to previous levels.

Alibaba's Qwen3 Models Expand Context Window to 1 Million Tokens: Alibaba has extended the context window of its Qwen3 AI models to a substantial 1 million tokens, enabling them to analyze extensive texts of approximately 1,200-1,500 pages at once.  The company says that the open-source models are open-source and operate at three times the speed of previous versions, putting pressure on competitors with limited context windows.

xAI Makes Grok 4 Available for Free, Plans Ad Integration: xAI has made its Grok 4 model free to access worldwide with generous, temporary usage limits, with plans for ad integration to offset GPU costs. The next iteration will feature natively multimodal capabilities, processing audio and video bitstreams directly, while improving one-shot game generation through self-improvement loops.

OpenArt Launches One-Click Story Tool for AI Video Creation: OpenArt, an AI video startup founded by ex-Google engineers, released its 'One-Click Story' feature in open beta, that converts a sentence, script, or song into a one-minute video.  The tool offers Character Vlog, Music Video, and Explainer formats, with editing via storyboard mode and over 50 integrated AI models, aiming to lower creative barriers and tackle character consistency issues.

Google Finance Upgrades with AI-Driven Queries and Advanced Charting: Google is implementing an AI-driven upgrade to Google Finance in the U.S., integrating natural language Q&A and expanded coverage to include commodities and more cryptocurrencies.  The Google Finance redesign supports technical indicators like moving average envelopes and candlestick views, allowing for more granular trading insights.

Meta Acquires AI Audio Startup WaveForms: Meta has acquired WaveForms, an AI audio startup, to strengthen its AI unit, Superintelligence Labs.

AI Drug Discovery Companies in China Gain Traction with Big Pharma: Chinese AI-driven drug discovery firms have secured significant partnerships with major pharmaceutical companies, marking a notable advancement in the integration of AI within the pharmaceutical industry.

Horizon Fellowship Recruiting Experts with China Expertise: The Horizon Fellowship is actively seeking applicants with expertise in China's technology ecosystem, policy landscape, and strategic goals for its 2026 cohort; selected candidates will be placed in federal agencies, congressional offices, or committees to contribute to tech policy.

OpenAI Releases GPT-5 with Real-Time Router for Optimized Responses: OpenAI's GPT-5 features a real-time router that dynamically selects between a fast, efficient model for quick replies and a deeper reasoning system for complex problems, aiming to balance speed and accuracy. The model demonstrates improved capabilities in coding, health conversations (scoring 67% on HealthBench), and writing with enhanced literary depth, alongside a 45% reduction in factual errors compared to GPT-4o.

OpenAI Launches GPT-OSS Open Weight Models: OpenAI has released gpt-oss-120b and gpt-oss-20b, their first open-weight models since 2019, with 120B and 20B parameters respectively, intended for use cases such as on-device processing and rapid iteration without extensive infrastructure. These models use a Mixture-of-Experts architecture, balancing efficiency and quality, and were trained on a filtered dataset with safety in mind. They are available on platforms like Hugging Face and AWS.

Google DeepMind Unveils Genie 3 for Interactive World Generation: Google DeepMind released Genie 3, a world model that generates interactive 720p environments in real-time at 24fps from simple text prompts, allowing users to navigate dynamic worlds. Genie 3 remembers changes to a scene, maintains environmental coherence for several minutes, and allows modification of the virtual world through promptable world events. Currently a limited research preview, Genie 3 is a step toward richer environments for AI training and human creative exploration.

Anthropic Releases Claude Opus 4.1: Anthropic has launched Claude Opus 4.1, an updated version of their flagship model, with slight improvements over its predecessor, focusing on consistent performance and reliability. The model maintains a 200K token context window and is accessible to paid Claude users through Claude Code and APIs, with Anthropic hinting at a more substantial update in the near future.

Alibaba Introduces Qwen-Image Text-to-Image Model: Alibaba unveiled Qwen-Image, a text-to-image model and addition to the Qwen family, featuring capabilities such as accurate text rendering in multiple languages and image editing with style transfer and object manipulation. According to Alibaba's benchmarks, Qwen-Image matches or exceeds other top open and closed image generation models and is released under the Apache 2.0 license for download on Hugging Face and Modelscope.

ElevenLabs Expands into AI Music Generation with Eleven Music: ElevenLabs launched Eleven Music, an AI-powered music creation platform that allows users to generate studio-quality tracks from text prompts in any genre, with or without vocals, at 44.1kHz quality. The platform offers precision editing capabilities for transitions and song structure and provides commercial-ready output for various media, with an upcoming API for integration into apps and workflows.

OpenAI and HuggingFace Open Source Harmony for Structured LLM Responses: OpenAI and HuggingFace collaborated to release Harmony, a new structured format for LLM responses that helps to standardize prompt templates for complex, multi-role conversations and advanced tool usage. Harmony provides structured roles, channels, and dedicated token IDs to facilitate more reliable and easy to integrate agentic workflows.

Tesla Disbands Dojo Team, Shifts AI Strategy: Tesla is disbanding its Dojo team and ending its in-house supercomputer project for driverless vehicle technology.  The remaining staff are being reassigned within Tesla, which will now rely more on partners such as Nvidia and AMD for computing and Samsung for chip manufacturing.

Founderpath Leverages AI for Startup Investment and Growth: Founderpath uses AI to analyze startups, generate investment memos, and deploy capital within 24 hours, using Stripe data to evaluate companies against its portfolio. CEO Nathan Latka also released nine AI prompts used for growth tactics, including email list building and podcast launching, helping portfolio companies with distribution.

Cohere Announces North, its Next Generation Enterprise AI Platform: Cohere announced North, its next generation enterprise AI platform, designed for businesses to build and deploy AI solutions. The platform is intended to be a comprehensive suite of tools and services for enterprise-grade AI applications.

OpenAI Launches GPT-5 with Unified UX and Immediate Backlash: OpenAI launched GPT-5 as a unified experience, deprecating manual model selection in ChatGPT and pushing developers to stop building model choosers. However, power users reported degraded access to reasoning models, unpredictable routing, and steep drops in usage limits, leading to backlash. OpenAI acknowledged a broken autoswitcher and committed to fixes, including restoring GPT-4o as a selectable model and improving transparency.

Microsoft's Copilot Fully Migrates to GPT-5: Microsoft announced that 100% of Copilot users are now running on OpenAI's GPT-5, indicating a full integration of the new model into Microsoft's AI assistant. OpenAI reported a doubling of API traffic within 24 hours of GPT-5's launch, with a peak throughput of 2 billion tokens per minute.

OpenAI Releases GPT-OSS Models with MXFP4 Optimization: OpenAI released its first open-weight models since GPT-2, named gpt-oss-120b and gpt-oss-20b, using an Apache 2.0 open-source license. These models feature MXFP4 quantization, allowing the smaller 20B model to run on RTX 50-series GPUs with 16 GB of VRAM, and the larger 120B model on a single H100 GPU with 80 GB of RAM.

Qwen3 Models Now Support 1 Million Token Context Windows: Alibaba's Qwen3-30B-A3B-2507 and Qwen3-235B-A22B-2507 models now support up to 1 million tokens via Dual Chunk Attention (DCA) and MInference, with up to 3x speed improvements near 1 million tokens. Qwen also released Qwen Code CLI offering 2,000 free runs/day for vibe coding.

Cursor CLI Launches with GPT-5 Access and Enhanced Development Tooling: Cursor launched an early-beta CLI providing developers access to all models and enabling seamless transitions between shell and editor.  The CLI is expected to compete with Claude Code and allows for automation like batch commit messages and repo-wide edits.

LlamaIndex Announces Day-0 Support for GPT-5 with Agent Maze Challenge: LlamaIndex announced immediate support for GPT-5 via a pip install update and introduced the Agent Maze challenge, along with a scheduled workshop on real-time agents for Zoom voice via RTMS. A tools bug was also fixed in the new SDK using OpenaiResolve.

Unsloth Releases Free GPT-OSS Finetuning Colab and Fixes: Unsloth released a free gpt-oss finetune Colab and provided documentation for Unsloth fixes for gpt-oss, noting that the 20B model can train on 14GB VRAM and the 120B model can fit in 65GB. The company is also discussing dataset quality and format stabilization during full-layer finetunes.

OpenAI Cuts GPT-5 Prices: OpenAI has reduced the pricing for GPT-5, intending to challenge rivals on cost with stronger long-context answer quality and more reliable code generation. The rollout includes capacity limits and prepaid token blocks, with enterprise access expanding as new compute resources become available.

Meta Acquires Waveforms to Enhance AI Audio Capabilities: Meta acquired AI audio startup Waveforms to strengthen its work in voice, music, and sound generation. The acquisition is expected to improve content creation, moderation, and real-time audio features, with integration beginning immediately.

SoftBank Buys Ohio Factory for AI Data Center 'Stargate' Project: SoftBank acquired Foxconn’s Ohio factory with plans to transform it into a data center to support long-term training and inference needs for AI. The site will provide the power, cooling, and expansion capabilities required for the project.

OpenAI Launches GPT-5 with Unified System and Competitive Pricing: OpenAI released GPT-5, a unified system featuring a fast 'main' model and a deeper 'thinking' model, managed by a real-time router for efficient task handling. The API exposes different tiers (gpt-5, gpt-5-mini, gpt-5-nano) with varying pricing, targeting a broader range of use cases; prices start at $1.25 per million input tokens and $10 per million output tokens, with cheaper 'mini' and 'nano' options.

Microsoft Integrates GPT-5 into Copilot Suite: Microsoft is upgrading its Copilot suite across Word, Excel, and Teams to use GPT-5 as the default model, promising improved meeting summaries, more accurate data visualizations, and faster code suggestions in GitHub. The update will be available to paid M365 subscribers at no extra cost, aiming to enhance employee productivity with AI-driven features.

Cursor IDE Makes GPT-5 the Default Coding Model, Offering Free Access Initially: Cursor, an AI-powered code editor, has integrated GPT-5 as its default coding model, replacing Claude and providing initial free access to users. Citing the model as 'the smartest coding model' they've tried, Cursor aims to provide developers with enhanced coding assistance capabilities.

Anthropic Releases Claude Opus 4.1 with Enhanced Coding Performance: Anthropic launched Claude Opus 4.1, an improved version of Claude 4, which beats OpenAI's o3 with better coding performance, real-world coding, data analysis, and multi-file refactoring. While benchmark gains are minor, the real-world gains are a big step in coding capabilities, but comes at a higher price point.

xAI to Introduce Advertisements in Grok Responses: Elon Musk's xAI is planning to integrate advertisements into Grok's AI responses, aiming to monetize the platform and boost ad revenue. The company intends to use xAI's targeting technology and chatbot suggestions to deliver relevant ads to users seeking solutions to their problems.

ElevenLabs Rolls Out Full-Track Music Generation Tool: ElevenLabs announced Eleven Music, a tool enabling users to generate full-length songs with editable lyrics, 44.1 kHz audio, and multilingual vocals. The tool provides control over sound and lyrics, expanding ElevenLabs' offerings in AI-powered audio creation.

Meta Acquires WaveForms AI for Emotional Voice Synthesis: Meta has acquired WaveForms AI, a startup specializing in AI models that detect and synthesize emotional cues in speech, for an undisclosed amount. WaveForms AI team, backed by Andreessen Horowitz, will join Meta's Superintelligence Labs, to enhance Meta’s voice agents.

Noma Security Raises $100M to Build an AI Agent Security Platform: Noma Security raised $100 million to develop an AI-agent security platform, aiming to provide safety and security by design with real-time expert input, and test every scenario before going live for the enterprise. The startup will use the funding to refine its platform and expand its capabilities in AI-driven security.

ASAPP Releases Customer Service AI Agent with QA and Real-Time Monitoring: ASAPP launched a customer service AI agent offering real-time monitoring and QA, allowing for review and approval of agent responses and simulation of interactions. ASAPP provides safety and security by design, with real-time expert input.

DeepMind's Genie 3 Creates Interactive 3D Environments in Real-Time: DeepMind launched Genie 3, a foundation world model for real-time simulation and embodied agent training, that can create 3D environments with real-time interactivity. The model can generate navigable videos at 24 FPS and 720p.

OpenAI Launches Open-Weight AI Reasoning Models: OpenAI released gpt-oss-120b and gpt-oss-20b, two open-weight AI reasoning models available for free on Hugging Face under the Apache 2.0 license. Gpt-oss-120b operates on a single Nvidia GPU, while gpt-oss-20b is compatible with consumer laptops with 16GB of memory, enabling developers to connect them to more advanced closed models. However, training data won't be released due to copyright lawsuits.

Anthropic Releases Claude Opus 4.1 with Performance Upgrades: Anthropic unveiled Claude Opus 4.1, an enhanced version of its AI model with improvements in coding, reasoning, and agentic task performance, available to paid users through Claude Code, API access, Amazon Bedrock, and Google Cloud's Vertex AI. The company claims Opus 4.1 delivers top-tier coding performance, scoring 74.5% on SWE-bench Verified, a benchmark for real-world software engineering tasks, while maintaining the same pricing as Opus 4.

Google Introduces Gemini 2.5 Deep Think Reasoning Model: Google DeepMind introduced Gemini 2.5 Deep Think, its most sophisticated AI reasoning model that evaluates multiple ideas simultaneously. This multi-agent model, accessible to subscribers of Google’s $250-per-month Ultra plan in the Gemini app, has surpassed AI models from OpenAI, xAI, and Anthropic on LiveCodeBench 6 and achieved state-of-the-art results on Humanity’s Last Exam (HLE).

Google DeepMind's Genie 3 Generates Interactive 3D Environments in Real Time: Google DeepMind introduced Genie 3, an advanced AI world model that generates interactive 3D environments in real time with support for a few minutes of continuous interaction and memory of object placement. The model generates worlds at 720p and 24fps, and allows users to modify aspects of the world using prompts, however, Genie 3 is initially available as a limited research preview for academics and creators.

Uber Eats Adds AI to Enhance User Experience: Uber Eats is implementing AI to enhance menu descriptions, improve food photos, and summarize reviews, while also introducing features like user-uploaded images and a Live Order Chat to improve customer interaction and satisfaction. These AI-driven improvements aim to provide customers with more comprehensive and reliable information, leading to better decision-making and a more enjoyable ordering experience.

ElevenLabs Launches AI Music Generator with Commercial Licensing: ElevenLabs launched an AI music generator, claiming it is cleared for commercial use by partnering with Merlin Network and Kobalt Music Group to ensure the AI is trained on licensed material. This addresses concerns about copyright infringement, enabling users to create and monetize AI-generated music without legal issues.

Legal AI Startup Harvey Achieves $100 Million in ARR: Harvey, a legal AI startup providing an AI-powered platform for legal research and drafting, has achieved $100 million in annual recurring revenue. The platform, which has grown to over 500 customers including Comcast, has seen a significant increase in user engagement, reflecting its growing adoption among major corporations.

Google's AlphaEarth Foundations AI Model Tracks Climate Change: Google's new AI model, AlphaEarth Foundations, analyzes satellite data using machine learning to provide insights into environmental changes and resource distribution. The tool aims to assist governments and corporations in making informed decisions about land use and climate resilience, marking Google's continued expansion of AI applications into environmental monitoring.

Elon Musk's xAI to Open Source Grok 2: Elon Musk announced that xAI will open source Grok 2, though it is considered both larger and less performant than current state-of-the-art open-weight models. While specific details were not provided, comments indicate that later Grok versions achieve better reasoning via reinforcement learning (RL).

Meta's AI Spending Booms Amidst Strong Earnings: Meta reported strong earnings driven by increased AI spending and advancements in AI models, particularly for platforms like Facebook and Instagram. The company's capital expenditures are expected to benefit chipmakers like Advanced Micro Devices and Broadcom, signaling an ongoing investment in AI infrastructure.

OpenAI Releases GPT-OSS Models: OpenAI has released GPT-OSS-120B and GPT-OSS-20B, open-weight models available under the Apache 2.0 license, marking their first open-source release since GPT-2. The models are designed for high reasoning and tool use with strong safety standards, and the 20B parameter model can run on consumer hardware, while the 120B model requires a single GPU.

Anthropic Launches Claude Opus 4.1: Anthropic has launched Claude Opus 4.1, an incremental update to Claude Opus 4, featuring improvements in coding performance, specifically in multi-file refactoring and precise debugging within large codebases. Claude Opus 4.1 achieved a 74.5% score on the SWE-bench Verified benchmark and is available on OpenRouter.

Google DeepMind Unveils Genie 3 World Simulator: Google DeepMind announced Genie 3, a world model that generates interactive 3D environments from text prompts at 24fps in 720p, maintaining visual consistency for several minutes.  This model supports promptable world events, dynamic simulation of lighting and fluid dynamics, and enables scalable, persistent simulations for agent training.

ElevenLabs Launches AI Music Generator with Commercial Rights: ElevenLabs has launched Eleven Music, an AI music generator that produces full-length tracks with customizable vocals and instrumentation, supporting multiple genres and languages. Approved for wide commercial use, it allows users to fine-tune song structure, tempo, vocal delivery, and lyrical content, with API integration planned.

Clay Confirms Funding Round at $3.1B Valuation: Clay, a company offering a browser plugin that scrapes contact records daily and enriches Salesforce in real-time, has confirmed a $100M funding round at a $3.1B valuation.  The fresh capital will be used to fund deeper AI scoring that predicts deal size and churn risk.

OpenAI Models Land on AWS: GPT-4o and Embeddings are now available directly inside Amazon Bedrock, allowing customers to tap into the models without cross-cloud tunnels. Bedrock's governance layer keeps prompts, logs, and keys within existing AWS accounts, while billing is integrated into the AWS invoice.

Google Releases Storybook in Gemini: Google has launched "Storybook" in Gemini, a new feature that turns any topic into a custom illustrated storybook with narration.  The feature is currently available only on the desktop version of Gemini.

MetaStone AI Releases XBai o4: MetaStone AI has released XBai o4, its fourth-generation open-source model, which outperforms OpenAI-o3-mini in Medium mode. The model focuses on complex reasoning tasks and introduces a scalable, parallel test-time inference framework.

Shopify Adds Commerce Tools to AI Agents: Shopify's new commerce tools enable developers to add shopping and checkout functionality directly into AI agents and chatbots. This integration allows for the creation of AI-powered shopping experiences within conversational interfaces.

Youzu.ai Demonstrates Visual AI for E-Commerce: Youzu.ai demonstrated its visual AI infrastructure for e-commerce with a Room Visualizer feature, enabling users to upload a room photo and receive a complete redesign in seconds. The feature allows users to instantly shop every item in the redesigned room.

Alibaba's Qwen Team Releases Qwen-Image Model: The Alibaba Qwen team announced the release of Qwen-Image, a 20B parameter MMDiT model, under the Apache-2.0 license.  The model excels at text rendering in both English and Chinese and is also capable of various image editing tasks, rivalling GPT-4o in English text rendering and claiming best-in-class performance in Chinese.

Google's Gemini 2.5 Deep Think Ships to Ultra Subscribers: Google released Gemini 2.5 Deep Think to Ultra subscribers, touting SOTA performance across benchmarks.  Community testing indicates major uplifts compared to prior Gemini versions and near-parity with OpenAI’s o3 Pro on some tasks, such as AIME, HLE, and LiveCodeBench.

xAI Rolls Out Grok Imagine for AI Video and Image Generation: xAI has officially launched Grok Imagine, an AI image and video generator, in the Grok app.  This new feature allows users to create images from text prompts and generate short video clips from still images and includes a 'spicy mode' permitting NSFW content generation, setting it apart from competitors with stricter content policies.

Meta Acquires Stake in Scale AI and Offers Lucrative Deals to AI Researchers: Meta plans to reinvest into the AI race by offering top AI researchers more than $100M per year and acquired a 49% non-voting stake in Scale AI for $14B. Scale AI's CEO, Alexandr Wang, has been brought on board to lead Meta's Superintelligence AI Lab, structured to avoid antitrust scrutiny.

Huawei Releases Weights for Pangu Ultra 718B Model: Huawei has released the weights for Pangu Ultra, a 718B parameter Mixture-of-Experts model.  This model is notable for being trained entirely on Huawei Ascend NPUs, marking a fully Chinese-developed large model stack independent of Nvidia hardware, and the model is distributed under a custom license requiring attribution.

Tencent Releases Hunyuan-Instruct Series of Open-Source Language Models: Tencent has released the Hunyuan-Instruct series of open-source language models with parameter sizes ranging from 0.5B to 7B.  These models support pre-trained and instruct-tuned variants, as well as the GGUF format, feature a native 256K context window, Grouped Query Attention, advanced quantization, and strong agent performance.

Character.AI Launches AI-Powered Social Feed: Character.AI has launched Feed, an AI-native social feed transforming the app from a chat tool into a full AI-powered entertainment platform. Feed brings Characters, Scenes, Streams, and creator-driven videos into one scrollable hub, where every post is interactive and remixable, blurring the line between viewer and creator.

OpenAI Releases GPT-OSS Open-Weight Models: OpenAI has released gpt-oss-120b and gpt-oss-20b, providing free model weights and code, for the first time since GPT-2, with an Apache 2.0 open-source software license. The gpt-oss-120b model has 117 billion parameters, runs on a single H100 GPU (80GB) and reaches near-parity with OpenAI o4 mini on core reasoning benchmarks.

Hugging Face Releases Ultra-Scale Playbook: Hugging Face released its Ultra-Scale Playbook, a 200+ page guide detailing 4,000+ scaling experiments, covering 5D parallelism, ZeRO, FlashAttn, overlap, and bottlenecks. It is available for free to Hugging Face Pro subscribers.

Scale AI Lands Atop the Leaderboards With $14 Billion Investment From Meta: Scale AI secured a $14B investment from Meta in exchange for a 49% stake of the company's stock and having Scale AI's CEO, Alexandr Wang, come on board to lead Meta's Superintelligence AI Lab. The investment was structured in order to avoid antitrust scrutiny.

VERSES AI's Genius Outperforms OpenAI and DeepSeek in Code-Breaking Challenge: VERSES AI's Genius model demonstrated superior performance in a code-breaking challenge, proving to be 140 times faster and over 5,260 times cheaper than OpenAI’s o1-preview.  Against DeepSeek R1, Genius achieved a 100% success rate compared to DeepSeek’s 45%, while also being nearly 300 times faster and 800 times more cost-effective, showcasing its potential in complex reasoning tasks.

VERSES AI's AXIOM Model Enables Interactive Reasoning and Generalization in Games: VERSES AI's AXIOM model, built on the Free Energy Principle and Active Inference, can perform interactive reasoning and generalization across multiple games, surpassing state-of-the-art deep RL models. AXIOM uses a modular architecture with components like sMM, iMM, tMM, and rMM to perceive, identify, predict, and infer causal relationships, using only a fraction of the data, compute, and parameters needed by deep learning systems.

Meta Releases Meta CLIP 2, a Multilingual AI Model for Text and Image Understanding: Meta has launched Meta CLIP 2, a scaled-up multilingual version of OpenAI's CLIP model, capable of reasoning about text and images in hundreds of languages. Trained on 29 billion image-text pairs, Meta CLIP 2 outperforms its English-only counterpart on zero-shot image classification and multilingual benchmarks, offering a more representative understanding of the world for AI systems.

Column Tax's Benchmark Reveals LLMs Struggle with Tax Return Calculations: AI startup Column Tax has developed TaxCalcBench, a benchmark to evaluate AI models' ability to complete tax returns, revealing significant challenges for current LLMs. Models like Gemini 2.5 Pro and Claude Opus 4 scored below 33% on the benchmark due to incorrect tax table usage, calculation errors, and eligibility determination, highlighting the need for more robust AI before it can replace human accountants.

TII Abu Dhabi Releases Falcon-H1, a Hybrid Transformer-Mamba Language Model Family: The Technology Innovation Institute (TII) in Abu Dhabi has introduced Falcon-H1, an open-weight family of large language models with a hybrid architecture combining standard transformers with state-space model components.  Falcon-H1 models, available in six variants ranging from 0.5B to 34B parameters, exhibit efficient performance and set new state-of-the-art scores at the low end, trained on a cluster of 4,096 H100 GPUs.

Google Releases Deep Think Math Model for Gemini App Subscribers: Google has launched Deep Think, a variant of its Gemini 2.5 model, for Google AI Ultra subscribers, providing a Bronze-level reasoning capability for complex problems. Deep Think uses 'parallel thinking techniques' to explore multiple solution paths, aiding in coding challenges, web development, scientific research, and creative problem-solving, though at a cost of $250/month and a limited number of prompts per day.

Guidde Offers AI-Powered Video Tutorial Creation: Guidde is offering a platform to transform static training materials into engaging video guides using AI. The service simplifies the creation, updating, and localization of tutorials, featuring a free browser extension to empower teams with interactive learning experiences.
